Subject: 5 million-dollar lessons I learned as a ghostwriter
Body Text:
Ghostwriting changed my life.

When I quit my job at the age of 26 to go all in on ‚Äúfreelance
writing‚Äù I had no idea I‚Äôd end up in the lucrative (and
transformational) world of ghostwriting.

Since then, ghostwriting has helped me:

* Successfully quit my 9-5 job and build a multibillion-dollar
network for myself.
‚Äã
* Move out of a rathole studio apartment, buy my first car, and
disavow my former life as the clich√© ‚Äúpoor and struggling
writer.‚Äù
‚Äã
* Master the craft of writing and improve my skills in ways I‚Äôm
not sure I could have achieved had I not spent thousands of hours
practicing with other people‚Äôs voices.

But one of the most important takeaways I‚Äôve had from
ghostwriting are what I‚Äôve learned about myself and other people.

I have ghostwritten for hundreds of startup founders, executives,
and senior leaders at publicly traded companies all over the
world. I have also ghostwritten for Silicon Valley venture
capitalists, private equity firms, international speakers, New
York Times best-selling authors, and even Grammy-winning
musicians, Olympic athletes, and Bitcoin billionaires.

And through all of that, I‚Äôve learned some very important life
lessons.

Let‚Äôs dive in!

*************************************************
Lesson #1: 99% of people just want to feel heard.
*************************************************

Here‚Äôs a brutal life truth:

Most people don‚Äôt listen.

When you‚Äôre talking, the other person isn‚Äôt really hearing you.
What they‚Äôre hearing is their own thoughts interpreting what
you‚Äôre saying and trying to decide what they should say as soon
as your mouth stops moving. And some people don‚Äôt even wait for a
break in the conversation‚Äîthey just bulldoze right over you,
their inner monologue too loud for them to bear.

But this doesn‚Äôt work when you‚Äôre a ghostwriter. You have to
really listen to people to draw out their best insights and
stories. And this is done by becoming a ‚ÄúClose Listener.‚Äù

‚ÄúClose Listening‚Äù is an almost meditative practice‚Äîyou are
completely tuned-in to the other person:

* What they‚Äôre saying
* How they‚Äôre saying it
* But most importantly, what they‚Äôre not saying

Talking to a ‚ÄúClose Listener‚Äù is special.

You feel seen. You feel safe. You feel like they actually
care‚Äîand because you feel like they‚Äôre ‚Äúlistening,‚Äù you are far
more willing to divulge information you probably wouldn‚Äôt feel
comfortable sharing with most other people.

Being a ‚ÄúClose Listener‚Äù for people in your life is a gift. It
brings depth to your relationships. It opens spontaneous doors of
opportunity. And makes it easier to make friends.

At the end of the day, 99% of people just want to feel seen and
heard‚Äîand ‚ÄúClose Listening‚Äù is the cheat code ghostwriting gives
you to do it.

*********************************************************
Lesson #2: ‚ÄúSuccess‚Äù doesn‚Äôt make the journey any easier.
*********************************************************

When I ran my agency, I had the opportunity to ghostwrite for a
Grammy-winning producer).

He flew me out to his home for a work weekend. It owned a massive
ranch with a multimillion-dollar home music studio. He had every
keyboard money could buy.

Nicolas Cole üö¢-->

@Nicolascole77

That time I got hired as a ghostwriter for a music-tech project
founded by a Grammy-winning producer.

Went to his cabin in the mountains to work, and ended up playing
piano in his multimillion-dollar studio.

(I'm a classically trained pianist & played for 20+ years.) (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/mvurp33xnru5hgx2vvvtmhrqv52qqf3/9qhzhdupol6v48uz/aHR0cHM6Ly94LmNvbS9OaWNvbGFzY29sZTc3L3N0YXR1cy8xNzY4NTkzMzUyNjU4Njk4Mjgw
)

4:1 AM ‚Ä¢ Mar 15, 2024

0
Retweets
112
Likes

Read 29 replies (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/mvurp33xnru5hgx2vvvtmhrqv52qqf3/9qhzhdupol6v48uz/aHR0cHM6Ly94LmNvbS9OaWNvbGFzY29sZTc3L3N0YXR1cy8xNzY4NTkzMzUyNjU4Njk4Mjgw
)
‚Äã
In awe, I said, ‚ÄúYour creative process must be so different
today. You have so many options!‚Äù

He shook his head and said, ‚ÄúActually, it‚Äôs killing me.‚Äù

To make his next album, he was going to rent a studio apartment
in the city.

We all think the journey somehow gets easier once we‚Äôve achieved
our dreams, or made a certain amount of money. From my own
experience, and what I‚Äôve learned ghostwriting for so many
successful people, it‚Äôs actually the opposite.

The journey and creative process gets harder.

So, enjoy wherever it is you are today.

*****************************************************************
Lesson #3: Mastering ‚ÄúSales‚Äù is how you build stronger
relationships.
*****************************************************************

Sales isn‚Äôt about using sleazy sales tactics.

Sales is about helping people and educating them on an outcome
they want‚Äîall for free.

Over the years, I‚Äôve taken so many sales calls where I realized,
halfway through, the client was never going to hire me or simply
didn‚Äôt have the means. But instead of seeing it as a waste of
time, I used these as opportunities to create good will and
continue practicing thinking on my feet and helping people solve
problems in their business, for free.

I‚Äôve walked out of my office and told my fianc√© (now my wife),
Alyssa, about so many of these calls that one day she even gave
it a name:

‚ÄúThe Cole Gives Back Program.‚Äù

I love that.

Nicolas Cole üö¢-->

@Nicolascole77

‚ÄúSales‚Äù isn't about being a money-grabbing sleazeball.

Sales is Education.

‚Ä¢ Educating your client on a problem
‚Ä¢ Showing them why they need to solve it
‚Ä¢ Positioning your service as the solution

Sales is making friends at scale‚Äîand I wish more ghostwriters
knew this. (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/mvurp33xnru5hgx2vvvtmhrqv52qqf3/48hvh7ur4npdv5tq/aHR0cHM6Ly94LmNvbS9OaWNvbGFzY29sZTc3L3N0YXR1cy8xNzczODQ3OTA1NjQ1ODM0Mzgy
)
4:1 PM ‚Ä¢ Mar 29, 2024

14
Retweets
126
Likes

Read 26 replies (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/mvurp33xnru5hgx2vvvtmhrqv52qqf3/48hvh7ur4npdv5tq/aHR0cHM6Ly94LmNvbS9OaWNvbGFzY29sZTc3L3N0YXR1cy8xNzczODQ3OTA1NjQ1ODM0Mzgy
)
‚Äã
Even today, before every single sales call, I remind myself:

* Best-case scenario, they hire me.
‚Äã
* Worst-case scenario, I help someone, and continue building The
Cole Gives Back Program.

And guess what? When you give, and give, and give away so much
knowledge for free, people can‚Äôt help but find ways to pay you
back.

This doesn‚Äôt just apply to business. It applies to all areas of
your life‚Äîand especially your relationships.

If you give people more of what they want, if you help them out,
they‚Äôre more likely to return the favor to you in the future.

So always be ‚Äúselling‚Äù by sharing everything you know for free.

******************************************
Lesson #4: Status matters more than money.
******************************************

I had one client who was determined to become a New York Times
best-selling author.

He pulled out all the stops to sell more books to hit the list:

* He did around 100 podcasts.
‚Äã
* He did tons of guest posts for major publications which his PR
company set up for him.
‚Äã
* And he called in every possible favor from his network‚Äîfrom
connections he built over the last 5 to 8 years running an events
company.

I even spent $6,000 buying 300 copies of his books in return for
being put in contact with the CMO of one of the largest tech
companies in the world (which ended up being one of largest
clients ever, so win for me!).

When his book was published it became a New York Times
best-seller. He got the badge.

But a week later, the book completely fell off the charts. And it
never climbed back up. He‚Äôd used his entire book advance on
marketing for the book.

The book made him zero money. In fact, he‚Äôd be lucky if he broke
even:

* He spent tons of money getting his team members and personal
assistants to promote his book.
‚Äã
* He called in every favor possible (and had to return all those
promises he made, costing him money).
‚Äã
* And he paid people like me to promote the book for him through
our work together.

Getting the New York Times badge probably cost him $250,000+.

The lesson?

Some people will go to incredible lengths to earn a status
symbol, and spend tons of money and burn through all the good
will they‚Äôve built up over the years, just to feel like they‚Äôve
‚Äúmade it.‚Äù

********************************************************
Lesson #5: Everything takes twice as long as you expect.
********************************************************

I don‚Äôt think I‚Äôm the most ‚Äútalented‚Äù writer.

I just think I‚Äôm willing to tolerate boring work more than the
average person. If other writers endured the boring work as much
as I did, they would see similar results. It‚Äôs not rocket
science. It‚Äôs just hours.

But this ‚Äúboring‚Äù work is why so many people give up on the goals
they‚Äôre pursuing. They set an arbitrary goal (‚ÄùI must land my
first $5k client in the first month‚Äù or ‚ÄúI will publish my book
this year‚Äù) and when they don‚Äôt succeed, they just give up.

When they do this, they stop the compounding‚Äîand kill all the
benefits of it.

Because a lot of boring work goes into:

* Becoming proficient at a skill
* Promoting yourself and your services
* Building long-term relationships with people

So it makes me sad when I see people give up on a goal they‚Äôre
pursuing.

Nicolas Cole üö¢-->

@Nicolascole77

I often notice how many aspiring ghostwriters give up after one
or two months. This is painfully short-sighted. So many of my
"failed" sales calls came back to me 2, 6, or even 12 months
later. So don't give up, keep going, and let the compounding kick
in. (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/mvurp33xnru5hgx2vvvtmhrqv52qqf3/reh8h9u0ge3l47s6/aHR0cHM6Ly94LmNvbS9OaWNvbGFzY29sZTc3L3N0YXR1cy8xODM5MDA5NjcwODM0MzY4NTk5
)
11:30 AM ‚Ä¢ Sep 25, 2024

3
Retweets
102
Likes

Read 35 replies (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/mvurp33xnru5hgx2vvvtmhrqv52qqf3/reh8h9u0ge3l47s6/aHR0cHM6Ly94LmNvbS9OaWNvbGFzY29sZTc3L3N0YXR1cy8xODM5MDA5NjcwODM0MzY4NTk5
)
‚Äã
I experienced this at my ghostwriting agency.

The goodwill I built with my ‚ÄúFree Consulting‚Äù approach to sales,
meant that not only new clients came through the door, but old
ones decided to come back, and failed sales calls from ‚Äúway back
when‚Äù all of a sudden show up in my inbox, ready to buy.

The compounding is very, very real.

* Some of my earliest ghostwriting clients were startup founders
who are now worth hundreds of millions of dollars. (Not bad
people to have in my network!)
‚Äã
* And some of our longest-standing clients I now consider friends
and even mentors. (People I can call anytime for advice.)

Sage wisdom in Silicon Valley, and something I hear repeated
often by the founders and investors in that world, is the Naval
Ravikant quote:

‚ÄúPlay long-term games with long-term people.‚Äù

That‚Äôs the goal. You‚Äôre playing a long-term game. You are getting
yourself in the game, and you are building relationships with
people you end up working with (or ‚Äúnear‚Äù) for a very, very long
time.

That‚Äôs it!

Cole

Co-Founder, Premium Ghostwriting Academy

PS‚Ä¶ Want to kickstart your ghostwriting journey (and get paid to
learn valuable life lessons)?

burning questions. (

Subject: Get your copy written in under 10 minutes‚Ä¶
Body Text:
Without hiring a copywriter or becoming a copy pro Did you catch the webclass
where we talked all about how to get your copy written in as little as 10
minutes?! 
Don‚Äôt worry if not‚Ä¶ you still have time to check it out!Catch The Replay NOW >>

written in as little as 10 minutes‚Ä¶

Now, I know what you might be thinking‚Ä¶ 
‚ÄúThat doesn‚Äôt even sound possible...‚Äù
We hear that a LOT about Funnel Scripts.
After all, saying you can get ALL of your sales letters, scripts, webinar
slides, emails, and ads written in as little as 10 minutes WITHOUT hiring an
expensive copywriter is a BIG claim‚Ä¶
We‚Äôre prepared to back it up, but we also know the value of social proof‚Ä¶
So a few weeks before our LIVE webinar, we asked current Funnel Scripts users
what they thought about the software...
It wasn‚Äôt long until the thread was full of comments like this‚Ä¶
[https://funnelscripts.com/hosted/images/db/6bd66d7fc948e881fc52b1090eebf4/comment-1.png]
[https://funnelscripts.com/hosted/images/cd/eae5ff05d24336b9c0ac71e12b15ab/comment-2.png]
Obviously, it makes me SO excited that people are enjoying the software Jim
Edwards and I created, but I‚Äôm excited for another reason too‚Ä¶ 
I vividly remember when there were only two options to get good copy‚Ä¶
1. Hire an expensive copywriter2. Study copy and become a copy pro yourself 
I KNOW so many of you have a message that you‚Äôre dying to get out to the world,
and neither of those options are great‚Ä¶ especially when you don‚Äôt have a big
budget or really don‚Äôt like writing.
That‚Äôs something Jim and I talked a LOT about in the webclass‚Ä¶
(In fact, he reflected on the time he spent $1,500 on just 6 emails and his wife
told him never to do that again, ha ha! And I can‚Äôt tell you how many times I
spent upwards of 10k on a sales letter‚Ä¶ only to NEVER be able to use it.)
But we didn‚Äôt just talk about it--we solved it.
We showed everyone EXACTLY how Funnel Scripts works and how anyone can use it in
their business to IMMEDIATELY increase their sales and keep their funnel moving
forward.

Subject: want ME to write YOUR copy?
Body Text:
Is it just me, or is the HARDEST part of creating an awesome funnel... THE
COPY?! 
Yeah, I‚Äôm talking about the headlines, sales letters/videos, upsells, etc...
In the past, professional copywriters have charged me upwards of $15k or more
just for ONE sales letter‚Ä¶
The last time I wrote copy for someone, they had to pay me upfront AND give me
equity in their company.
So unless you're willing to pay the crazy high fees (and often even give up
equity in your company) it can be REALLY hard and expensive to get good copy
done for your funnels.
Well... that is until NOW...
You recently saw the TOTALLY revamped software program that Jim Edwards and I
created that will actually write professional, proven copy for you!

Funnel Scripts is the next best thing to having ME actually sitting in your

Subject: üóìÔ∏è Time is running out: AWS re:Invent hotel blocks closing
Body Text:
Discounted hotel rates ending soon!

You don't want to miss AWS re:Invent 2024 in Las Vegas. Your conference pass gives you access to thousands of sessions, keynotes with AWS leaders, and numerous opportunities to connect with the global cloud community.

Accommodations are filling up fast, register now to secure the best hotel rates by this Friday, Nov. 8, and while supplies last.

Register now
https://reinvent.awsevents.com/?trk=9621286d-a867-4ddb-a211-b59eefe8cdfc&sc_channel=em

----------
Group ticket offers
Join re:Invent with your team and explore incentives like conference pass discounts, Delta flight vouchers for international customers, and more.

Learn more 
https://reinvent.awsevents.com/group-ticket-offers/?trk=9621286d-a867-4ddb-a211-b59eefe8cdfc&sc_channel=em

-----------
Flight discounts
Registered attendees are eligible for discounts up to 10% off the price of the airfare, provided by AWS re:Invent's preferred airline, Delta. Terms and conditions apply.

Learn more
https://reinvent.awsevents.com/experience/plan-your-trip/?trk=9621286d-a867-4ddb-a211-b59eefe8cdfc&sc_channel=em#eventdescription-96c01f805e

-----------
AWS Certification discount
All registrants attending re:Invent in person will receive a 50% discount on any AWS Certification exam. Vouchers can be used for an online-proctored or test center‚Äìbased exam.

Learn more
https://reinvent.awsevents.com/aws-certified/?trk=9621286d-a867-4ddb-a211-b59eefe8cdfc&sc_channel=em

-----------
Getting your trip approved
Need help convincing your manager to let you attend AWS re:Invent 2024? Build a business case to present the value of attending re:Invent to your organization.

Learn more
https://reinvent.awsevents.com/experience/justify-your-trip/?trk=9621286d-a867-4ddb-a211-b59eefe8cdfc&sc_channel=em

----------

Subject: 4 Years Ago This Week‚Ä¶
Body Text:
one decision that changes everything

Hey Candace,

I‚Äôve been settling into my new surroundings in Hong Kong and spent this week setting up my studio in the apartment.

What do you think?

I love building a new filming set up whenever I arrive in a new place (partly because it just gives me an excuse to buy more stuff from Ikea üòÖ) but it always feels like it gives the videos and the channel a bit of a spring clean too.

Anyway, the other thing I‚Äôve been celebrating this week is the 4 year anniversary of the Part-Time YouTuber Academy, or should I say the 4 year anniversary of the inception of the course.

It was Monday 19th October 2020 when I first sat down with Angus, my General Manager, to think about creating a course around YouTube and 3 weeks later, we‚Äôd launched the first cohort.

Yes, I‚Äôve never been one to act slowly (as my team know üòÖ) and this was a classic case of bias to action to get the product into the world and, more importantly, get feedback from actual customers.

I thought maybe a couple of dozen people would sign up and we‚Äôd work with them to improve the initial product but cohort 1 had over 350 students from across the world which was genuinely mental and it was such an incredible four weeks that we decided to continue.

4 years on, more than 6,000 students have gone through the course which is incredible and honestly, it‚Äôs been so rewarding to see so many people see their lives change from publishing videos on YouTube.

Whether it‚Äôs a growth in subscribers, an uptick in leads to a business, getting job opportunities or simply gaining confidence on camera, it‚Äôs been such a rewarding thing to do.

(I‚Äôve also realised in writing this email that I‚Äôve now hired 6 team members over the past 4 years who went through PTYA before joining the business üòÖ)

And we‚Äôve had numerous success stories throughout the four years including:

  • Elizabeth Filips (2020) 224 ‚Üí 989,000 subscribers
  • Ankur Warikoo (2020) 36,000 ‚Üí 5.9M subscribers
  • School of Scent (2020) 0 ‚Üí 260,000 subscribers
  • Izzy Sealey (2021) 0 ‚Üí 657,000 subscribers
  • Pete Matheson (2021) 15,400 ‚Üí 201,000 subscribers
  • John Coogan (2021) 1070 ‚Üí 450,000 subscribers
  • Ellie-Jean Royden (2021) 851 ‚Üí 355,000 subscribers
  • Jonathan Elvidge (2021) 9,899 ‚Üí 178,000 subscribers
  • Steve Huynh (2022) 29,500 ‚Üí 160,000 subscribers
  • Amrit Sandhu (2023) 8,500 ‚Üí 108,000 subscribers
  • Zachary Staines (2024) 33,836 ‚Üí 152,000 subscribers
  • Han Zhango (2024) 34,000 ‚Üí 142,000 subscribers
  • Azul Wells (2024) 10,100 ‚Üí 149,000 subscribers
  • Aman Manazir (2024) 33,836 ‚Üí 142,000 subscribers

‚Ä¶the list goes on

I can‚Äôt name every single channel here but it‚Äôs been incredible to see so many people start, grow and scale their content and creator businesses after going through the course.

If you‚Äôre interested in following in their footsteps, you can join the Part-Time YouTuber Academy today here.

The course has over 10 hours of core material with an additional 15+ hours of guest interviews but you also get free access to a further 6 hours of material as part of the Creatorpreneur Academy (usually $799) and 4 hours of teaching as part of our Camera Confidence Masterclass (usually $149). All that for $995.

If you‚Äôd rather continue to get YouTube-related tips, advice and support through these emails, that‚Äôs absolutely fine too and I‚Äôll continue to try to be as helpful as I can. üòÖ

But if you want to take YouTube seriously and get access to the proven strategies and techniques to thrive on YouTube (without the guesswork), join the Academy: http://tracking.aliabdaal.com/tracking/click?d=tb158WDcUQq8ydQHVT6dGsD16NccM0dJF7ns77JbtAl0dhqcYb5iR2-80a416wrQA4EZA2HJF9vR9btnNeNleO6yvZHxGjto8C2-BzEX2pq2LZcpMNKF-xq4ASnh5A0Of6luQ3kx7qTzsUZyr3GqwMA1

And if you‚Äôve got any questions in particular, as always, just reply to this email!

Thanks for reading, have a great weekend üôå
Ali xx


üöÄ Want to start a YouTube channel? Go¬†here.
üìà Want to grow your business with YouTube? Go¬†here.

Ali Abdaal Ltd (TA Part-Time Youtuber Academy), 16-19 Eastcastle Street, Fitzoriva, London, W1W 8DY

Subject: RICE-A: A Prioritization Framework for AI-Driven Features | AI PM Jobs
Body Text:
View this post on the web at https://marily.substack.com/p/rice-a-a-prioritization-framework

In today‚Äôs AI-driven world, prioritizing features for development is a critical challenge. Traditional frameworks like RICE excel at helping teams evaluate feature ideas based on Reach, Impact, Confidence, and Effort. However, when it comes to AI products, the unique challenges of data collection, model training, and deployment require a nuanced approach. I see Product Managers sometimes including these challenges within ‚ÄòEffort‚Äô but I don‚Äôt believe that this is the right approach.
That‚Äôs why I am introducing RICE-A, an enhanced prioritization framework tailored specifically for AI-driven features. RICE-A will help product managers make data-informed decisions, balancing innovation with execution feasibility.
What Is RICE-A?
RICE-A builds on the RICE framework by introducing a fifth factor: AI Complexity (A). This additional layer captures the unique effort required by the AI lifecycle - to design, train, and deploy AI models, ensuring AI-specific challenges are weighted appropriately.
The RICE-A Formula:
Each component evaluates a specific aspect of the feature's feasibility and potential:
Reach: What percentage of your target audience will benefit from this feature?
Impact: How significant is the impact for the target user?
Confidence: How certain are you about the accuracy of your assumptions and ability to deliver?
Effort: What is the engineering effort needed to implement the feature?
AI Complexity (A): What are the data and computational demands for collecting the right dataset, training a robust model, and ensuring scalability?
Why Add "AI Complexity"?
AI features present unique challenges that aren't captured by traditional effort metrics. For example:
Data Challenges: Collecting, cleaning, and labeling high-quality datasets is often a monumental task.
Training Costs: Model training requires substantial computational resources, hyperparameter tuning, and infrastructure setup.
Deployment & Monitoring: AI systems demand post-deployment monitoring, retraining, and bias detection to ensure sustained performance.
How to Use RICE-A
Step 1: Score Each Component
Assign scores to each factor based on your product's context. For example:
Reach: % of users impacted (e.g., 50% of all feature users).
Impact: Use a scale of 1‚Äì5 to evaluate the impact of the feature.
Confidence: Evaluate the quality of data and assumptions (e.g., 80% = 0.8).
Effort: Estimated engineering hours, scaled inversely (e.g., 50 hours = score of 0.02).
AI Complexity: Break down model-specific tasks (e.g., data preprocessing, training) into effort scores. I recommend including a 0.5 multiplier for AI complexity. This is because AI-related efforts are typically intensive but should not overshadow general engineering effort unless justified. This way the AI complexity is weighted proportionately and doesn't dominate the scoring unless significant.
Step 2: Calculate the RICE-A Score
Plug your scores into the formula to derive a single priority score. Higher scores indicate features that deliver the most value relative to the effort required.
Step 3: Prioritize Features
Sort your list of potential features by their RICE-A scores. Reevaluate periodically to ensure alignment with team capabilities and business goals.
A Practical Example
Let‚Äôs say your team is considering a feature that uses AI to introduce recommendations on Netflix. Here‚Äôs how it might score in RICE-A:
You can now determine if it‚Äôs worth pursuing and stack rank all proposed AI-powered features which will help you create a roadmap.
Benefits of RICE-A
Clarity on AI-Specific Effort: Highlights the often-hidden complexities of AI projects.
Alignment with Stakeholders: Provides a data-driven way to justify priorities to leadership.
Efficient Resource Allocation: Helps teams focus on high-impact, feasible features.
Alright so RICE-A is a natural evolution of the RICE framework, bridging the gap between traditional prioritization and the unique demands of AI-driven product development. By explicitly accounting for AI complexity, product managers can better evaluate trade-offs, align teams, and drive impactful innovation.
Thoughts?
11 new AI Product Management Jobs I‚Äôd apply to:  ...

Subject: Workshop this Thursday: Grad School Application Strategues
Body Text:
Events for applicants to support your goals ¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬†‚Äå¬† ¬† Dear ProFellow readers, ¬† I'm offering _3 EXCLUSIVE WORKSHOP EVENTS_ this Fall just for those who pre-order my new book Pitch Your Potential: The Formula for Winning Dream Jobs, Awards and Elite Opportunities [https://profellow.krtra.com/c/PMvQhxViLodT/xeLlP]_. _Learn the MATCH ME Formula¬Æ‚Äîthe 7 elements of a winning application‚Äînow through these special events! ¬† The first _Pitch Your Potential_ Book BONUS Workshop [https://profellow.krtra.com/c/rIN8fS3YiRCp/xeLlP] is coming up this THURSDAY, OCTOBER 23 at 10am Pacific and is designed for master's and doctoral applicants. (_Registrants who can't attend live will receive the replay._) BOOK BONUS WORKSHOP: HOW TO BECOME A TOP GRADUATE SCHOOL CANDIDATE USING THE MATCH ME FORMULA¬Æ [https://profellow.krtra.com/c/rIN8fS3YiRCp/xeLlP] ¬† _A 1 hour workshop for master's and doctoral applicants with Dr. Vicki Johnson¬†_ DATE: Thursday, October 23 TIME: 10am Pacific | 1pm Eastern (U.S.) Register to join LIVE or receive the replay! ¬† You‚Äôre going to learn: ¬† * The MATCH ME FORMULA¬Æ‚Äîthe 7 elements of a winning application‚Äîand how to apply it to become a competitive candidate for top master‚Äôs and doctoral programs * How to create a master's or doctoral program application that is MEMORABLE, HIGHLY SPECIFIC, & CAPITALIZES ON THEIR UNIQUE BENEFITS * How to apply the Formula to PERSONAL STATEMENTS, SOPS, AND SELF-INTRODUCTIONS to faculty and admissions representatives * How to OVERCOME MINDSET CHALLENGES such as fear of rejection, comparison culture, and procrastination ¬† Why attend? ¬† >From 2019‚Äî2025, Coach Rachel Santarsiero and I taught the MATCH ME Formula¬Æ to ~400 grad school applicants who faced challenges ranging from a low GPA, lack of publications, career gaps, career change, being a first-gen, non-traditional or foreign applicant, and more. With this Formula, they overcame these challenges and achieved: ¬† * 547+ Master‚Äôs acceptances * 151+ PhD acceptances * 51+ Fellowship awards * and _$20K to $400K+ in funding per school acceptance! üéâ_ ¬† Meet these real-life MATCH ME Formula success stories here! [https://profellow.krtra.com/c/v18WifgHwaXc/xeLlP] ¬† >¬†_‚ÄúThe¬†MATCH¬†ME¬†Formula¬†is¬†pure¬†brilliance!‚Äù¬†_‚Äì¬†¬†Richard >¬†Mabula,¬†fully¬†funded¬†MFA¬†candidate¬†at¬†UT¬†Knoxville¬†and¬†multi-award >¬†winner ¬† HOW TO REGISTER FOR THIS WORKSHOP: When you pre-order _Pitch Your Potential_ and register through the steps below, you‚Äôll also be automatically registered for ALL 3 BooK BONUS events [https://profellow.krtra.com/c/GEDvQWhqzla4/xeLlP] in the series! Each event will be a 1-hour information-packed presentation with time for Q&A, led by author and ProFellow Founder Dr. Vicki Johnson. All registrants will receive the video replays. ¬† To get registered: ¬† 1. Pre-order the book _Pitch Your Potential_ (~$28). Purchase links for multiple retailers can be found here [https://profellow.krtra.com/c/PMvQhxViLodT/xeLlP]! ¬† 2. Email a screenshot of your receipt of purchase to bookbonus@profellow.com. Add a message sharing why you are excited to read the book! ¬† That‚Äôs it! You'll be registered for the event and receive the details within 1 business day.¬† ¬† Pre-orders help increase the visibility of a book. I appreciate every pre-order and every note of support! 100% OF THE BOOK PROCEEDS WILL GO TOWARD CONTINUING PROFELLOW'S MISSION AND FREE, COMPREHENSIVE DATABASE OF AWARDS.¬† ¬† Thank you readers! I hope to see many of you this Thursday! ¬† Warm regards, ¬† Dr. Vicki Johnson & the ProFellow Team ¬† ¬† ------------------------- ¬† LOOKING FOR FUNDING AWARDS?¬† ¬† Register for a FREE ProFellow.com database account [https://profellow.krtra.com/c/9YzAFuQhkm9c/xeLlP]to search for and bookmark more than 2,800 funding awards! Find Professional Fellowships, Student Fellowships, Summer Fellowships, Postdoctoral Fellowships,¬†and Business Accelerators. ¬†LET'S GET SOCIAL : ) ¬† Instagram (Dr. Vicki Johnson) [https://profellow.krtra.com/c/SFHnLJYOfBoQ/xeLlP]¬†|¬†LinkedIn [https://profellow.krtra.com/c/zsv9BkyT6brK/xeLlP]¬†|¬†YouTube [https://profellow.krtra.com/c/POZrTI9ftGYf/xeLlP] ¬† ------------------------- ¬† _ProFellow Insider_ is read by more than 100,000¬†U.S. high achievers. Contact us to advertise [https://profellow.krtra.com/c/w72bSBFKngZa/xeLlP] your graduate program, call for applications, event, or job opening. ¬† Copyright ¬© 2025 ProFellow, All rights reserved. ¬† You received this email because you opted into ProFellow's mailing list. Subject: üìà¬†Trade Your Time For 15M Views [Weekly Viral Templates]
Body Text:
Welcome back to Weekly Viral Templates‚Äîan exclusive perk for
Typeshare Pro users. Each week, we break down 3 pieces of content
that went viral (Tweet, Thread, Atomic Essay, LinkedIn post,
etc.) and explain why they worked. Then, we turn them into a
Typeshare Template you can immediately put into practice.

Hey there!

This week‚Äôs theme is Saving Time, and we have 3 exciting hooks to
break down for you:

* Hook #1: The ‚Äú5-Minute Class‚Äù
* Hook #2: The ‚ÄúTime Slasher‚Äù
* Hook #3: The ‚ÄúSecret Unlocked‚Äù

‚Äã

*********************************************
Viral Breakdown #1: The ‚Äú5-Minute Class‚Äù Hook
*********************************************

(
https://click.convertkit-mail2.
)‚Äã

)‚ÄãThread (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/92upo6m47kfdum9v6gb9hz34r633cw/kkhmh6hld0gqxvul/aHR0cHM6Ly90d2l0dGVyLmNvbS9kaWNraWVidXNoL3N0YXR1cy8xNTkyNTMyOTk3MTM1NTUyNTEz
)‚Äã

Here‚Äôs why this hook works:

* Big Value. Minimum Time. Mystery Problem. "7 frameworks. 1000
hours. 5 years of mistakes. In 5 minutes" Dedicate 5-minutes of
your time and you can benefit from 5 years of Dickie‚Äôs lessons
learned. Everyone wants a lot for a little and this thread caters
to the reader‚Äôs desire for efficiency and quick results. Notice
Dickie never mentions what problem his 7 frameworks solve for the
reader. It caters to the reader‚Äôs curious nature and demonstrates
just how powerful saving time can be.

*************************************************
Viral Typeshare Template #1: The ‚Äú5-Minute Class‚Äù
*************************************************

These {Number Of Things} took me {Hours} and {Years} of mistakes
to learn.

I‚Äôll teach them to you 5 minutes:

)‚Äã

Let‚Äôs break down all the different pieces working in this hook:

* Relatable Struggle: ‚ÄúIt took me 4 years.‚Äù Cole hooks the reader
with a relatable journey and common struggle to writing a
book‚Äîtime. Readers can empathize with the challenge of writing
their first book and are compelled to find out what happens next.
‚Äã
* From Struggle To Success: ‚Äú60,000 Words In 30 Days.‚Äù Cole lays
out a steady progression of improvement that ultimately gives him
the credibility to offer the reader an easy button for writing
their first book and skip the hard part.
‚Äã
* The Solution: ‚ÄúHere‚Äôs the framework‚Äù Anyone who wants to write
a book or is struggling to write the book will click to get this
framework to solve their book writing dilemma.

***********************************************
Viral Typeshare Template #2: The ‚ÄúTime Slasher‚Äù
***********************************************

‚Äã
And it took me {Less Time} to {Audience Desire} the 2nd time.

Let‚Äôs break down all the different pieces working in this hook:

* Trending Topic: ‚ÄúTwitter revealed its algorithm‚Ä¶.‚Äù Aakash takes
advantage of Twitter‚Äôs decision to open up what had previously
been a giant mystery to Twitter entrepreneurs. Suddenly what was
hidden has now been revealed, which generates interest.
‚Äã
* So What, Here‚Äôs What: ‚ÄúBut what does it mean for you?‚Äù ****
Most people don‚Äôt have the skill to unpack or read an
‚Äúalgorithm.‚Äù Aakash took his time to understand, and now he‚Äôs
helping the reader do what they most likely can‚Äôt, saving them
the time to learn how to read code and distill what it means.
Anyone who wants to grow on Twitter and take advantage of the
keys to getting seen will click.

**************************************************
Viral Typeshare Template #3: The ‚ÄúSecret Unlocked‚Äù
**************************************************

‚Äã
But what does it mean to you?
‚Äã

Nicolas Cole, Dickie Bush, and Sam

Subject: 5 Things in Data Engineering That Still Hold True After 10 Years
Body Text:
View this post on the web at https://seattledataguy.substack.com/p/5-things-in-data-engineering-that

Hi, fellow future and current Data Leaders; Ben here üëã
When I first started in the data world back in 2015, Hadoop was everywhere. Hortonworks, Cloudera, MapR, all promising to reshape the future of data. Fast forward a decade, and many newer practitioners don‚Äôt even recognize those names. And yet, for all the hype cycles and shiny new platforms, so many of the fundamental challenges in data haven‚Äôt really changed.
But before that, if you're a data leader looking to understand what is going on in the broader data world as well as elevate your leadership skills, I recently released my self-paced Data Leaders Playbook Accelerator. If you'd like to check out the program, you can sign up here [ https://substack.com/redirect/84acf617-2889-4ccc-9dde-55b502f16cee?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ].
Now let‚Äôs jump into the article!
When I started in the data world back in 2015 Hadoop was at it‚Äôs peak. 
Actually I happened to be scrolling through an old instagram account and found a picture from a DAMA conference where Horton Works sponsored it(you can see it below). At the time, Hadoop and its ecosystem were everywhere, Hortonworks, Cloudera, MapR, each promising to reshape the future of data.
Fast forward just ten years and many newer practitioners don‚Äôt even recognize those names. And yet, in data engineering, a decade is barely enough time for fundamentals to change. Underneath the hype cycles and new logos, many of the same challenges remain.
1. Schema Design and Data Modeling Remain Essential
How some companies approach data modeling has changed in the past decade since I first opened up Kimball [ https://substack.com/redirect/feb22b54-c95a-486e-8952-ecfa7f0b7e74?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ]. Many now lean on date partitions and table overwrites to simplify how they track history, instead of slowly changing dimensions.
In addition, AI is beginning to influence the conversation. Tools can now help generate schema recommendations, flag inconsistencies, or even propose transformations based on usage patterns(actually this was going to be the project I took on at Facebook prior to leaving). 
But while those capabilities are new, the fundamentals of data modeling [ https://substack.com/redirect/1bab18c3-9580-4607-b5fd-606f04ecc8a9?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ] haven‚Äôt really shifted. You still need to intentionally decide how to represent entities, relationships, and history in a way that the business understands and the system can scale.
In fact, many tools, even those with some level of AI capabilities require you to set-up a semantic layer or an ontology. There is still the need to be intentional with your data.
Whether you‚Äôre using  a star schema or or a denormalized wide table, good models require deliberate design and trade-offs. The tools may automate pieces of the work, but they can‚Äôt replace the judgment that goes into structuring data so people can actually use it.
Or maybe, you‚Äôll end up like the reddit post below, thanks Joe Reis  for capturing it (although I do often wonder if some people are just trolling).
2. Data Quality and Validation (‚ÄúGarbage In, Garbage Out‚Äù)
I often wonder how long the GIGO phrase has been around. Who said it first, and was it referencing data?
It still gets thrown around a lot today because, even in the age of AI it can be difficult to get quality data [ https://substack.com/redirect/a99fc366-4676-4cd3-b19e-8fdbcbbe5763?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ]. In many ways, it‚Äôs only gotten harder. 
Companies want more sources than ever, and that means more opportunities for errors, mismatched definitions, and conflicting values.
Even when the data itself is ‚Äúaccurate,‚Äù it may be incomplete or missing the context needed to make a good decision. A customer record without a region, a transaction without a timestamp, or a product without a category, all technically correct, but limiting the questions that can be answered.
This is where data engineers [ https://substack.com/redirect/bc866cc9-812a-45d9-ae43-49fa7c9cf3b6?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ] continue to step in. Not only in terms of creating data quality checks, but also advising what data should be added in or tracked to better answer key questions.
The business always has lofty goals, but if you don‚Äôt have the right or accurate data, you won‚Äôt be able to answer the questions or build an AI no matter how hard you try. As in the words of Sir Arthur Conan Doyle's Sherlock Holmes, Data! Data! Data! I can't make bricks without clay, and you‚Äôve given me sand.
3. Dashboards And Queries Are Still Slow
Back in my first database course, my instructor told us about his consulting work. Time and again, clients would bring him in to fix sluggish queries. After a bit of review, he‚Äôd add an index [ https://substack.com/redirect/0d8a1003-ea94-42a5-9d8a-74671078a776?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ] and suddenly the performance issues would disappear.
Fast forward a decade, and I still see the same story play out. Many dashboards [ https://substack.com/redirect/8e6c752c-c7b0-430c-8fbf-0c31cb6e5408?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ] and queries are built and slow down over time. The dashboard that initially wasn‚Äôt so bad taking three seconds to load now takes thirty. 
Often the solution is straightforward, add the right index(if you‚Äôre on a system that has indexes) or pre-aggregate the data. Neither is a silver bullet, and both should be applied thoughtfully, but the number of times I‚Äôve seen dashboards go from minutes to sub-seconds is still remarkable.
Despite advances in hardware and cloud databases, it doesn‚Äôt mean you can always just select a larger compute instance. At least, not without your Snowflake bill growing. 
SeattleDataGuy‚Äôs Newsletter is a reader-supported publication. To receive new posts and support my work, consider becoming a free or paid subscriber.
4. Batch Processing Is Still The Backbone Of Most Data Platforms
Another thing that has changed over the past decade is the sheer amount of companies building some form of data pipelines. 
And it‚Äôs not just the number of companies, it‚Äôs the number of pipelines within each company. When I was at Facebook, some teams managed over a thousand DAGs. The sheer volume of data workflows has exploded, and orchestration platforms like Airflow, Prefect, and Mage [ https://substack.com/redirect/5b302db7-9bb3-420e-994d-19cd0b2ed5f4?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ] now exist largely because of that scale.
But despite all of this growth, the foundation hasn‚Äôt really shifted: batch is still the default. 
Most data moves in scheduled chunks and nightly loads. Streaming pipelines have matured and found their place. Especially when it comes into operational analytics and workflows [ https://substack.com/redirect/719d6f70-d07e-4961-a8cd-6307bde09206?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ].
But for the majority of use cases, batch remains the default.
Ten years ago, your ETL job was a cron script running at midnight or an SSIS [ https://substack.com/redirect/93e17a56-d2a5-4d2e-963e-64c890dab580?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ] package being kicked off by SQL Server Agent. Today it might be a serverless job triggered by EventBridge [ https://substack.com/redirect/c00c1b62-5603-42ac-bad0-da9642188bbc?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ] or an Airflow [ https://substack.com/redirect/db062dea-e1af-4aec-b4bf-99d052d12bea?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ] DAG. But it‚Äôs probably being run on a schedule at a specific time, and moves a date window worth of data over to your data warehouse.
5. Business Alignment Trumps Tools
I am putting this last because, well, I write about this a lot and I assume it can get some what repetitive. I‚Äôll have to get back to talking about columnar storage [ https://substack.com/redirect/cf6cfe80-9d28-4e98-90eb-24a3fe2d9722?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ], data warehouses [ https://substack.com/redirect/a3d91ec0-f3fa-4473-bef0-36d1f6521fd1?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ] and the joy of pulling data from SFTP [ https://substack.com/redirect/ff6cd144-4662-4585-b563-9ea605abacf6?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ] servers after this article.
But it deserves the final spot because in the era of AI, it‚Äôs more relevant than ever. Just because we can move faster, deploy bigger models, or automate pipelines doesn‚Äôt mean the work is actually useful. The hardest part of data engineering was never ‚Äúcan we do it?‚Äù but ‚Äúdoes it matter?‚Äù
Will the business actually be able to support your new model that you‚Äôve developed? There are always multiple initiatives that your CEO or VP is trying to drive forward, if your work is too far outside of that or doesn‚Äôt actually drive some clear value, it won‚Äôt matter what technology you used.
That was true ten years ago when Hadoop clusters were humming away, and it‚Äôs just as true today when AI copilots are writing SQL. The companies that win aren‚Äôt the ones with the flashiest tech stack, but the ones whose data teams stay tightly aligned with business priorities.
Final Thoughts
Over the past decade, a lot has changed. SQL is no longer ‚Äúdying.‚Äù..wait nope just read another article apparently it‚Äôs dying again!
Snowflake, Databricks [ https://substack.com/redirect/135a9e62-8a5d-4418-8b88-dfcd6765184b?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ], and BigQuery [ https://substack.com/redirect/51906d89-9178-4b57-b817-319911e4df52?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ] have become household names in data. And an even broader range of companies now have some version of an analytics stack, on top of Excel, of course.
But for all the new tools, vendors, and buzzwords, the hardest problems remain the same. If anything, they‚Äôve grown more complex as expectations around what data can deliver have exploded. At the core, though, most challenges still come down to two things, the quality of the inputs and the performance of the queries.
A decade from now, we‚Äôll almost certainly be talking about another wave of platforms and paradigms, maybe beyond LLMs, maybe something none of us can imagine today. But if history is any guide, the toughest challenges will still be less about the tools and more about us, how we capture, model, and use data to answer real questions.
As always, thanks for reading.
Upcoming Data Events
Airflow Summit 2025(I‚Äôll be there!) [ https://substack.com/redirect/4cadf8a5-da69-4e05-a31f-234f2a0805df?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ]
Big Data London(I‚Äôll be there!) [ https://substack.com/redirect/7b0bb8af-aaab-48bd-96de-9814dc21f015?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ]
Small Data SF [ https://substack.com/redirect/71d0c407-7f74-411a-af6c-c0dffa032170?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ]
Articles Worth Reading
There are thousands of new articles posted daily all over the web! I have spent a lot of time sifting through some of these articles as well as TechCrunch and companies tech blog and wanted to share some of my favorites!
Full vs Incremental Pipelines
full, partial, or both? by Daniel Beach  
This is another classic, isn't it? Some data questions have had folk spitting and fighting for nearly a few decades now. Funny, how nothing really changes, even in the age of AI.
Technology has undergone significant shifts from the days of SSIS to DBT. But, I still see the exact same topics being discussed and poked at all these years later. And I mean literally the same topics.
Read More Here [ https://substack.com/redirect/46c36a8a-60ba-411d-9fe6-68c0c081a143?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ]
uReview: Scalable, Trustworthy GenAI for Code Review at Uber
Code reviews are a core component of software development that help ensure the reliability, consistency, and safety of our codebase across tens of thousands of changes each week. However, as services grow more complex, traditional peer reviews face new challenges. Reviewers are overloaded with the increasing volume of code from AI-assisted code development, and have limited time to identify subtle bugs, security issues, or consistently enforce best practices. These limitations can lead to missed errors, slower feedback loops, and other issues, ultimately resulting in production incidents, wasted resources, and slow release cycles.
Read More Here [ https://substack.com/redirect/3bb72f99-6b35-413b-87ec-c9d3f025b4e1?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ]
End Of Day 191
Thanks for checking out our community. We put out 4-5 Newsletters a month discussing data, tech, and start-ups.
If you enjoyed it, consider liking, sharing and helping this newsletter grow!

Subject: Admin controls on the printer

Good morning everyone,

I am sharing the administrative protocol for use of the printer in the admin wing. The controls on the printer can be remotely accessed by following the instructions below.

Login

  *   On your browser type this number, 192.168.199.252.
  *   For User Type, select Administrator
  *   For Password enter 12345678
  *   Then select the login button on the bottom right of the screen.

Edit/Delete Users

After login you will be taken to the home screen. Click the following tabs in this order,

  1.  User Auth/Account Track
  2.  Account Track Settings
  3.  Account Registration
  4.  Select an employee to edit or delete their information

Add New Users and set a copy code

After login click the following tabs in order

  1.  User Auth/Account Track
  2.  Account Track Settings
  3.  Account Registration
  4.  Click New Registration
  5.  Leave Use Opening Number selected
  6.  In the password field box enter the copy code you want to assign to new staff. The system does not generate or save these numbers, so it is important to document these codes in a secure location once created.
  7.  In the name field enter the employee's name.
  8.  Do not make any other changes (The system is already setup to make black and white copies)
  9.  Click OK and a new staff has been added and can make copies.

Edit/Delete email addresses

After login click the following tabs in this order,

  1.  Store addresses
  2.  Address Book
  3.  Select any person to edit or delete their email address from the system.

Add email addresses

After login click the following tabs in this order,

  1.  Store addresses
  2.  Address Book
  3.  New registration
  4.  Leave Use Opening Number selected
  5.   Enter the name and email address only and leave other fields blank
  6.  Click OK and an email address will be added for staff to scan documents.

  1.

Best,
Candace

Subject: Every ghostwriter should use this pricing strategy
Body Text:
This should be every ghostwriter‚Äôs pricing strategy:

Avoid the Middle.

Either be very expensive or be very cheap.

Most ghostwriters, when they sit down to come up with how much
they should charge for their service, they either:

* Close their eyes, wait for a random number to pop into their
head, and then decide, ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs how much I should charge!‚Äù
‚Äã
* Or they look around at all the other people who provide their
ghostwriting service and then they go, ‚ÄúI should probably just do
that but maybe at a discount so I can compete on price.‚Äù

Both are really, really bad ways to think about pricing.

I can pretty much guarantee what you‚Äôre charging right now is
nowhere near the ceiling of what you could charge.

There are two reasons for why this is:

* You have a business model problem. You‚Äôve picked the wrong way
to think about charging for the ‚Äúvalue of your value.‚Äù
‚Äã
* You have some faulty belief about your own self-worth. You
think you‚Äôre not worth the price or there‚Äôs no way someone would
be willing to pay this. Or, because you‚Äôve never seen someone
else around you charge his, so there‚Äôs no way you could do it
either.

But if you can solve these two problems, it will have a huge
impact on your earning potential as a ghostwriter.

So, let‚Äôs fix these problems, shall we?

Prefer to watch a version of this email? Click here to watch it
on YouTube. (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/gku5p88dl5i5hdv2l6qbrh8nlz699cm/m2h7h6u844drw9tl/aHR0cHM6Ly90YXB0aGUubGluay95SDNzalplbi15
)‚Äã

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/gku5p88dl5i5hdv2l6qbrh8nlz699cm/m2h7h6u844drw9tl/aHR0cHM6Ly90YXB0aGUubGluay95SDNzalplbi15
)‚Äã

*************************************
Ghostwriters: Stop charging per hour.
*************************************

If you are charging per hour, stop immediately.

Nicolas Cole üö¢-->

@Nicolascole77

There are 5 levels in the Ghostwriter Income Staircase:

1. Charging per word
2. Charging per hour
3. Charging per month
4. Charging per asset
5. Charging per outcome

Accelerate to Level 4 as quickly as possible, then stay there and
stack cash. (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/gku5p88dl5i5hdv2l6qbrh8nlz699cm/e0hph0u0rr8x52i7/aHR0cHM6Ly94LmNvbS9OaWNvbGFzY29sZTc3L3N0YXR1cy8xNzU4OTM3MDU3MDM0OTI0MTE1
)
11:30 AM ‚Ä¢ Feb 17, 2024

7
Retweets
92
Likes

Read 10 replies (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/gku5p88dl5i5hdv2l6qbrh8nlz699cm/e0hph0u0rr8x52i7/aHR0cHM6Ly94LmNvbS9OaWNvbGFzY29sZTc3L3N0YXR1cy8xNzU4OTM3MDU3MDM0OTI0MTE1
)
‚Äã
Charging per hour is a terrible business model because you are
tying your earning potential to time and effort. You can only
make more money when you work more hours, and you will never be
rewarded for creating efficiencies in your service or process.
Because if you get the work done in half the time, you make half
as much money‚Äîwhich is a huge problem.

And then on top of that, whenever you anchor yourself to per
hour, the client associates this rate with the hourly rate of
every other person in their life:

* Their lawyer
* Their dentist
* Their gardener
* Etc.

So you‚Äôre placing yourself in the context of every other vendor
that charges per hour, and most other people who charge per hour
are typically not charging a premium.

Even lawyers are way underneath the market of what they could
make.

But this isn‚Äôt your fault. Everyone price-anchors to hours. But
you don‚Äôt have to make the same mistake. Even if you were to
notch your hourly rate up to $500 or $1,000, you would still be
leaving a ton of money on the table.

Instead, charge by project and outcome.

***************************************************
Premium Ghostwriters charge by project and outcome.
***************************************************

The customer doesn‚Äôt care about the number of hours you work.

What they care about is the outcomes you deliver. They only care
about the number of hours you work because that‚Äôs the way you
told them you work. But if you were to charge by outcome (so by
project) instead, you can easily charge more.

Nicolas Cole üö¢-->

@Nicolascole77

Freelance writers charge per word or per hour.

Premium Ghostwriters charge per project or outcome.

Want to guess which one makes you more $$$? (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/gku5p88dl5i5hdv2l6qbrh8nlz699cm/owhkhwurqq2z54aq/aHR0cHM6Ly94LmNvbS9OaWNvbGFzY29sZTc3L3N0YXR1cy8xNzU3ODQ5ODc1MzkwMDE3NTUz
)
11:30 AM ‚Ä¢ Feb 14, 2024

4
Retweets
63
Likes

Read 17 replies (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/gku5p88dl5i5hdv2l6qbrh8nlz699cm/owhkhwurqq2z54aq/aHR0cHM6Ly94LmNvbS9OaWNvbGFzY29sZTc3L3N0YXR1cy8xNzU3ODQ5ODc1MzkwMDE3NTUz
)
‚Äã
But to charge by project, you have to understand this fundamental
reframe:

You‚Äôre charging for your pattern recognition and experience, not
the hours you work.

*****************************************************************
Charge for the value you provide, not the hours it takes to
provide the value.
*****************************************************************

What the client is paying you for are all the years it took you
to acquire knowledge in order to deliver the outcome.

So, let‚Äôs say a client asks you to put together a document
outlining how to write the perfect marketing email. As a
ghostwriter, you might think that‚Äôll take you 4-5 hours and you‚Äôd
charge $500 for it. But they aren‚Äôt buying your time. They are
paying for your pattern recognition.

If you think that the best way to be compensated on this is how
long it takes for you to create just the document or the
template, you‚Äôre leaving 10 years of value on the table because
that‚Äôs how long it took you to be able to create this in the
first place.

As a writer, you have to understand the value of your value.
------------------------------------------------------------

The client can take this document and easily get 10x, 20x, even
50x ROI on your knowledge if they were to teach it to their team
(or if you were to teach it to their team).

You‚Äôre passing along 10 years of knowledge to someone else‚Äôs
organization which they can use to get tremendous upside. So, why
wouldn‚Äôt you charge something like $50,000 for this? After all,
if they can use this to 10x their sales via email, then why
wouldn‚Äôt they pay that? It‚Äôs a steal!

Look at it another way. It sounds like a lot for a ‚Äúproject‚Äù but
really $50,000 is the equivalent of a fairly
entry-level/mid-level employee.

******************************************
Pricing boils down to your own self-worth.
******************************************

Did your mouth fall open when I dropped the $50,000 price tag?

If it did, then you don‚Äôt really believe you‚Äôre worth charging
that amount.

Nicolas Cole üö¢-->

@Nicolascole77

3 faulty beliefs that hold freelance writers back from raising
their rates ($$$):

‚Ä¢ "I'm afraid the client is going to say 'No.'"
‚Ä¢ "I'm afraid the client is going to get upset.
‚Ä¢ "I'm afraid I'm not worth what I'm asking for."

All self-inflicted.

All wrong. (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/gku5p88dl5i5hdv2l6qbrh8nlz699cm/z2hgh7u3llqg03bz/aHR0cHM6Ly94LmNvbS9OaWNvbGFzY29sZTc3L3N0YXR1cy8xNzA0NjA4OTc0OTI0ODQ1MzQ0
)

Likes

Read 7 replies (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/gku5p88dl5i5hdv2l6qbrh8nlz699cm/z2hgh7u3llqg03bz/aHR0cHM6Ly94LmNvbS9OaWNvbGFzY29sZTc3L3N0YXR1cy8xNzA0NjA4OTc0OTI0ODQ1MzQ0
)
‚Äã
You‚Äôre terrified and cannot fathom charging more than a baseline
hourly rate the ‚Äúworld‚Äù has told you is fair.

And I promise you, when you start to understand how higher-level
decision-makers make pricing & packaging and buying decisions,
they have no problem spending significantly more than you think
because they‚Äôre playing a different game, and they are not
concerned with the time or energy or effort.

They‚Äôre concerned about the outcome the service delivers‚Äîand you
can charge accordingly because what you know is WORTH that price.

Alright, now, onto some tactical advice.

*****************************************
3 more tactical ghostwriting pricing tips
*****************************************

* Tip #1: Avoid the Middle (or, in other other words, making it
less expensive won‚Äôt make people buy). The number that you pick
says a tremendous amount about your business. Let‚Äôs say I have a
Ferrari for sale. Everyone knows a Ferrari costs $300k-$500k. But
if I said I have one for sale for $500, you wouldn‚Äôt think, ‚ÄúWow,
what a steal!‚Äù Your first thought would be, ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs wrong with
the Ferrari?!‚Äù A huge part of pricing is understanding how the
price affects the customer or client‚Äôs perception of what you do.
Whenever you make something less expensive, fewer people buy
because they assume you aren‚Äôt the best. And why would they
settle for less than the best?
‚Äã
* Tip #2: The true ceiling of your current service is 2x, 3x, 5x,
10x your current price. I‚Äôve lived this. When I was building my
ghostwriting agency, for the entire first year, we charged $2,000
or $3,000 a month for 3 articles/week. That was 12
articles/month. It was a tremendous amount of volume. It was
horrible. But after 2 years, we‚Äôd switched to charging $5,000 for
2 articles/month. The best part? Clients were actually happy that
we were doing less volume (because they couldn‚Äôt keep up). So
when you think, ‚ÄúNo one would be willing to pay that,‚Äù know this
is just a faulty belief you have in yourself.
‚Äã
* Tip #3:Ask, ‚ÄúWhat would I need to do to charge this much?‚Äù
Don‚Äôt think ‚ÄúI can‚Äôt charge this much.‚Äù Instead, ask what you‚Äôd
need to deliver to charge the amount you want. This is a
packaging technique. Make a list of everything the client would
want. What would make them ecstatic for you to tell them or give
them? Then the price point rationalizes itself.

So, to wrap up, whatever you‚Äôre charging right now, I can
guarantee is nowhere near the ceiling of what you could charge.

Use these frameworks and tips to go out and charge more‚Äîand get
paid what you‚Äôre worth as a writer.

That‚Äôs it!

‚ÄîCole

Co-Founder, Premium Ghostwriting Academy

PS‚Ä¶ Want more pricing tips so you can finally land your first
high-ticket client?

From Name: Jess Ramos from Big Data Energy‚ö°Ô∏è

Subject: Is Null, If Null, and Is Not Null in SQL: Lesson 12 Free Beginner SQL Course
Body Text:
View this post on the web at https://jessramosdata.substack.com/p/is-null-if-null-and-is-not-null-in

Got BDE?‚ö°Ô∏è
Hi BDEs! Welcome to Lesson 12 of the free Big SQL Energy Beginner Course‚ö°Ô∏è Today we‚Äôre learning about handling NULLs in SQL!
üö® üö®üö®üö®üö®üö®üö®üö®üö® Don‚Äôt forget to snag my intermediate course at 20% off w/ code Jan2025. This deal will end at the end of the month after my Beginner series is complete!
If you‚Äôre new here, I‚Äôm Jess Ramos, the founder of Big Data Energy and the creator of the BEST SQL course and community: Big SQL Energy‚ö°Ô∏è. Check me out on socials: üîóLinkedIn [ https://substack.com/redirect/3630f4c0-e8f1-4682-ab99-9ad4a29f1f00?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ], üîóInstagram [ https://substack.com/redirect/4a3ccd07-9bd8-409c-8610-6caa64b3da33?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ], üîóYouTube [ https://substack.com/redirect/9bd79962-e2a7-4620-81a5-3db0668983aa?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ], and üîóTikTok [ https://substack.com/redirect/933ed883-e91d-499c-a9ca-5768bacf3b3f?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ].
Big SQL Energy Intermediate is an intermediate SQL course designed to solve real business problems hands-on using realistic data and a modern tech stack. You‚Äôll walk away with 2 SQL portfolio projects, portfolio building guidance, access to the Big Data Energy Discord community, and lots of confidence for you upcoming coding interviews. This course is all of the most important things I‚Äôve learned on the job as a Senior Data Analyst in tech who grew from a $72K salary to over a $150K salary. And now I‚Äôm sharing it with YOU!
                                  Use code Jan2025 for 20% off for all of January!
But if you‚Äôre here for the free BEGINNER Big SQL Energy course, the next lesson for you is below! ‚¨áÔ∏è
Lesson 0: Intro & Getting Started
üé• Video [ https://substack.com/redirect/3926a3a7-9cad-4289-80e4-ba5f8024d24d?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ]
Before you start, you‚Äôll need access to any IDE (integrated development environment) for SQL of your choosing. I highly recommend using a üîóHex data science notebook [ https://substack.com/redirect/f735ca92-e27c-433a-9c66-0ff333657d39?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ] because it‚Äôs easy to get started with and stored in the cloud‚Äî so no headaches to download and set up. However, you can alternatively use DBeaver, MySQL Workbench, SSMS, or any others if you‚Äôd prefer. Just import the dataset used in the lesson, and you‚Äôre ready to go! Remember, if you get stuck or experience errors, ChatGPT and Gemini are great resources to learn about syntax and help you debug. Alright, let‚Äôs get started!
üîó Join Hex Data Science Notebooks: https://app.hex.tech/signup/big-data-energy [ https://substack.com/redirect/f735ca92-e27c-433a-9c66-0ff333657d39?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ]
üîó Datasets (Orders & Customers): https://github.com/jessramosdata/big-sql-energy-beginner [ https://substack.com/redirect/eb916357-976e-47f7-8914-a21263ea3e41?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ]
Lesson 12: Is Null, If Null, and Is Not Null
üé• Video [ https://substack.com/redirect/32f0abfa-076c-4198-851d-fb95cb6a444f?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ]
One of the most challenging and ANNOYING parts of working with data is dealing with NULLs values. Nulls represent missing or unknown data, and they can sometimes cause unexpected results (and even incorrect results) in your analyses if not handled correctly. It might seem like the easiest thing to do is to simply remove them; however, this can have negative impacts to your analysis. NULLs aren‚Äôt always mistakes and nuisances ‚Äî sometimes they‚Äôre actually very meaningful all in themselves. 
A null value in a column means that there‚Äôs no value. It's not the same as zero or an empty string, so we have to make decisions on how to handle them. Nulls can be a bit tricky, so let's learn how to check for them and replace the NULLs with another value. Here are 3 of the most common tools to use when working with NULLs:
Is Null
Checks if a value in a column is NULL or not and returns with a Boolean True/False value. It‚Äôs often used in CASE statements (in my üîóintermediate course [ https://substack.com/redirect/d9ee2215-d47b-4934-99a6-e076a209fb05?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ]) and in the WHERE clause to filter. The query below pulls all the rows (orders) that do not have a review submitted for them:
SELECT 
   order_id,
   review IS NULL
FROM 
   orders;

And this query shows how to filter for NULLs in the WHERE clause: 
SELECT 
   *
FROM 
   orders
WHERE 
   review IS NULL;
Is Not Null
Checks if a value in a column is NOT NULL or not and returns with a Boolean True/False value. It‚Äôs the opposite of IS NULL and is also often used in CASE statements (in my üîóintermediate course [ https://substack.com/redirect/d9ee2215-d47b-4934-99a6-e076a209fb05?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ]) and in the WHERE clause to filter. The query below pulls all the rows (orders) that DO have a coupon logged for them:
SELECT 
   order_id,
   coupon IS NOT NULL
FROM 
   orders;

And this query shows how to filter for NULLs in the WHERE clause: 
SELECT 
   *
FROM 
   orders
WHERE 
   coupon IS NULL;
So now we‚Äôve learned how to identify NULLs, but what do we do with them?! Sometimes we remove them (aka filter them out). Sometimes we replace them with another value‚Äî either the mean, median, a 0, or something that makes sense for the business scenario. Let‚Äôs learn how to replace NULLs with another value:
IFNULL
IFNULL lets you replace null values with a specified value. This is useful for cleaning data and preventing nulls from causing issues in calculations and further downstream in dashboards. Sometimes having NULLs will make you unable to perform a calculation, so you have to either remove them or replace them. The query below replaces all the NULL coupon values with 0 since a NULL coupon value is really $0 off from the order!
SELECT 
   order_id, 
   coupon,
   IFNULL(coupon, 0) AS coupon_clean
FROM 
   orders;

And this query replaces NULL reviews with helpful text:
SELECT 
   order_id, 
   review,
   IFNULL(review, 'No Review') AS review_clean
FROM 
   orders;
A few other great ways to handle NULLs are with COALESCE & CASE statements which we‚Äôll touch on a little bit in this course and learn SO IN DEPTH in my üîóintermediate course [ https://substack.com/redirect/d9ee2215-d47b-4934-99a6-e076a209fb05?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ]. See you in the next lesson!
üö®üö®üö® If you‚Äôve enjoyed the free BEGINNER Big SQL Energy course, grab my intermediate course for 20% off NOW because this deal expires February 1. There are no deadlines or timelines for this course‚Äî you start and take as long as you want. It will take your beginner skills to the next level and get you ready to ace your interviews. üö®üö®üö®
DM me or email me at courses@bdeanalytics.com if you have questions on the intermediate course!
-xoxo,
jessüíï
Big Data Energy‚ö°Ô∏è is a MUST subscribe if you want BDE in your data career.

Subject: Marketing materials from Mac desktop
Body Text: Marketing plan for roles in Marketing Agency

Subject: üò¢ My YouTube Producer Left the Team‚Ä¶
Body Text:
Hey Candace,

At the end of last year, Tintin, my YouTube Producer, left the
team üò¢

He‚Äôd been producing the channel for over two years so it‚Äôs sad to
see him leave but he‚Äôs trying the whole entrepreneurial thing for
himself, and I‚Äôm super happy for him.

But starting a new chapter without him reminded me of just how
important it is to have a system behind your content.

And I know, I know. I‚Äôve talked about systems a lot but one of
the biggest mistakes I keep seeing so many creators make is that
they‚Äôre thinking one video at a time. They come up with an idea,
plan the video or write the script, film everything, it gets
edited, uploaded, posted, and only then do they start thinking
about the next piece of content. And they just rinse and repeat
the whole process over and over again.

But running on this hamster wheel isn‚Äôt sustainable and will
quickly lead to burnout and it makes creating content even harder
when you're running low on motivation - something I‚Äôve talked
about in recent weeks with my own filming üòÖ

When I hang out with other big, successful YouTubers, I love
talking about their production pipelines. Some people organise
everything on Apple Notes, others use Trello, or Notion, just
like me and my team, and they‚Äôre all slightly different. But the
one thing we all have in common is that we understand the power
of creating simple systems.

You can come up with the best video ideas, write scripts that
tell really cool stories, craft catchy titles, and make banger
thumbnails, but none of this is important unless you‚Äôre able to
do it sustainably. And it‚Äôs the system that provides you with
leverage to work smarter, not harder.

And if you‚Äôve not got a formal ‚Äòsystem‚Äô yet, it doesn‚Äôt have to
be complicated to begin with. As I talk about in one of the
modules within PTYA, the first thing you need to do is simply
draw out your YouTube process from start to finish - our pipeline
within Notion looks something like this:

Idea generation ‚Üí Confirm the title and thumbnail ‚Üí Scripting ‚Üí
Filming ‚Üí Editing ‚Üí Publishing ‚Üí Repurposing ‚Üí Video analytics üìà

(Worth noting that we try not to even begin writing the video
until the packaging is sorted - a reminder of just how important
the title and thumbnail are to your videos‚Ä¶)

Step two is to then create checklists for each individual step.
For example, when I‚Äôm siting down to film a video I run through a
checklist that says things like ‚Äúset up camera angles‚Äù, ‚Äúset up
mics on table‚Äù and even ‚Äúpress record‚Äù, because sometimes I
forget to do that and, spoiler alert, it‚Äôs a complete disaster üòÇ

Step three is then to streamline the process by eliminating,
automating, or delegating tasks. I tell pretty much every
YouTuber, and all my PTYA (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/5qu5ex8krot7hnvlv47h6h9pd3l44an/6qhehou7444v44i9/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cucHR5YS5jb20vcGFydC10aW1lLXlvdXR1YmVyLWFjYWRlbXkvP3V0bV9jYW1wYWlnbj1zeXN0ZW1zX2phbjI1JnV0bV9tZWRpdW09ZW1haWwmdXRtX3NvdXJjZT1jcmVhdG9yX25vdGVz
) students, to outsource their editing, because if you value
you‚Äôre own time then you should definitely get someone else to do
this step for you (unless you really really really enjoy editing
üòÖ).

Another way to streamline your system is by removing friction.
For example, writing out the hook before every video helps me
when it comes filming, because the whole process feels much more
effortless and less of a heavy-lift.

(Quick tip - I also film the hook after the video. I just find it
easier to get into the flow of filming the content first then
record the hook and intro once I've warmed up).

So if you‚Äôre looking to create or refine your production systems,
don‚Äôt overcomplicate things, just follow these simple, but key,
steps to get the ball rolling:

* Map out the entire process on a Figjam board or equivalent.
* Create checklists for each step that suit your requirements.
* Streamline the process by eliminating, automating, delegating
and/or removing friction.

If you want to dive deeper into the systems that we have for our
channel, how we think about optimising workflows plus a
walkthrough of our system which Tintin recorded just before he
left, you can get access to that within the Part-Time YouTuber
Academy (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/5qu5ex8krot7hnvlv47h6h9pd3l44an/6qhehou7444v44i9/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cucHR5YS5jb20vcGFydC10aW1lLXlvdXR1YmVyLWFjYWRlbXkvP3V0bV9jYW1wYWlnbj1zeXN0ZW1zX2phbjI1JnV0bV9tZWRpdW09ZW1haWwmdXRtX3NvdXJjZT1jcmVhdG9yX25vdGVz
).

Otherwise, I hope this has been helpful. Just remember - systems
are the key to long-term success on YouTube but they don't need
to be complex to produce results.

Have a great week :)

Ali xx

P.S

Tintin recorded a video (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/5qu5ex8krot7hnvlv47h6h9pd3l44an/kkhmh2ulpppgp7ck/aHR0cHM6Ly95b3V0dS5iZS9TcURlSXFKXzB6UT9zaT0zVVEzWlZpM3RJM2JXUHpI
) about his experience leaving the company which has gone
semi-viral if you want to give it a watch and hear more about
what he‚Äôs doing next üôå

üöÄ Want to start a YouTube channel? Go here (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/5qu5ex8krot7hnvlv47h6h9pd3l44an/58hvh8umwwwpepb7/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5wdHlhLmNvbS9wdHlhLWJsLWZvb3Rlcg==
).

) |

squo;r squo;rABOUT: Welcome to, you‚Äôre now part of our community and we‚Äôre glad
you are. Get ready for some awesome stuff coming your way. We recognize the
importance of protecting the privacy of the personal information you provide to
us. Accordingly, we have developed our Privacy Policy for you to understand how
we collect, use, communicate, disclose the personal information you entrust to
us. Your use of our site is conditioned upon your agreement with this Policy and
our Terms of Use. Before using our Service, please read our Policy on our site
carefully as it contains important information on who we are and how and why we
collect, store, use, and share your personal information. This Policy also
explains your rights in relation to your personal information. This Policy is
written in the English language. We do not guarantee the accuracy of any
translated versions of this Policy. Any translations are for your convenience
only. To the extent that any translated versions of this Policy conflict with
the English language version, the English language version of this Policy shall
control. Categories of Personal Information and Purpose for Collection We
collect the following categories of personal information: (1) contact
information including your name, email address, and mailing address; (2)
authentication information, including the user name and password that you use to
register an account on the Service; (3) financial information for payment
processing purposes; (4) user content, including survey responses, comments,
reviews, questions, and suggestions; (5) personal characteristics including age
range, date of birth, gender, marital status, and nationality; (6) personal
preferences including product preferences, online preferences, and interests;
(7) online behavior information including online activity, preferences, and time
spent viewing features; and (8) IP address or mobile network information. The
personal information we collect is required to provide the Service and customer
support to you. If you do not provide the personal information we ask for, it
may delay or prevent us from providing the Service or support to you. The
Company retains personal data for so long as reasonably necessary. If you
inquire about a career at the Company through our website(s)' careers pages, you
will also be asked to provide your resume. We utilize a third-party provider to
host our job applications and assist with the application process. Such a
third-party provider may have its own terms of use and privacy policies, and we
encourage you to review those policies whenever you visit their website or
interact with their platform. The Company will use the personal data of job
applicants solely for employment evaluation purposes. Providing this information
is completely voluntary. We may now or in the future provide customer support
via chatbox or email that utilizes artificial intelligence and natural language
processing to understand customer questions and automate responses to them,
simulating human conversation. However, by using our website, you agree to waive
the more restrictive laws and agree to be governed by the laws of the Canada. If
you wish to view our official policies, please visit our website. If you have
provided personal, billing, or other voluntarily provided information, you may
access, review, and make changes to it via instructions found on the Website. To
manage your receipt of marketing and non-transactional communications, you may
unsubscribe by clicking the "unsubscribe" link located on the bottom of any
marketing email. Emails related to the purchase or delivery of orders are
provided automatically ‚Äì Customers are not able to opt out of transactional
emails. We will try to accommodate any requests related to the management of
Personal Information in a timely manner. However, it is not always possible to
completely remove or modify information in our databases. If you have any
questions, simply email support@drsquatch.com or visit our website to view our
official policies. By accessing and using our website, you explicitly accept,
without limitation or qualification, the collection, use and transfer of the
personal information and non-personal information in the manner described in our
Privacy Policy. Please read this Policy on our website(s) carefully, as it
affects your rights and liabilities under the law. If you disagree with the way
we collect and process personal and non-personal information, please do not use
this website. This Policy applies to this website as well as all web pages
Company hosts. It regulates the processing of information relating to you and
grants both of us various rights with respect to your personal data. It also
informs you of how to notify us to stop using your personal information. We are
located in the Canada. You may be located in a country that has laws which are
more restrictive about the collection and use of your personal information.
However, by using our website, you agree to waive the more restrictive laws and
