Subject: Are you setting yourself up to fail?
Body Text:
Hey friends,

Last week, I talked about the concept of pendulation - something I learned from a retreat hosted by Joe Hudson and the Art of Accomplishment team. This week, I'd like to share another key tidbit from the retreat: it relates to failure.

What happens in our brains when we process ‚Äúfailure‚Äù? Well, the brain‚Äôs ‚Äúerror detection system‚Äù, the Anterior Cingulate Cortex (ACC) activates, sending signals to the amygdala (our fear centre) and the hippocampus (which helps form memories). This creates a cocktail of emotions and memories that make us want to avoid similar situations in the future.

For example, if you were an ape challenging the alpha male and got beaten down, this cocktail of emotions and memories about your ‚Äúfailure‚Äù would disincentivise you from trying that again, at least for a long time. It's not great for our survival to keep attempting things we've failed at before.

It‚Äôs not very ‚Äúpersonal development‚Äù friendly, but the idea of "if at first you don't succeed, try, try again" isn't actually that helpful for our survival. When we fail at something, it's a profound signal to our brains, bodies, and systems to not attempt that thing again for a while.

Why is this important? Well, it gives us a way to hack our brains when we're trying to learn new things or accomplish anything. If we set up situations where failure is likely, it's super demotivating. Most people will stop trying pretty quickly if they keep failing.

This is illustrated nicely by a study that Mark Rober did, which I reference in my book, Feel-Good Productivity  (https://djX7c204.eu1.hubspotlinks.com/Ctc/5H+113/djX7c204/VX7Sq83BhPRJW3Yqsnh5GcHcGVJvnzy5mqRLpN2K0T3n3pyd0W7lCdLW6lZ3nwW38rpwV66lmcQW7QMC5K7Y_MWLW6KtmKr7xjsK2W2yYGl5622vBYW8jCRrQ5SwK2-VjQCZn9b51WRW46Ly5d1jLS2VW3HdHhY6RR0wPVlVglw3rDPm2W5JVxhL1010bkVcsyzy1QdklyN93BG8rgLxl3W2bqCYB2XPfm3W2scQDV34Fb6JW46gJBD2qm7NnW3wdPm87g92PDVLtTTW4YRdkSW5z-ZCs2-h6nlW1_4kJ72dXZBRW1Zj96g8nkxMRW22KV5w1_FqvtW6kb0pn4-g9SBW3L3PTm67B-r5N4kw6np7Gk3rf6p-XLY04 ) (which you should totally read / listen to if you haven‚Äôt yet). He got 50,000 people to play a game where they were supposedly learning to code, but it was really just a big science experiment. The puzzle they were trying to solve was impossible. Half the group was told "You failed. Please try again." The other half was told "You failed. You've lost 5 points. You now have 195 points. Please try again." These were totally arbitrary ‚Äúpoints‚Äù that had absolutely no bearing in the real world.

But what they found was pretty interesting - the group who were told they lost points (i.e., where the failure was emphasised) tried less than half as many times to solve the puzzle compared to the group that was simply told they failed. This echoes what most of us intuitively know to be true - failure doesn‚Äôt feel very good, and can be quite demotivating.

It does suggest that when we're trying to learn new things or accomplish anything, we should try to set things up in a way that makes it hard for us to fail. For example, if I'm starting a new diet and my rule is that I ‚Äúsucceed‚Äù only if I stick to my calorie goal everyday, but I ‚Äúfail‚Äù if I go over even once, it's going to be really easy to fail. Same goes for building a YouTube channel or a business - if I tell myself I'm only succeeding if I stay consistent and make at least 1 video a week, I'm making it very easy for myself to fail because of these arbitrary rules I've created - for the record, every YouTuber / writer / business-owner in the world struggles with consistency: you‚Äôre not alone.

In the context of integrating learnings after the retreat, Joe and Tara emphasised how important it is to not think of ourselves as having failed if we ‚Äúfall off‚Äù or don't do something we intended to do. As soon as you label yourself as having failed, it becomes a profoundly demotivating force. It makes it less likely, rather than more likely, that you'll continue to apply the learnings and grow from the experience.

Just like the concept of pendulation we talked about last week, I really like this because it allows us to have more forgiveness and grace for ourselves. But it also encourages us to rig the game in our favour.

When you're playing games of personal improvement or trying to level up (and tbh, with everything in life), there's very little point in making things harder for yourself than they need to be‚Ä¶ unless of course, you‚Äôre doing that as a deliberate way to add more of a sense of challenge to make the thing feel more like ‚Äúplay‚Äù.

But that‚Äôs not what most of us do. Most of us create arbitrary rules for ourselves that make it quite hard to feel we‚Äôre succeeding, and distressingly easy to feel we‚Äôre failing. The trick is to set up the rules of the game so that even if you don‚Äôt stay as consistent or as intentional as you‚Äôd like, you avoid registering that as a ‚Äúfailure‚Äù.

We‚Äôre not doing this just because it'll make us feel better (though there's nothing wrong with that), but also because we recognise that every time we label ourselves as having failed, we‚Äôre sucking away some of our motivation to try again. This is hardwired into our brains.

Sure, you can probably fight against it, but why bother?

One really useful hack that I've been using for years around this is to simply label new things I'm trying as "experiments". This is why in my book, all 54 strategies are labelled as ‚Äúexperiments‚Äù. Each chapter has 6 experiments for the reader/listener to try out. Framing anything as an experiment means that whether or not it "works", the experiment is still successful. The point of an experiment is to gather data, not to win or lose.

Have a great week!

Ali xx

P.S. I‚Äôm on the look out for an in-person YouTube producer based in Hong Kong. ‚Äå ‚Äå ‚Äå ‚Äå ‚Äå ‚Äå ‚Äå ‚Äå ‚Äå ‚Äå ‚Äå ‚Äå ‚Äå ‚Äå ‚Äå ‚Äå ‚Äå ‚Äå CR WEEKLY [https://usercontent.flodesk.com/screenshots/58aed3ae-6715-4ca4-80fb-7d8e73c69e7d/676443cdc89efc94d6d4083a/art-lqiGwLsNHi-4f1df5a5-2c44-40fe-aa29-5d0edf2463de.png]HEY FRIEND! [https://usercontent.flodesk.com/screenshots/58aed3ae-6715-4ca4-80fb-7d8e73c69e7d/676443cdc89efc94d6d4083a/art-ORWRl2CGcV-316dae7b-9a85-43b0-b18e-7dddecef5bfa.png]
We hope you're having a great week. We had a fabulous meetup in Atlanta on
Tuesday, and we have our last meet up of 2024 in Baton Rouge today!We wanted to
say thank you to everyone who participated in the meetups throughout this year.
Each of you is what makes this community so encouraging and fun to be a part of.
If you are interested in hosting a meet up in your city in 2025, then fill out
the form on our AI Film Events page
[https://uqj77c.ff12.fdske.com/e/c/01jfg4wez4t04zb1a9gnky8kh9/01jfg4wez4t04zb1a9gnx98avz]
.Ok, let's get to the good stuff. This last week was crazy, so we have lots to
cover.Image item
[https://usercontent.flodesk.com/58aed3ae-6715-4ca4-80fb-7d8e73c69e7d/upload/k3zlqbprp7/Newsletter_Email_Images.png]
[https://uqj77c.ff12.fdske.com/e/c/01jfg4wez4t04zb1a9gnky8kh9/01jfg4wez4t04zb1a9gst5hhas]
Check out the latest episode of AI Film News.
[https://uqj77c.ff12.fdske.com/e/c/01jfg4wez4t04zb1a9gnky8kh9/01jfg4wez4t04zb1a9gv3ex9b8] 
 This is no joke our biggest episode ever! So much news. Here are some of the
highlights below.Google Veo 2 -
[https://uqj77c.ff12.fdske.com/e/c/01jfg4wez4t04zb1a9gnky8kh9/01jfg4wez4t04zb1a9gw2eqnd5]
On Monday Google announced Veo 2 and we were lucky enough to get early access.
We have already had a blast playing with the tool and are genuinely blown away
by the physics in each of the generations. One of the main downsides is that you
have to use their new image generator and cannot upload an external image. With
that said, it still seems to consistently outperform Sora's generation, but
we'll let you decide for yourself. üìπRunway's Frames -
[https://uqj77c.ff12.fdske.com/e/c/01jfg4wez4t04zb1a9gnky8kh9/01jfg4wez4t04zb1a9gwnc45qd] 
 Runway has been dropping some big updates recently, maybe they're getting
excited for the holidays. They just launched frames, which will give you more
stylistic control over your image generations. The images in the press release
look spectacular, so it's safe to say we cannot wait until we get our hands on
this tool. Runway's image generator tends to fall under the radar, so we are
excited to see how it performs compared to other tools like Midjourney. üñºÔ∏èHuge
AI Filmmaking Competition -
[https://uqj77c.ff12.fdske.com/e/c/01jfg4wez4t04zb1a9gnky8kh9/01jfg4wez4t04zb1a9gzt1z3x3] 
 Project Odyssey is hosting one of the biggest AI Filmmaking competitions ever,
giving you the chance to win up to $70,000. This competition is sponsored by
some of the most notable AI companies in the world including Kling, ComfyUI,
Viggle, and so many more. You can even choose which category you want to compete
in. Check it out and share your submission with us! üí∞Pika 2.0 -
[https://uqj77c.ff12.fdske.com/e/c/01jfg4wez4t04zb1a9gnky8kh9/01jfg4wez4t04zb1a9h1ayyz8r]
Similar to Runway, Pika was in the holiday spirit and decided to release Pika
2.0. This new model gives you the ability to prompt for specific elements in a
scene, such as a certain outfit, person, or environment. We definitely recommend
checking it out. üß•Minimax AI Video Update -
[https://uqj77c.ff12.fdske.com/e/c/01jfg4wez4t04zb1a9gnky8kh9/01jfg4wez4t04zb1a9h59jsfak]
Minimax recently launched a new AI video model that specializes in animated
visuals. A lot of the time when using AI video generators they struggle to
generate animated videos. It often tries to change it to live action or does
some type of weird hybrid thing. This new model honestly does a phenomenal job
staying consistent and could be a great use to you on your next animated film.
üßõMidjourney Moodboard -
[https://uqj77c.ff12.fdske.com/e/c/01jfg4wez4t04zb1a9gnky8kh9/01jfg4wez4t04zb1a9h6rfhgc1]
Midjourney recently launched moodboards, geared towards helping you maintain
consistency in your image generations. This seems pretty similar to style
reference, but it makes it much easier and definitely seems to be geared toward
helping those utilizing Midjourney for film projects. üîÆImage to Video Game?! -
[https://uqj77c.ff12.fdske.com/e/c/01jfg4wez4t04zb1a9gnky8kh9/01jfg4wez4t04zb1a9h8t3y8jr]
Google Deepmind just launched what is the biggest update to AI Video games ever.
We often talk about Sora and how it creates worlds in it's video generations.
This is the video game version of that, but it does it in real time all from a
prompt. It can generate other CPUs, general VFX, and it even can create a video
game from uploading an image. üéÆ

Image item
[https://usercontent.flodesk.com/58aed3ae-6715-4ca4-80fb-7d8e73c69e7d/upload/rhqfyyo4iw/9.png]
[https://uqj77c.ff12.fdske.com/e/c/01jfg4wez4t04zb1a9gnky8kh9/01jfg4wez4t04zb1a9hbj58a35]CREATIVE AI JOBS BOARD [https://usercontent.flodesk.com/screenshots/58aed3ae-6715-4ca4-80fb-7d8e73c69e7d/676443cdc89efc94d6d4083a/art-3MdFc79YGK-cfc4320b-16e5-41f8-a8db-4c2ec3f9ace7.png]
Interested in finding your next paid AI job? We curate new opportunities for you
on our Creative AI jobs board
[https://uqj77c.ff12.fdske.com/e/c/01jfg4wez4t04zb1a9gnky8kh9/01jfg4wez4t04zb1a9hfa0kchr] 
 every week. üî•Play Media is seeking somebody to fill a remote roll as an AI
Animator, Canto AI is looking for an AI Video Creator, and there are tons of
jobs for prompting and other AI Artist roles.And if you're hiring an AI Creative
or other AI positions, submit your job posting here!
[https://uqj77c.ff12.fdske.com/e/c/01jfg4wez4t04zb1a9gnky8kh9/01jfg4wez4t04zb1a9hjpzz5j8]

[https://uqj77c.ff12.fdske.com/e/c/01jfg4wez4t04zb1a9gnky8kh9/01jfg4wez4t04zb1a9hmdddsrn]AI FILM OF THE WEEK:SANTA AT THE BEACH [https://usercontent.flodesk.com/screenshots/58aed3ae-6715-4ca4-80fb-7d8e73c69e7d/676443cdc89efc94d6d4083a/art-FGpkZvA1La-0846e99a-40f9-4745-87f6-5cce0de24741.png]
Get in the holiday spirit with this super fun, retro-styled, AI music video

Subject: Register now for this one-of-a-kind creative event
Candace, want free IxDF membership by helping make the world a better place?
Body Text:
Interaction Design Foundation logo [https://public-images.interaction-design.org/emails/brand/v5/ixdf-logo-for-header.jpg]
 BUILD CREDIBILITY + EMPOWER OTHERS = FREE MEMBERSHIP
Dear Candace,

You get free IxDF membership every time someone joins IxDF after clicking a link
or watching a video you shared.

They even get 3 months of free membership ‚Äî along with a thank-you message
showing you made it happen. 

How does it work? We'll automatically add your referral code (‚Äú?r=candace-grant
‚Äù) to every link you share:

IxDF referral code example [https://public-images.interaction-design.org/emails/referral-programs/url-r-member-slug.png]
  You build credibility and show generosity every time you share a link to the
world's largest and most authoritative compendium of design knowledge
[https://email.mailgun.interaction-design.org/c/eJxsyj1yhSAQAODTQBcHVn7WgiKN94CF1Z3xyRsl8fqZ9K_-vpoWLo1Rt2Sj9xHnOVq9pyX6kNma0qoDs7joZmKDVHIoFrlqSYGJ2Fb2hK1aqIjFB8LQMBMBLsoZOUe7Mg3p51dtt2zn1K9NH2kf432r-VvBqmB9nmf6XBWsh_zD-LmagnX0t9Ctr5SFeqZdzg0MeOXM9spyTNRf-jfBXwAAAP__Zn5ExA]
. It's a treasure trove of videos and articles ‚Äî worth millions of dollars in
expert insight ‚Äî and you're sharing it to help others grow. 

Long-term tracking:

 * Anyone who clicks a link with your referral code is remembered for 2 years.
 * If they join IxDF within that time, you get 3 of free membership.
 * They'll even get 3 months of free membership, with a personalized message 
   thanking you!
 * Each link you share can keep generating referrals ‚Äî and helping others ‚Äî for
   many years. It's an easy way to build scalable, even passive, referrals from
   a single action.

You'll help make the world a better place:

 * You help people grow their careers and create better products and services.
 * At the same time, you show thought leadership and generosity.

Go to Your Control Panel and Learn More
[https://email.mailgun.interaction-design.org/c/eJxsjc1q8zAQAJ9GviVoV15JPvjwQfBrfEi7K1vgnyA7TR-_tPTY2zAMjIxDyVpipyMEohCdC9Ato4LNg4gFQI5EnF1PVoQo9hEDxq6OvjAXkEIcVQAlxkyeo9eYmDEOprd1v7Qlvuqx30TPOu_3o83dOi7X9TyN-2dwMji93-_736nBaT3muhucYIAQ0LhJP5-16WncAwL54FwIYNA3ldqUr_-vthr3MEg4bbplbecPz3rdSlO9_cqlPg3671G6Xk2Ne2TAnsSVwMDIxcWSRYP4Igmj2KCcUyDAQBaz5IEseO9tcqXPoAhdG1PlI_FS9xktkuntvKW63vnYuo8RvwIAAP__R2lwRw]
 SHARE IXDF'S FREE RESOURCES. BUILD YOUR CREDIBILITY
When you share free IxDF resources to help others learn design, you don't just
showcase your skills‚Äîyou build your credibility:

 1. You build your brand as a forward-thinking professional ready to share your
    knowledge.
 2. Professionals who share knowledge are more likely to get new job
    opportunities and salary increases.
 3. You attract new opportunities and collaborations with decision-makers who
    can catapult your career.
 4. You show your commitment to learning so you don't get left behind when
    managers decide who to reward and promote.
 5. Your articles on LinkedIn, or your blog, act like a mini-portfolio.

HOW TO PUBLISH AN ARTICLE TO GET REFERRALS
Let's use a LinkedIn article as an example. You can apply the same approach on
your own blog, Medium.com, or portfolio website.

 1. Log into your control panel
    [https://email.mailgun.interaction-design.org/c/eJxsjc1q8zAQAJ9GviVoV15JPvjwQfBrfEi7K1vgnyA7TR-_tPTY2zAMjIxDyVpipyMEohCdC9Ato4LNg4gFQI5EnF1PVoQo9hEDxq6OvjAXkEIcVQAlxkyeo9eYmDEOprd1v7Qlvuqx30TPOu_3o83dOi7X9TyN-2dwMji93-_736nBaT3muhucYIAQ0LhJP5-16WncAwL54FwIYNA3ldqUr_-vthr3MEg4bbplbecPz3rdSlO9_cqlPg3671G6Xk2Ne2TAnsSVwMDIxcWSRYP4Igmj2KCcUyDAQBaz5IEseO9tcqXPoAhdG1PlI_FS9xktkuntvKW63vnYuo8RvwIAAP__R2lwRw] 
    to find your referral code and learn to maximize your referrals and impact.
 2. Write a short article about something you're learning and link to a few of
    our topic definitions
    [https://email.mailgun.interaction-design.org/c/eJxsyj1yhSAQAODTQBcHVn7WgiKN94CF1Z3xyRsl8fqZ9K_-vpoWLo1Rt2Sj9xHnOVq9pyX6kNma0qoDs7joZmKDVHIoFrlqSYGJ2Fb2hK1aqIjFB8LQMBMBLsoZOUe7Mg3p51dtt2zn1K9NH2kf432r-VvBqmB9nmf6XBWsh_zD-LmagnX0t9Ctr5SFeqZdzg0MeOXM9spyTNRf-jfBXwAAAP__Zn5ExA] 
    like the ones about User Experience
    [https://email.mailgun.interaction-design.org/c/eJxsysFuhCAQANCvgVsNDKKzBw698B-zw6CTuLJRrP38pkmPPb9X0qM-paKV5OcYZwxh9nZNTFwFHQkAVYCAI4UyIXqM41xcsJqmylx9qZFRioeC-IwT4yRIzIAPMzrduxzEXdv-UeTUZR_asdgtrb2_TxM-DWQD-b7v4f9qIG_6C_06xEDu7a18GsjX99-yRyLlRrzqvoCDaEa3vEi3gdvLfiX4CQAA__-udUjA]
    , Design Thinking
    [https://email.mailgun.interaction-design.org/c/eJxsyjtuxCAQANDTQLeWGcAMBUUa7sEOH4_ihZVN4utHUdrU7-Xg67NUlCUoZ61DrZ2SezAqoU--eK1dcRnJOAe1KpPBZzSb5LBVoqpytYQlK8iIT7sRbgUTEaAXZuU-y5lo8uiPXC5ufRlnk0fY53xfQn8IiALifd_L_1VAPPgX5tdZBMQ53kyXgPhXHnPn_sm9yTMkppFo595gBSvM2l6Jj4XGS34H-AkAAP__Qx5K9A]
    , and UI Design
    [https://email.mailgun.interaction-design.org/c/eJxsyjtuxCAQANDTQBcLhu8WFGm4BwyDPZLXrGw2vn4UKeXW77X06JV6lJR0cC5EY4KWWzJOBaeCjQSual1UJ2-qsR6MNbVbycl3xK5bdxipaWgxVucxeooFEeJDWMXHpLPg5HF8Nbp4PZZxrnJP25yvS5hvAVlAvu97-VwF5J3_YL5PEpDneDFeAvKb_5c8U2EcBTc-VlDghFXrs_C-4HjKnwS_AQAA__8H3kfo]
    .
 3. Use this easy guide
    [https://email.mailgun.interaction-design.org/c/eJw0jr2OhiAQAJ8GujO48rMWFNfwHrgsujk_NGqO179YXDeZYjIlznXhiprjGJwLOE1h1FtktDX7QlgsLn4hMB45WLAQ5tk40BJ9JapjqY6QywgFcXGe0DNmIsBZWSPt4SvTI0f7KnzL2objWvUet-c5bzV9K0gKUu992KX9cJE20PFRkDbeTwXp3ypIud2drxccvBv6ilnoyLRJW8GAU9asnyz7W9C_Ef4CAAD__xKaQ8g] 
    to publish your article on LinkedIn. An article, as opposed to a regular
    post, will get more readers from Google searches.
 4. We'll comment, like, and thereby boost your article when you tag IxDF
    [https://email.mailgun.interaction-design.org/c/eJxkzLFyhCAQANCvge4cWECxoEjjf8DuojtRuPFMTP4-c3XaVzxKcy1co-ZkpxCm6Nxk9ZbQVcresXEO7Dx7b9BEV9hDQetL1pLGilgt1YCRyQLFWMKIceSYESHOyhtpF58ZL-ntQfyStQ39XPWetut6vpT7ULAoWO77HnZpn0zSBuyHggX78cztV8EiP1Qf_6NH7V-N8lv0mbJgz7hJW8FAUN6sR5b9fenvBH8BAAD__3A7SiA] 
    and use the #ixdf hashtag. 
 5. Tag us on any other platform and we'll do the same: Instagram
    [https://email.mailgun.interaction-design.org/c/eJwUysFuhiAMAOCngduM1B-pBw67-BoLlhab_MKCZO7xl92_HDc5WNBydMH7gMsSnD2jgONDEEPGJLB5dgm3TQgCh5WPxWpchUhcFk_I2UFGPPxKuDImIsDNvGatg3uioa1-ZL611Kn1Yt_xHOP7Nsungd3A_jzPpPUeqfR0TdQuA7v-ZvlqvRjYbY9JqSU6tRaYwZvXXK6k739qfyL8BQAA__8IoD4H]
    , Facebook
    [https://email.mailgun.interaction-design.org/c/eJxMzDFuxCAQQNHTQBcEgxnYgiKN7zEMjI2yC5HXiXP8aKUUab_0fs03KU2SbtnFEGLyPjq9ZwkYQ7yVUKgiES8AaL1ldIjoF6t7RmEWVyVwatVBTakE5IQtETOkm1psH2c7iM8-x1ttz74NM49N3_N-np9P5d8VrArW67qMELcy54fh-VCw9p8q5h83f1zm16j0KvrI1HkS731sYCGoxW4P6vfXQX9n-A0AAP__RddF_Q]
    , Threads

Subject: How much $$$ can you make as a ghostwriter?
Body Text:
I started ghostwriting in 2016.

Since then I‚Äôve ghostwritten for 300+ different industry leaders:

* CEOs
* Silicon Valley Founders
* Grammy-winning musicians

And more.

And every day, I get tons of messages about how to get into
ghostwriting, how to scale as a ghostwriter, and what skills you
need to master to become a highly-profitable ghostwriter.

So, to help you kickstart you ghostwriting business, here are the
8 most common questions I get asked all in one place.

Let‚Äôs dive in!

Prefer to watch a video version of this newsletter?

‚ÄãClick here to watch this over on YouTube. (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/75uo4eeqwos8hkgvrzqtzhw34m666cn/z2h2nr6ec7u3q26xnzaz/aHR0cHM6Ly95b3V0dS5iZS9rYzZQWmVBdElhRT9zaT1lV2E2SGFsMk44eFc2V3Vk
)‚Äã

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/75uo4eeqwos8hkgvrzqtzhw34m666cn/p8hzn3o6squznw6omefr/aHR0cHM6Ly95b3V0dS5iZS9rYzZQWmVBdElhRT9zaT1lV2E2SGFsMk44eFc2V3Vk
)‚Äã

*****************************************************************
Question 1: Should you target a specific industry or play the
field and pick a niche later?
*****************************************************************

When starting out, it‚Äôs important to pick a niche where you have
an Information Advantage.

Your Information Advantage is where:

* You already speak the industry lingo
* You know the pain points of your target client
* You know what outcomes these kinds of people want

When I first started, I attracted founders and executives from
every kind of industry.

But I didn‚Äôt have an Information Advantage in every single
industry on planet Earth! But if you do have domain expertise,
you should write for that particular industry because your
Information Advantage means you can charge more.

Nicolas Cole üö¢-->

@Nicolascole77

Ghostwriters:

Niche down until you have an information advantage. Clients
aren‚Äôt paying you to "write words". They‚Äôre paying you to write
the right words in a way that is fluent within their industry.

If you can't, talented writer or not, you have no value in that
industry. (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/75uo4eeqwos8hkgvrzqtzhw34m666cn/3ohphdu7e5mg0wip/aHR0cHM6Ly94LmNvbS9OaWNvbGFzY29sZTc3L3N0YXR1cy8xNzk3Njk3NDc1NzE0NzI0MjQz
)
11:30 AM ‚Ä¢ Jun 3, 2024

1
Retweets
53
Likes

Read 12 replies (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/75uo4eeqwos8hkgvrzqtzhw34m666cn/3ohphdu7e5mg0wip/aHR0cHM6Ly94LmNvbS9OaWNvbGFzY29sZTc3L3N0YXR1cy8xNzk3Njk3NDc1NzE0NzI0MjQz
)
‚Äã
So, look for the pattern of who‚Äôs the easiest to work with
(because of your Information Advantage) and which clients are the
most efficient for you.

*****************************************************************
Question 2: What‚Äôs the most challenging part of ghostwriting for
such high-profile clients?
*****************************************************************

The biggest challenge is TIME.

You are dealing with people who in many cases are managing
anywhere between 5-10 employees all the way up to thousands of
employees. You‚Äôre dealing with people who are used to being in
power dynamics where they‚Äôre the ones telling other people what
to do. Many also have families.

>From the moment they wake up to the moment they go to sleep, they
have people pinging and dinging them asking for things.

So, what is a busy CEO really looking for?
------------------------------------------

Someone to manage them.

The worst thing you could do as a service provider is start
working with someone like that and then say, ‚ÄúLet me know what
you need,‚Äù because that‚Äôs already their whole life.

What they value more than anything else is your ability to:

* Follow up eight times
* Not get frustrated when you don‚Äôt hear back
* Move the ball forward and take radical accountability

Yes, they value this even more than your writing ability.

*****************************************************************
Question 3: How do you get into the mind of a client to produce
meaningful work?
*****************************************************************

You don‚Äôt want to go onto your call with a CEO and ask, ‚ÄúWhat
ideas do you have?‚Äù because they aren‚Äôt going to know what to
say.

Remember, you‚Äôre the expert here‚Äîso guide them.

Winning ideas are the overlap between:

* What this person would be most equipped to talk about * This
could be broad for your client (e.g. CEOs can talk about morning
routines, hiring, firing, etc)
* Or very deep, domain-specific knowledge

* And what topics other people would find most interesting

Show up with ideas that would perform well and speak to their
target audience.

Nicolas Cole üö¢-->

@Nicolascole77

95% of my ghostwriting clients had the same "voice":

‚Ä¢ To the point
‚Ä¢ No harsh language
‚Ä¢ No flowery language
‚Ä¢ Minimal industry jargon
‚Ä¢ Simple and easy to understand
‚Ä¢ Formal tone without being verbose

Most of the time, they just wanted to sound confident. (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/75uo4eeqwos8hkgvrzqtzhw34m666cn/48hvh7ur4dl8l5uq/aHR0cHM6Ly94LmNvbS9OaWNvbGFzY29sZTc3L3N0YXR1cy8xODA5NjU2MjMwNjE4NTcxMTMy
)
11:30 AM ‚Ä¢ Jul 6, 2024

3
Retweets
77
Likes

Read 21 replies (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/75uo4eeqwos8hkgvrzqtzhw34m666cn/48hvh7ur4dl8l5uq/aHR0cHM6Ly94LmNvbS9OaWNvbGFzY29sZTc3L3N0YXR1cy8xODA5NjU2MjMwNjE4NTcxMTMy
)
‚Äã

*****************************************************************
Question 4: Should I start ghostwriting if I‚Äôm a new writer and
haven‚Äôt published anything online before?
*****************************************************************

Can you?

Yes.

Should you?

Sure.

But is your life easier or harder by not writing for yourself on
the internet?

Well, it‚Äôs harder. We have plenty of people in our Premium
Ghostwriting Academy (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/75uo4eeqwos8hkgvrzqtzhw34m666cn/reh8h9u0gldzd7s6/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cucHJlbWl1bWdob3N0d3JpdGluZ2FjYWRlbXkuY29tLw==
) who don‚Äôt write on the internet and don‚Äôt write under their own
name. They don‚Äôt build a personal brand. They use cold outreach
and tap their network to land clients. So it can work if you‚Äôre
not already writing online.

But it‚Äôs worth asking how many more clients could you attract and
how much easier would it be to convert those clients if you used
yourself as practice?

Dickie Bush üö¢-->

@dickiebush

A quick & easy way to upskill as a ghostwriter:

Practice In Public.

‚Ä¢ Ghostwrite eBooks? Write eBooks for yourself.
‚Ä¢ Ghostwrite LI posts? Write LI posts for yourself.
‚Ä¢ Ghostwrite IG captions? Write IG captions for yourself.

Prove it works for you, first. (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/75uo4eeqwos8hkgvrzqtzhw34m666cn/8ghqh3ulm6dndxbl/aHR0cHM6Ly94LmNvbS9kaWNraWVidXNoL3N0YXR1cy8xODE3OTkwNjcxNDgwODM2Mzc0
)
11:28 AM ‚Ä¢ Jul 29, 2024

2
Retweets
117
Likes

Read 32 replies (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/75uo4eeqwos8hkgvrzqtzhw34m666cn/8ghqh3ulm6dndxbl/aHR0cHM6Ly94LmNvbS9kaWNraWVidXNoL3N0YXR1cy8xODE3OTkwNjcxNDgwODM2Mzc0
)
‚Äã
Practice on yourself, write what you want to master under your
name, and then rent whatever‚Äôs working to other people.

********************************************************
Question 5: How do you measure success as a ghostwriter?
********************************************************

This question reveals how little people understand about their
value.

Often, freelance writers think their offer needs to promise
something specific:

* ‚ÄúI will get you 10,000 followers in 60 days‚Äù
* Or ‚ÄúI will make you an extra 30 grand from your sales funnel‚Äù

First, nobody in marketing has any idea whether something is
going to work or not.

Second, an example.

I built my ghostwriting agency doing nothing but 800-word
articles. We ended up writing more articles each month than Inc.
magazine or Forbes, doing over $2 million a year in revenue. Not
once did I promise specific follower counts or revenue increases.

The way we framed the value was simple:

* Do you understand it‚Äôs important to write on the internet?
‚Äã
* When you write on the internet, people view you as a thought
leader so it‚Äôs easier to connect with peers and inbound
opportunities are likely to increase
‚Äã
* Right now you‚Äôre not writing on the internet
‚Äã
* When we work together, you will be writing on the internet

The value is that zero-to-one moment. They don‚Äôt have those
things now but they will when you work with them.

That‚Äôs the value you sell.

**************************************************************
Question 6: What types of businesses should I steer away from?
**************************************************************

This goes back to where you have an Information Advantage.

When I was ghostwriting, I started to avoid clients where I
didn‚Äôt want to know anything about their industry. Some early
clients were in industries I knew nothing about but was excited
to learn more about (for example, crypto in 2016 and 2017).

So, the real question comes down to what you want to learn.

I had clients in other industries (like affiliate marketing and
grey hat marketing) that I wasn‚Äôt interested in. But I continued
saying yes to clients in industries I didn‚Äôt know much about but
found interesting.

Consider steering away from businesses where:

* It‚Äôs too time-consuming, even if interesting, because time is
your primary asset
‚Äã
* There are regulations on what you can/can‚Äôt say (medicine,
finance, health and wellness, etc.)

Pro tip: If you learn to navigate these regulations, it increases
your value tremendously to those companies.

***************************************************************
Question 7: How do I come up with different topics for clients?
***************************************************************

All content leads back to 5 content buckets:

* Mission. What is the founder‚Äôs/CEO‚Äôs mission? What are they
trying to do and why does it matter?
‚Äã
* Industry Trends. What‚Äôs currently happening? Can they comment
on new data and/or studies?
‚Äã
* Futurism. Where is this industry headed? Ask them to project
current trends 5-10 years out.
‚Äã
* Education. What could they explain to others in their role or
those aspiring to be in their role?
‚Äã
* Stories. What unique experiences can they share?

You can go back to these 5 content buckets over and over again
and they work for any leader in any industry.

*****************************************************
Question 8: Is there a ceiling for solo ghostwriters?
*****************************************************

Most people ask this question way earlier than necessary.

Getting to $10k/month as a ghostwriter is incredibly easy with
just a handful of skills. The difference between $10k and
$20k/month comes down to outreach effort and the ability to sell
on the phone.

This pattern continues up to $30k-$50k. Around $40k-$50k, you‚Äôll
hit a ceiling as an individual. There are some outliers . For
example, New York Times bestselling authors who ghostwrite for
celebrities can make $1-2M yearly, but they only do 1-2 projects
per year.

For the average person, at around $30k/$40k/$50k per month, you
have two main options:

* Stay there and maybe launch digital products
‚Äã
* Scale into a small agency by hiring other writers, account
managers, and sales reps

Many people ask about scaling before they‚Äôve even reached $10k
per month.

This is ‚ÄúEarly 20s Syndrome‚Äù‚Äîconstantly looking for the next
thing instead of focusing on what‚Äôs right in front of you.

Nicolas Cole üö¢-->

@Nicolascole77

Scaling my ghostwriting business took over 12,000 hours and 5
years of mistakes.

I‚Äôll teach you how I did it in 2 minutes: (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/75uo4eeqwos8hkgvrzqtzhw34m666cn/l2heh6u38m272oag/aHR0cHM6Ly94LmNvbS9OaWNvbGFzY29sZTc3L3N0YXR1cy8xNzQyNTc4OTU3OTkwNDcwMDkw
)
9:9 AM ‚Ä¢ Jan 3, 2024

4

)
‚Äã
Focus on reaching the next milestone, and the next step will
reveal itself when you‚Äôre ready.

That‚Äôs it!

Cole

Co-Founder, Premium Ghostwriting Academy

Then join me inside the Premium Ghostwriting Academy!

Subject: my roommate just landed his dream client
Body Text:
Hey Candace!

How are things?

Just wanted to check in and share a quick story about my roommate, Lane.

Earlier this year, he was working at Walmart, making around $2,000 a month,
struggling to see a way out.

His weeks were long‚Äîalways working 6 days, chasing overtime, and getting up
at 5 a.m. every morning just to get by.

It was exhausting.

*On top of that, he was surrounded by people who didn‚Äôt have the same drive
or goals as him, which made it even harder to stay motivated.*

Lane felt stuck in a cycle, knowing he wanted more but not knowing how to
break free.

That's when I convinced him to join PGA.

He quit his soul-sucking job at Walmart & well all-in into the program.

And within 2 months of joining, he landed a $4,000 monthly retainer client
from what he learned.

Now, here‚Äôs the crazy part:

*Lane didn‚Äôt have a writing background or a big network.*

What he did have was belief in the process and trust in himself.

He followed the roadmap we give every student inside PGA‚Äîand he landed his
first client.

Which meant: he didn‚Äôt have to go back to work at Walmart!

And with this new-found skillset and freedom, he finally had the chance to
ask himself:

‚ÄúWho would my perfect dream client be?‚Äù

And as a fantasy football nerd and the NFL season starting up, the answer
was crystal clear.

So using what he learned in Module 5 (Cold Outreach), he sent a DM to his
favorite fantasy football creator‚Ä¶

AND BOOM!

Now he is writing for him and preparing to do the same to the people in his
client‚Äôs network.

*How is this possible?*

Thanks to the‚Ä¶


   - Endless support
   - 1-on-1 coaching
   - Weekly hot seat calls
   - And massive community of like-minded individuals inside PGA

I know the timing wasn‚Äôt right before, or maybe funds were tight‚Äîbut here‚Äôs
the thing: the longer you wait, the longer you‚Äôre missing out on the
opportunity to rewrite your future.

*What if that next $4K client could be yours?*

The only thing standing between you and that milestone is taking that first
step.

You already know the program works‚Äîthe question is:

Are you still interested in building up a lucrative side-hustle / pivoting
away from your 9-5 (like Lane did)?

If so, can you take a look at my Calendly and see if any times work for you?

https://calendly.com/connor-pga/15min

I‚Äôd love to help you make it happen.

Best,

Connor

PS - Lane isn‚Äôt the brightest crayon in the box (don‚Äôt tell him I said
that!). If he can do it, why can‚Äôt you?

Hey Candace,

In our last email I covered why Productivity Lab may not be for everyone (https://djX7c204.eu1.hubspotlinks.com/Ctc/5H+113/djX7c204/VXhCzy1Vh0k0W6CrStv6dhmLzW7Y8zfc5l2cCnN8SvFDj5n4LbW50kH_H6lZ3q1N1jll56449WnW157DPW73cFQ3Vrmk811gnjQ9W1H7FF54y9J3hVG_r9j5pvxpJW79WsG744CDw2VC_9Sl2Rmc7dN1DQqMjWbn1TN52CVbpQWPxlW7X0_xg2Z3ghlW2z1C1k6KpFsCW6SNLMR8Tcs0MW1QH6QS1LRlWJW7TH3jh70q7pXW68MTnv28SqK6M41GKtDmpgJW3zp5dt5Qq4XMN81m64DTTK-KVg2V4H6yZnPfW1MmWz67hyGkNW2cyMLW2y_J-lW15cJ-l5Yc9YHW75Hm8v15cZ7HMBhb52FxtlDW5jG5j_5lvrqVW5l47R26mB5wDV4ys0m6Zxcy-W1Bxrm-1jMM83W2L_th51YvDTBN2nmWrrz280QVYn3DT8HRCQcW9hkQ6W5WvnzJf2Bmwxn04 ) .

Today I thought it‚Äôd be a good idea to answer the most common questions I receive about the Lab.

Here we go!

What do I get from joining Productivity Lab?

Productivity Lab is an online community, resource library, and co-working space rolled into one helping you to double your productivity alongside other ambitious entrepreneurs, creators, and professionals.

But, the goal of Productivity Lab isn‚Äôt just about helping you to get more done. It‚Äôs about freeing up your time to do more of what matters to you in work and life, while enjoying the journey along the way.

So, here‚Äôs what you get from joining the lab:

‚úÖ Life Productivity System: A 90 day self-paced productivity programme, where you‚Äôll learn everything you need to know to build your own simple, effective productivity system with guidance from our Productivity Coaches.

üéâ Focus Labs: Daily, live deep-work focus sessions, accessible for all the major time zones across the world, every single working day.

üí≠ Reflection Rituals: Weekly, monthly, and quarterly reflection workshops to help embed lasting changes.

üó£Ô∏è Expert-Led Workshops: Workshops with productivity experts, successful entrepreneurs, and specialists in various fields to share their insights, strategies, and tips for optimising your work and life.

üìö Exclusive Resource Library: A curated and ever-growing repository of knowledge, covering everything from the latest productivity strategies to the best practices in wellness and health.

ü§ù Community Support and Networking: A vibrant community of like-minded individuals. Share your journey, seek advice, collaborate on projects, or simply engage in meaningful conversations that inspire and motivate you.

üèÜ Access to Productivity Coaches: Access to productivity coaches who can provide tailored advice and support within the community spaces.

ü§ì And much, much more.

How will Productivity Lab boost my productivity?

How will productivity Lab double my productivity? ü™Ñ

By joining the Lab, we‚Äôll help you understand the core principles to double your productivity (through the 90 day Life Productivity System), and give you the structure to take immediate action on your goals (through our sessions, guest workshops, and the support of our Productivity coaches).

As long as you turn up and put in the work, we can almost guarantee that your productivity is going to double.

In fact, over 70% of members say they double their productivity in the first 3 months of being a member of the Lab.

Here‚Äôs what one member had to say about their productivity gains:

How will productivity Lab help me set clear goals? üîÆ

A productivity systems that works needs alignment. Your life vision should connect with your yearly, quarterly, weekly, and daily goals. Without this, you'll struggle to focus on what truly matters.

That's why Productivity Lab includes regular reflection rituals. These are guided workshops - weekly, quarterly, and yearly - that help you gain clarity on your life direction and create a roadmap to get there.

But we don't stop there. Our community is packed with productivity coaches excited to offer you support and guidance whenever you need it.

How will productivity Lab help me connect with ambitious people? üíé

At the heart of Productivity Lab is our thriving community. We're bringing together ambitious entrepreneurs, creators, and professionals. And we've built spaces for you to connect and learn from each other.

You‚Äôll get access to spaces to share productivity strategy, learn from the successes of our members, and join live co-working sessions every day.

But that's not all. You'll instantly plug into a network of hundreds of go-getters, just like you, who are eager to level up their productivity, support each other, and enjoy the journey together.

How will productivity Lab help me tackle procrastination? ‚ú®

We procrastinate when we have unclear goals, lack excitement, and are easily distracted.

Productivity Lab tackles this head on by offering regular reflection workshops to keep you aligned with your life vision, hosting focused study sessions, and by designing the Lab to be engaging & fun every step of the way.

With Productivity Lab there‚Äôll be no need to make excuses. Just progress.

How will productivity Lab help me improve my focus and do more of what matters to me? üß™

We lack focus when we‚Äôre unintentional about how we use our time.

Productivity Lab helps you to be more intentional by giving you a framework and structure to design your week and do more of the things you truly care about.

Whether that‚Äôs by attending a co-working session, a reflection workshop, or getting guidance from a productivity coach, we‚Äôll help you build a life you love.

The result: More focus, better work and greater productivity.

How much does Productivity Lab cost?

Pricing a product is tricky.

This is especially true for something like Productivity Lab where it's not just a course, or a system, or a community. It's all three.

But, after months of building this, I think we‚Äôve created something pretty cool. And I‚Äôm super happy how things have shaped up after all the feedback we‚Äôve been getting from our members.

So, when we re-launch Productivity Lab at the end of the week I‚Äôm offering you a chance to join as an early member of the Lab - before prices likely increase at the end of the year - for just $19/week ($997 per year).

But here's my promise: Join now, and your price is locked in. No future hikes for you.

Plus, to sweeten the deal, I‚Äôm going to offer you my final ever launch discount for Productivity Lab, saving you a tonne of money if you get access within the first couple of days.

But more on that later üëÄ

How long do I get access to Productivity Lab for?

Productivity Lab is an annual membership. When you purchase your membership, you automatically get access for a whole year (12 months) üéâ

Hopefully, we covered all the questions you had about Productivity Lab üòú

But, if you have any more questions about the Lab, hit reply and we‚Äôll try to get back to you ASAP.

Talk soon!

Ali xx

Sent with ‚ù§Ô∏è from Ali Abdaal Ltd.

16-19 Eastcastle Street , Fitzrovia, London, W1W 8DY, United Kingdom

Thanks so much for giving Buzzsprout a spin. You can verify your email by visiting the link below.

------------------------------------------------------------          
Verify your email: https://www.buzzsprout.com/my/profile/email/verify/62a7e77c6631de7c5aaf6e33145abc99
------------------------------------------------------------


------------------------
New to podcasting?
------------------------
Check out our How to Make a Podcast Guide. The guide walks you through the entire process from coming up with an idea, to purchasing equipment, recording your first episodes, and promoting your podcast.

http://www.buzzsprout.com/how-to-make-a-podcast


------------------------
Have questions about podcasting with Buzzsprout?
------------------------
We're happy to help you with any podcasting questions you may have. Just click the "Contact Support" link at the top of any Buzzsprout screen or reply to this email and request a call back. 


Happy podcasting,
Buzzsprout

Subject: Edit your podcast like a word doc
Body Text:
If you've got a backspace key, you can edit audio in Descript.
Descript 
( https://clicks.descript.com/f/a/tabdUWaeNdu7nsPykuUigA~~/AAQRxQA~/RgRopNfPP0RbaHR0cHM6Ly93d3cuZGVzY3JpcHQuY29tLz91dG1fY2FtcGFpZ249b25ib2FyZGluZ19lZGl0aW5nJnV0bV9tZWRpdW09ZW1haWwmdXRtX3NvdXJjZT1icmF6ZVcDc3BjQgpmu89SwmaAVQFbUhhhaWNvYWNoaW5nMjAyNUBnbWFpbC5jb21YBAAAAjM~ )
           If you've got a backspace key, you can edit audio in
Descript. And it's loaded with magical editing features that will
save you from touching the timeline, ever. Like these.



Remove filler words 
( https://clicks.descript.com/f/a/leqOXAv0XWbbg5H96xoXEw~~/AAQRxQA~/RgRopNfPP0RQaHR0cHM6Ly9oZWxwLmRlc2NyaXB0LmNvbS9oYy9lbi11cy9hcnRpY2xlcy8xMDE2NDgwNjM5NDUwOS1SZW1vdmluZy1maWxsZXItd29yZHNXA3NwY0IKZrvPUsJmgFUBW1IYYWljb2FjaGluZzIwMjVAZ21haWwuY29tWAQAAAIz )
             Instantly remove filler words

Descript automatically detects and removes filler
words, whether you've said "umm" once, 100 times, or more times
than you want to count. It also smooths edit boundaries to make
the cuts sound natural.

Instantly remove filler words

Descript automatically detects and removes filler
words, whether you've said "umm" once, 100 times, or more times
than you want to count. It also smooths edit boundaries to make
the cuts sound natural.





Edit audio 
( https://clicks.descript.com/f/a/A7nFEtUu17XN0WpEbGrtzw~~/AAQRxQA~/RgRopNfPP0RUaHR0cHM6Ly9oZWxwLmRlc2NyaXB0LmNvbS9oYy9lbi11cy9hcnRpY2xlcy8xMDE2NDg3MjAxNzkzMy1EZWxldGluZy12cy1pZ25vcmluZy10ZXh0VwNzcGNCCma7z1LCZoBVAVtSGGFpY29hY2hpbmcyMDI1QGdtYWlsLmNvbVgEAAACMw~~ )
             Tap delete to edit audio

Editing your video is as easy as editing a doc. Just
highlight the parts where you stumbled over your words, or that
you just need to cut for time. Press delete. That‚Äôs it ‚Äî Descript
will edit it out of your video and keep everything aligned.

Tap delete to edit audio

Editing your video is as easy as editing a doc. Just
highlight the parts where you stumbled over your words, or that
you just need to cut for time. Press delete. That‚Äôs it ‚Äî Descript
will edit it out of your video and keep everything aligned.





Correct your transcript 
( https://clicks.descript.com/f/a/Ss658FHdlHo776khrUfNEg~~/AAQRxQA~/RgRopNfPP0RVaHR0cHM6Ly9oZWxwLmRlc2NyaXB0LmNvbS9oYy9lbi11cy9hcnRpY2xlcy8xMDExOTYxMzYwOTIyOS1Db3JyZWN0aW5nLXlvdXItdHJhbnNjcmlwdFcDc3BjQgpmu89SwmaAVQFbUhhhaWNvYWNoaW5nMjAyNUBnbWFpbC5jb21YBAAAAjM~ )
             Quickly correct your transcript

A perfect transcript is a few clicks away. Just put
your text cursor over any word that‚Äôs misspelled,
mis-capitalized, or needs punctuation changes, then type your
corrections the same way you would in a doc.

Quickly correct your transcript

Subject: Free ghostwriting guide üëÄ
Body Text:
Hey!

Are you looking to land your first high-paying ghostwriting
client so you can finally start monetizing your writing skills?

If so, you‚Äôre in luck!

We spent the last month creating a 3-step Ultimate Guide on how
to generate organic leads as a ghostwriter:

* A proven content strategy you can use to attract your ideal
client (and why you shouldn‚Äôt be aiming to go viral).
‚Äã
* How to use social platforms to engage with target clients in
your niche (in only 30 minutes a day).
‚Äã
* Nurture your warm leads over DMs (and not waste your precious
time sending 100s of cold DMs every week).
‚Äã
* The little-known (but highly effective) pitching technique
working on social media right now.

And tons more!

These are the exact frameworks Dickie (my co-founder) and I have
used to build an organic lead gen flywheel for ourselves and our
businesses.

And now, we‚Äôre giving them away for FREE!

-----------------------------------------------------------------
To get early access, follow Cole, like the Tweet below, and then
reply ‚Äúüëª‚Äù‚Äîwe‚Äôll send you a copy (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/d0uxmll85xa0h4xm53zumhz4xe244al/m2h7h6u86dm3rmhl/aHR0cHM6Ly90YXB0aGUubGluay9nSDJFbzRUaWo=
)‚Äã
-----------------------------------------------------------------

‚Äã

Not on Twitter? No problem! You can also get access to the
Ultimate Guide through this LinkedIn Post (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/d0uxmll85xa0h4xm53zumhz4xe244al/dphehmu09l8e35il/aHR0cHM6Ly90YXB0aGUubGluay8xcHF1am9iSk0=
)‚Äîjust don't forget to complete all the steps :)
-----------------------------------------------------------------

So, go ahead and do that‚Äîand then let us know how you like the
Guide!

Happy ghostwriting!

-Dickie & Cole

From: Dr. Evan Academics West <drevan@academicswest.com>
Sent: Tuesday, January 15, 2019 2:34 PM
To: AWFTSTAFF <awftstaff@NETORG3687262.onmicrosoft.com>; AWPTSTAFF <awptstaff@NETORG3687262.onmicrosoft.com>
Subject: Fw: Exam review CIA strategies to consider for students taking exams




Dear staff,



As we enter the winter exam cycle I wanted to send out some suggestions to help prepare students for exams.  I am, as always, available to discuss any CIA strategy with you.  Please speak with a student‚Äôs educational clinician as well to review SAP data.



  1.  Exams should not be weighted to damage a student‚Äôs final grade; rather, it should give them a chance to raise their grade.  We will try and come up with a program-wide policy for exam weight so stay tuned.



  1.  Exams should be constructed as ‚Äúa mile wide but only a foot deep‚Äù.  Exams should be a general review of material without the same granular focus as a typical quiz or test.





  1.  Remember the triple threat. Exams really require distributive learning (remember 13 from playbook also referred to as 10-24-7). They must start reviewing as soon as possible and make sure they do ‚Äúcircuit training‚Äù. Meaning, don‚Äôt start studying a single topic at a time. They need to do multiple subjects a day so they don‚Äôt start, for example, studying math the day or even two days before the math exam.



  1.  Materials management: Review should start with organizing papers. Separate and organize tests, quizzes, important reference material, etc. and throw-out unnecessary papers. Simply by doing this students tend to ‚Äúclear the cobwebs‚Äù and remind them of old material.



  1.  Teacher profile: students in CIA class should review each teacher‚Äôs profile. How do they tend to test? What format? Where do they tend to pull material from?



  1.  Review should take into account learning style (refer to SAP). Is a student better Mindmapping for review or extensive discussion?  If they have weaker working memory or processing they will need more constant review. Does the teacher make the study guide or is that better done by the student to reinforce material (this can even be done as a group: students share their guides with each other and perhaps compile a master guide).  Lots of ways to go ‚Äì just keep in mind the student‚Äôs profile.



  1.  Self-test!  Remember . . . ‚Äútake the test before you take the test‚Äù.  Students must (either student constructed or teacher developed) take a practice test (again, see teacher profile) before the actual exam.



I know this is not an exhaustive review of exam prep, but I hope it gets the juices flowing as we formalize our exam process.



Best,



Evan Flamenbaum, DSW

Director

Academics West, LLC

37 West 65th street, Fifth floor

New York, NY 10023

www.academicswest.com

(212) 580-0080 X2



Web<http://academicswest.com/> | Facebook<http://www.facebook.com/academicswest.llc> | Schedule a Tour or Consultation Call<https://academicswest.simplybook.me/v2/> |LinkedIn<https://www.linkedin.com/company/academics-west-llc>

Subject: Principal Data Scientist I positions available, Candace Grant
ü•≥ A Reminder To Celebrate The Small Wins
Body Text:
Hey Candace,

I‚Äôve decided to make a late change to what I was going to write
about this week. Earlier today one of my team shared an Instagram
story with me that I‚Äôd posted back in January 2018, celebrating
the fact that I‚Äôd finally reached 2500 subscribers.

Not 250,000. Not 25,000. But 2,500.

It seems a little surreal looking back on that now. I was going
through a particularly intense period with my degree and hitting
2500 subs felt like a significant moment in my YouTube journey.
At that time, I was celebrating subscriber growth in increments
of 100 so just going past that 2.5k mark really meant a lot.

Seeing that screenshot reminded me about the importance of
celebrating your wins, regardless of how big or small they might
seem when you‚Äôre looking back on your journey.

I‚Äôve seen it with our PTYA (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/n4u4z20wxvavhx8drn5u6h6d4xgggsl/owhkhwurzxv38rbq/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cucHR5YS5jb20vcGFydC10aW1lLXlvdXR1YmVyLWFjYWRlbXkvP3V0bV9jYW1wYWlnbj1zbWFsbHdpbnNfMTEyMjUmdXRtX21lZGl1bT1lbWFpbCZ1dG1fc291cmNlPWNyZWF0b3Jub3Rlcw==
) students too when they share their wins in the community - from
getting 500 views, passing 1000 subscribers or getting monetised,
all the way to celebrating larger milestones like getting a
silver play button for passing 100k subs.

Each one of these milestones is significant in its own right for
whatever stage of the journey you‚Äôve reached but if you don‚Äôt
stop to appreciate them, you‚Äôll quickly lose the enjoyment,
enthusiasm and energy you need to stay consistent on YouTube.

But the thing is - it‚Äôs easy to forget to just stop and
celebrate.

It‚Äôs easy to reach one milestone then immediately chase the next
one, especially on YouTube where view or subscriber numbers are
everywhere you look.

And it‚Äôs easy to fall into the trap of measuring your success by
these metrics. While metrics have their place, this Instagram
story reminded me that the journey is even more important than
the number itself.

I also wanted to share the screenshot because I know that
sometimes it might be difficult to relate to a larger channel if
you‚Äôre just starting out. I get that and I wanted to show that I
was once at the start of the journey, celebrating subscriber
gains in increments of 100 and just focussing on making my videos
1% better every time and gradually improving every week.

And it didn‚Äôt take long for things to compound. In fact, it was
only a couple of years after this Instagram story that I passed 1
million subscribers on YouTube (and my celebrations for that
milestone were actually a very similar Instagram photo üòÖ).

So this week it's just a short reminder to make sure you take the
time to celebrate those wins or milestones regardless of where
you are along the YouTube journey.

Have a great week creating content and I'll speak to you soon.

Ali xx

Subject: Develop smarter with JetBrains tools
Body Text:
Hello Candace,

Thank you for choosing JetBrains development tools!

We have prepared some useful information to help you apply the great functionalities of our tools to your daily development, and assist you to better manage your licenses.
Product Technical Support

We have prepared an online resource for each of our products to help you develop using our tools, including Tech support portal [ https://www.jetbrains.com/support ], Community Forums [ https://intellij-support.jetbrains.com/hc/en-us/community/topics/ ], Plug-in Repository [ https://plugins.jetbrains.com/ ], Webinars [ https://www.jetbrains.com/support/webinars/ ], Product demos [ https://www.youtube.com/user/JetBrainsTV ], and more. If you have any questions regarding our products, please reply to this email or submit your request [ https://www.jetbrains.com/support/ ] at the "Support Home" of the corresponding product.
License Management

With JetBrains Account system [ https://account.jetbrains.com/licenses/ ], you can manage all your licenses and purchase details under one account. If you have licenses in separate accounts, we can help you merge them. If you need any help, please feel free to reply to this email.

Learn how to deliver and activate IDE or .NET tool licenses [ https://www.jetbrains.com/store/post-purchase/ ]
Technological developments

JetBrains tools combine the most popular and modern technologies. We also make available a range of blogs, newsletters, tutorials and other learning resources on a regular basis, to help you adopt these technologies and effectively use them together with JetBrains tools. You can subscribe to:
- Monthly Newsletter [ https://www.jetbrains.com/newsletter/ ]: Have JetBrains Newsletter delivered directly to your inbox each month.
- Company Blog [ https://blog.jetbrains.com/ ]: Receive information about the most up-to-date JetBrains company news and specific product updates.


Yours truly,
The JetBrains Team
https://www.jetbrains.com
The Drive to Develop

Subject: Lesson 5 Free Beginner SQL Course
Body Text:
View this post on the web at https://jessramosdata.substack.com/p/lesson-5-free-beginner-sql-course

Got BDE?‚ö°Ô∏è
Hi BDEs! Welcome to Lesson 5 of the free Big SQL Energy Beginner Course‚ö°Ô∏è Today we‚Äôre learning how to check the data type of a column and convert data types with CAST!
If you‚Äôre enjoying this course, share on social media and tag me and lmk what you think so far! I want to hear from YOU! ‚ù§Ô∏è
If you‚Äôre new here, I‚Äôm Jess Ramos, the founder of Big Data Energy and the creator of the BEST SQL course and community: Big SQL Energy‚ö°Ô∏è. Check me out on socials: üîóLinkedIn [ https://substack.com/redirect/a86e3cbe-3c52-4fd2-a5ad-0f087c6d8aeb?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ], üîóInstagram [ https://substack.com/redirect/8684f9b9-91dd-4bbf-859d-ac512d9507d3?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ], üîóYouTube [ https://substack.com/redirect/aa304626-2e79-4459-8d34-eadb529742e7?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ], and üîóTikTok [ https://substack.com/redirect/f1b75d2b-621f-40fe-8ab2-ae024522de01?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ].
Big SQL Energy Intermediate is an intermediate SQL course designed to solve real business problems hands-on using realistic data and a modern tech stack. You‚Äôll walk away with 2 SQL portfolio projects, portfolio building guidance, access to the Big Data Energy Discord community, and lots of confidence for you upcoming coding interviews. This course is all of the most important things I‚Äôve learned on the job as a Senior Data Analyst in tech who grew from a $72K salary to over a $150K salary. And now I‚Äôm sharing it with YOU!
                                  Use code Jan2025 for 20% off for all of January!
But if you‚Äôre here for the free BEGINNER Big SQL Energy course, the next lesson for you is below! ‚¨áÔ∏è
Lesson 0: Intro & Getting Started
üé• Video [ https://substack.com/redirect/1e9ac445-094e-43cc-91a7-9d6abe4b1e27?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ]
Before you start, you‚Äôll need access to any IDE (integrated development environment) for SQL of your choosing. I highly recommend using a üîóHex data science notebook [ https://substack.com/redirect/fc141397-1f24-4a6e-b34a-e58ab96e7873?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ] because it‚Äôs easy to get started with and stored in the cloud‚Äî so no headaches to download and set up. However, you can alternatively use DBeaver, MySQL Workbench, SSMS, or any others if you‚Äôd prefer. Just import the dataset used in the lesson, and you‚Äôre ready to go! Remember, if you get stuck or experience errors, ChatGPT and Gemini are great resources to learn about syntax and help you debug. Alright, let‚Äôs get started!
üîó Join Hex Data Science Notebooks: https://app.hex.tech/signup/big-data-energy [ https://substack.com/redirect/fc141397-1f24-4a6e-b34a-e58ab96e7873?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ]
üîó Datasets (Orders & Customers): https://github.com/jessramosdata/big-sql-energy-beginner [ https://substack.com/redirect/de131ab6-cd79-464f-8198-08b9ac62ef67?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ]
Lesson 5: Data Types & Cast
üé• Video [ https://substack.com/redirect/f4408c69-654c-4e02-8b09-89885dc74981?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ]
Think about all the different kinds of data that exists out there‚Ä¶
A list of customers with their names, address, and phone numbers. 
A chart of patients with all their health data like weight, height, and age. 
Stock data with prices for every date this year. 
There‚Äôs a huge variety of data in the real world that results in different formats in the database. Some of the main ones are:
String / Varchar: text data like a name, address, or customer feedback text box
Integers: whole numbers without decimal places like age, number of people, or subscription count (you can‚Äôt have 1.35 people or 67.98 subscriptions!)
Decimals: numbers with decimal places like price, revenue, or rainfall amount
Dates: Date values without a timestamp like 2024-01-03
Datetimes: Date values with a timestamp like 2024-01-03 03:09:26
Many of these data types have additional formatting options that are optional where you can specify the date format, max characters in a string, and even the number of decimal places to keep in a decimal number. For these, I just Google as I need them! All you have to do is figure out the correct format for what you‚Äôre looking for, do a few tests in SQL, and QA to make sure you really did what you meant to.
There are also a bunch of subcategories for data types as well that can be even more niche and specific, but you really don‚Äôt need to know all of them. If you ever have a use case for them, you can just do a quick google or ChatGPT to figure out which one you need. I promise you don‚Äôt need to memorize ALL the different formats. Just understand what they mean and be ready to google, apply, and test (QA) as needed! Being a good data analyst (especially senior!) is being able to figure things out and apply examples to your scenario.
Now that we have an understanding of the different data types we might experience in a database, let‚Äôs talk about some real stuff for a second. Have you ever heard of data cleaning? Chances are, you‚Äôve heard jokes about it because it‚Äôs a huge part of a data analyst‚Äôs job (and a huge pain in the B.U.T.T.), but you might not know what it is. One common issue in a database is that data can be imported or loaded into a database in incorrect formats (or maybe the data was just incorrect in the first place at the source). For example, a date might be showing up as a string, an integer might be showing up as a decimal, or a string might be showing up as an integer.
Why does this matter? Well sometimes we need to clean up field so they look better and more appropriate in the output, but more commonly, we need to convert datatypes in order to use them in relevant functions. For example, only dates can be used in date functions, so if your data imported as text, you might be out of luck using that date function. (You‚Äôll get an error about an incorrect data type and need to convert it to fix it and use it in the function. This caused me MANY headaches as a new data analyst, so let‚Äôs learn how to fix it!).
(BTW if you‚Äôre new to functions in SQL, functions basically mean you put something IN and get something OUT. You put in values or columns (called inputs or arguments) and you get out some sort of output based on what the function does)
We can use the CAST() function to convert values & fields between data types. Here‚Äôs some examples below:
select 
   cast(order_date, varchar),    --converts date to string/varchar
   cast(coupon, integer),        --converts decimal to integer
   cast(order_date, datetime),   --converts date to datetime
   cast(price, decimal)          --converts integer to decimal
from 
   orders;
***Note the CAST function syntax may differ slightly between dialects and platforms. ChatGPT if needed!
Here‚Äôs a secret insider secret if you don‚Äôt wanna look like a newbie:
A lot of newer cloud platforms (like Snowflake) support a shorthand notion of CAST with 2 colons (::) after the value or column name.
select 
   order_date::varchar), 
   coupon::integer, 
   order_date::datetime, 
   price::decimal 
from 
   orders;
Changing the data type of a column in a query doesn‚Äôt change the data type in the original source table, only creates that new version temporarily in your query. Now that we know how to convert data types in SQL, let‚Äôs move onto some other FUN functions and operations!
If you‚Äôve enjoyed the free BEGINNER Big SQL Energy course, grab my intermediate course for 20% off NOW because this deal expires February 1. There are no deadlines or timelines for this course‚Äî you start and take as long as you want. It will take your beginner skills to the next level and get you ready to ace your interviews.
DM me or email me at courses@bdeanalytics.com if you have questions on the intermediate course!
-xoxo,
jessüíï
WHO AM I?‚ö°Ô∏è
I'm Jess Ramos, a content creator, instructor, and leader in the data world. I'm super passionate about data and especially SQL‚Äî which inspired me to launch my own SQL course, Big SQL Energy! My 9-5 is being a Senior Data Analyst in tech. I'm also an Instructor with LinkedIn Learning and the founder of Big Data Energy Analytics. My 5-9 (aka outside of my regular job!) is creating amazing content for YOU on LinkedIn [ https://substack.com/redirect/a86e3cbe-3c52-4fd2-a5ad-0f087c6d8aeb?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ], Instagram [ https://substack.com/redirect/dc5d171f-c860-4b48-b639-a02344687dd2?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ], TikTok [ https://substack.com/redirect/f1b75d2b-621f-40fe-8ab2-ae024522de01?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ]-- and this newsletter!ü§©

Subject: üòâ The Goldilocks Principle of Habit Formation
Body Text:

Anyway, this week, I want to talk about habits, morning hydration, and a $5 water bottle :)

We've all heard that drinking water first thing in the morning is super important for energy levels. I've literally made videos about this. I've read the studies. I've nodded along sagely when health experts talk about it. And yet, for years, I've never managed to actually do it consistently.

It's not for lack of trying. I've bought fancy water bottles. I've set reminders. I've tried putting massive bottles by my bed. But nothing stuck. The problem was always the same - I'd wake up, see the giant bottle, think "ugh, that's a lot of water," ignore it, and make a coffee instead (it‚Äôs still liquid, right?).

But sometimes the solution to a big problem comes in a small package. In this case, a $5 plastic bottle from Muji (In case you‚Äôve never been, Muji is a Japanese retail store that sells household stuff.)

I bought it randomly while my wife Izzy was shopping for clothes. It's nothing special - just a basic 350ml bottle. I spotted the bottle while Izzy was shopping and thought "that's quite cute."

Here's what's interesting: The small size of the bottle completely changed the game. 350ml is perfect - it's about two glasses of water, which feels substantial enough to make a difference, but not so much that it feels daunting. It's like the Goldilocks of water bottles - not too big, not too small, just right.

My morning hydration system is (maybe embarrassingly) simple:

- Fill bottle before bed
- Wake up
- Actually drink the water (because it doesn't feel impossible)

I've been doing this for a few weeks now, and it's actually having a proper impact on my energy levels. Instead of coffee being the first thing to hit my system each morning, it's water. Given how dehydrated we get during sleep, this makes a lot of sense.

But here's the bigger lesson: Sometimes when we struggle to build a habit, it's not because we lack motivation or discipline. It's because we're making the task itself too daunting. We set ourselves up for failure by trying to drink from metaphorical (and literal, I guess) giant water bottles.

Breaking down your goals into smaller, more manageable chunks isn't just productivity advice - it's actually the difference between building a habit that sticks and another failed attempt at change. Whether it's drinking water, reading books, or learning a new skill, sometimes the key is to make the daily goal small enough that your brain doesn't immediately reject it.

So next time you're struggling to build a new habit, you might like to ask yourself: "Am I trying to drink from too big a bottle?"

Have a great week!

Ali xx

----------‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî

----------
# _**Welcome!**_

I hope you are well.

Here, you‚Äôll get 50 Print On Demand resources diversified across tools to use, YouTube content to learn from, newsletters or blogs, and courses.


----------‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî

----------
# _**Tools To Use**_

1. **Printful**: All-in-one print-on-demand platform with a wide range of products and integrations. 
[Link](https://www.printful.com)  

2. **Canva**: User-friendly graphic design tool for creating product designs and marketing materials. 
[Link](https://www.canva.com)  

3. **Shopify**: E-commerce platform with seamless print-on-demand integrations. 
[Link](https://www.shopify.com)  

4. **Adobe Photoshop**: Professional image editing software for creating high-quality designs.  
[Link](https://www.adobe.com/products/photoshop.html)  

5. **Printify**: Print-on-demand platform with a global network of print providers. 
[Link](https://printify.com)  

6. **Placeit**: Mockup and design tool for creating product images and marketing materials.  
[Link](https://placeit.net)  

7. **GIMP**: Free, open-source alternative to Photoshop for image editing and design.  
[Link](https://www.gimp.org)  

8. **Mailchimp:** Email marketing platform for promoting your print-on-demand products.  
[Link](https://mailchimp.com)  

9. **Oberlo**: Dropshipping app that can be used with print-on-demand products on Shopify.  
[Link](https://www.oberlo.com)  

10. **Etsy**: Online marketplace popular for selling custom and print-on-demand products.  
[Link](https://www.etsy.com)  

11. **Inkscape**: Free vector graphics software for creating scalable designs.  
[Link](https://inkscape.org)  

12. **Hootsuite**: Social media management tool for promoting your print-on-demand business.  
[Link](https://www.hootsuite.com)  

13. **Redbubble**: Artist-focused print-on-demand marketplace for selling designs on various products.  
[Link](https://www.redbubble.com)  

14. **Merch by Amazon**: Amazon's print-on-demand platform for selling designs on their marketplace. 
[Link](https://merch.amazon.com)  

15. **Affinity Designer:** Professional graphic design software, alternative to Adobe Illustrator.  
[Link](https://affinity.serif.com/en-us/designer)  

16. **Teespring**: Print-on-demand platform focused on apparel and accessories.  
[Link](https://teespring.com)  

17. **Google Analytics**: Web analytics tool for tracking your online store's performance. 
[Link](https://analytics.google.com)  

18. **Fiverr**: Freelance marketplace for hiring designers or marketers for your print-on-demand business.  
[Link](https://www.fiverr.com)  

19. **Printful Mockup Generator**: Free tool for creating product mockups with your designs.  
[Link](https://www.printful.com/mockup-generator)  

20. **Trello**: Project management tool for organizing your print-on-demand business tasks.  
[Link](https://trello.com)  

21. **Unsplash**: Free high-quality stock photo website for sourcing images for designs.  
[Link](https://unsplash.com)  

22. **Sellfy**: E-commerce platform with built-in print-on-demand capabilities.  
[Link](https://sellfy.com)  

23. **Pixlr**: Free online photo editor for quick design touch-ups and creation.  
[Link](https://pixlr.com)  

24. **Printify Mockup Generator**: Free tool for creating product mockups with Printify's catalog. 
[Link](https://printify.com/mockup-generator)  

25. **Later**: Social media scheduling tool to plan and automate your content posting.  
[Link](https://later.com)  


----------‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî

----------
# _**How It Works?**_

A **Print-on-Demand (POD)** business is an eCommerce model where products like t-shirts, mugs, posters, and more are customized and printed only after an order is placed. This eliminates the need for inventory and upfront production costs. 

‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî

**How It Works?**

1. **Choose a Niche**  
Select a specific audience or theme (e.g., dog lovers, gamers, fitness enthusiasts). Identify trends or popular topics to guide your designs.

2. **Create or Source Designs**  
Design eye-catching graphics or hire a designer. Ensure the designs align with your niche and are high quality.

3. **Select a Print-on-Demand Platform** 
Choose a platform that integrates with your store. Popular platforms include:

  1. **Printful:** Offers a wide range of products and integrations with Shopify.  

2. **Printify:** Features multiple suppliers and competitive pricing.  

3. **TeeSpring:** Provides a simple setup and social selling features.  

4. **Redbubble:** Includes a built-in marketplace for passive selling.

4. **Set Up Your Online Store**  
Use platforms like Shopify, Etsy, or WooCommerce to host your store. Integrate the POD service with your store for seamless order processing.

5. **Add Products**  
Upload your designs to the POD platform and create product listings. Add high-quality mockups and detailed descriptions to attract customers. 

6. **Market Your Products** 
Use social media, email marketing, and paid ads to reach your target audience. Leverage content marketing and influencers to build trust and drive traffic.

7. **Fulfill Orders**  
When a customer places an order, the POD platform automatically prints and ships the product directly to them.

8. **Earn Profits** 
You earn the difference between the price you set and the cost charged by the POD service. 

‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî

**Benefits of Print-on-Demand**

* **Low Startup Cost:** You don‚Äôt need to buy inventory upfront.  

* **Minimal Risk:** You only pay for products when you sell them.  

* **Customizable:** You can easily create and sell unique designs.  

* **Scalable:** The business can grow with minimal effort as orders increase.  

* **Automated Fulfillment:** POD platforms handle production and shipping for you.

‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî

**Challenges in Print-on-Demand**

1. **Lower Profit Margins**  
The cost per item is higher because each product is made individually.

2. **Dependence on Suppliers**  
Product quality and shipping times are determined by the POD platform you use.

3. **Limited Customization Options**  
Your product range is limited to what the POD supplier offers.

4. **Shipping Times**  
Production and delivery times can be longer compared to pre-stocked inventory.


----------‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî

----------
# _**Blogs and Newsletters**_

1. **Printful Blog**: Comprehensive guides and tips for running a POD business. 
[Link](https://www.printful.com/blog)  

2. **Printify Blog**: Insights on starting and growing a print-on-demand venture. 
[Link](https://printify.com/blog/)    

3. **Merch Informer**: Newsletter with Amazon Merch trends and strategies.  
[Link](https://merchinformer.com/blog/)  

4. **Michael Essek**: Blog by a successful POD entrepreneur sharing his experiences. 
[Link](https://www.michaelessek.com/blog/)  

5. **Gooten Blog**: Insights on POD trends and best practices.  
[Link](https://www.gooten.com/blog/)  

6. **Teespring Blog**: Tips for success on the Teespring platform. 
[Link](https://community.teespring.com/blog/)  

7. **Redbubble Blog**: Artist resources and POD selling tips.  
[Link](https://blog.redbubble.com/)  

8. **Teepublic Blog**: Guides for artists selling on Teepublic.  
[Link](https://www.teepublic.com/blog)  

9. **Spreadshirt Blog**: Tips for selling custom products on Spreadshirt.  
[Link](https://www.spreadshirt.com/blog/)  

10. **Printsome Blog**: Articles on t-shirt printing and POD business. 
[Link](https://www.printsome.com/blog/)  


----------‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî

----------
# _**YouTube Content**_

1. **How To Start A Luxury Clothing Brand Using Print On Demand + A.I**: [Link](https://youtu.be/BdBcWuMU66A?si=GoETfIu8TZ__Q5tr)  

2. **Beginner guide to print on demand in 2024**: [Link](https://youtu.be/hYJ2bvVlSMM?si=ZeU0Td2swsJYS8Bh)  

3. **Make 40,202 Per Month Selling Mugs With A.I: **[**Link**](https://youtu.be/kDV6iDxYBB4?si=vuR2Bh6STlfPdjIp)** **

4. **How To Do Niche Research For Print On Demand (The EASY Way)**: [Link](https://youtu.be/U_-1EiQ_lsc?si=TCsKycRv5IXFZKoT) 

5. **AI Tools To Boost Sales**: [Link](https://youtu.be/9dXHD9vwK44?si=hgjQHhW-QqMCImSY)  

6. **Tim Kou‚Äôs experience with Print on Demand**: [Link](https://youtu.be/FlvfMU08BiE?si=ueS7QyaQxF8CQQBf)  

7. **Print on Demand trends in 2025**: [Link](https://youtu.be/JA9b-hvYAMk?si=QlnefIJfHyBSXeVC)  

8. **Changes coming to Print on Demand**: [Link](https://youtu.be/AKjZKea6TR4?si=jJAefK2XQMUp7_Lt) 

9.  **The Best Print on Demand company no one talks about**: [Link](https://youtu.be/3nhpXB5tw3Y?si=pZ7VSFHIsXGTL970)  

10. **The New Way To Sell Embroidered Print on Demand Products**: [Link](https://youtu.be/LbfCBTqvUXg?si=kVZJ_lxOv72ody1M)  


----------‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî

----------
# _**Courses**_

1. **Ryan's Method: Print on Demand Course**: [Link](https://ryanhogue.com/courses/dropshipped-pod/)  

2. **Printful Academy**: [Link](https://www.printful.com/academy/courses)  

3. **Shopify Basic Course By Pixel Cozy**: [Link](https://pixelcozy.com/courses/pod-frenzy-shopify-basic-course/)  

4. **Sell Print on Demand on Etsy with Printify - Complete Guide**: [Link](https://www.skillshare.com/en/classes/sell-print-on-demand-on-etsy-with-printify-complete-guide/484074970)
