Subject: ‚ÄúThe First Data Hire‚Äù Series: How to Survive and Succeed as a Solo Data Leader
Body Text:
View this post on the web at https://seattledataguy.substack.com/p/the-first-data-hire-series-how-to

Hi, fellow future and current Data Leaders; Ben here üëã
I‚Äôve had a few conversations with data experts who just started a new role as a data leader or are the first data hire. This is always a challenging situation as you‚Äôve got to set expectations and have to develop much of the infrastructure yourself. So I wanted to write an article series about being the first data hire.
But before that, if you're a data leader looking to understand what is going on in the broader data world as well as elevate your leadership skills, consider signing up for my 6-Week Data Leaders Playbook Accelerator program [ https://substack.com/redirect/1f1784bf-0794-4bda-aa4b-c16b9b8b757e?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ] that I will be running in September!
Now, let‚Äôs jump into the article!
Being the first data hire is one of the most common (and chaotic) experiences I hear about from data engineers and analysts.
Sometimes you‚Äôre the first hire for the entire company. Other times, you‚Äôre brought in to support a single department. Either way, the situation tends to feel the same: exciting, overwhelming, and a little bit absurd.
On one hand, you have a blank slate. You get to build what you think matters. On the other, there‚Äôs no process, no standards, and everyone wants something from you, yesterday.
Leadership might assume you‚Äôll wave a magic wand and spin up the same infrastructure they had at their last company, where a 20-person team shipped real-time dashboards and full-blown applications already integrated with AI and delivering insights.
Meanwhile, you‚Äôre one person staring down 30 semi-automated workflows cobbled together in Google Sheets, Access, and a random script Terry developed back in 2018. Plus a backlog of 100+ requests from people who don‚Äôt know what they want, only that they want it now.
So, where do you start?
That‚Äôs what this article is about. Whether you're new to the role or just walked into another "first hire‚Äù situation, I‚Äôll walk through the most common mistakes, the frameworks I‚Äôve seen work, and how to prioritize projects when everyone‚Äôs asking for everything.
SeattleDataGuy‚Äôs Newsletter is a reader-supported publication. To receive new posts and support my work, consider becoming a free or paid subscriber.
Mistakes New Data Leaders Make
Before we get into what to do, let‚Äôs talk about what not to do. These are some of the most common mistakes I see new data leaders make. I‚Äôm sure there are more, if you‚Äôve experienced this, feel free to share your own below so others can learn from them, too.
Trying to Solve Every Problem for Every Leader at Once
One of the biggest traps early on is trying to please everyone. I recently spoke with a data leader about how to juggle requests from half a dozen stakeholders [ https://substack.com/redirect/953d7059-ef95-42ca-a0f7-99890cf2b1e8?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ] with no clear priorities and nowhere near enough bandwidth.
Sure, hiring more help is ideal. But realistically, you‚Äôll hit a point where you have to make tough calls. You can‚Äôt solve every problem. And more importantly, you shouldn‚Äôt have to. You need to communicate who you can and can‚Äôt support. What will and won‚Äôt be done. Just because you can try to track a dozen levers and metrics doesn‚Äôt mean you should. The challenge here is, when you‚Äôre the new data leader, people will come to you. They will have long lists, they will try to find ways to become a priority, whether what they want aligns with the business goals or not. I can promise you, it will be overwhelming all while you‚Äôre trying to wrap your head around the companies data infrastructure [ https://substack.com/redirect/82b76f82-2912-4148-816d-4ce5c0e9fb1c?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ]. 
When you‚Äôre first getting started, focus on discovery. Interview key stakeholders, learn their goals, and figure out which ones align with broader business objectives and have an interest in partnering with you.
>From there, build a simple prioritization matrix to help you decide where to focus your time and who you‚Äôre realistically able to help.
Neglecting to Build Relationships
No matter who you end up supporting, building strong relationships across the business is non-negotiable.
It‚Äôs tempting to hunker down and focus on delivering dashboards or machine learning models [ https://substack.com/redirect/7f41f13a-0f2f-4db1-ab00-a59594652c0a?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ]. But shipping alone isn‚Äôt enough, those tools still need to be used, integrated, and maintained. If you‚Äôre building a dashboard, who‚Äôs going to embed it into the workflow? Do they even know you‚Äôre working on it?
Beyond implementation, relationships help surface better problems to solve. When you‚Äôre regularly talking with stakeholders, outside of just gathering requirements, you‚Äôll start to hear the real challenges they‚Äôre facing. The ones they may not mention in a formal request. That‚Äôs where some of your most valuable, creative work can come from.
Focus Purely on Tooling
I‚Äôve said this before, but it‚Äôs worth repeating: building infra for the sake of infra is a great way to never deliver anything the business needs [ https://substack.com/redirect/3ddef29f-e489-4c88-80de-a45e908dbba3?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ]. It‚Äôs also a great way to lose trust.
I‚Äôve seen teams go all-in on the ‚Äúperfect‚Äù architecture or the latest tool, only to emerge weeks later with a solution no one asked for. Or worse, a dashboard with numbers the business doesn‚Äôt trust.
If you don‚Äôt bring stakeholders along for the ride, don‚Äôt be surprised when they question the output. Technical elegance doesn‚Äôt matter if the business can‚Äôt use (or believe in) what you‚Äôve built.
Guiding Principles for a Startup Data Strategy
Now that we‚Äôve covered what not to do, let‚Äôs talk about principles you can use to better approach building your data infrastructure.
Also, if you‚Äôd like, I recently ran a live webinar discussing this very topic!
Start Simple, Focus on Value
It sounds obvious, but it‚Äôs easy to forget: most businesses don‚Äôt need the perfect infrastructure, they need answers.
I‚Äôve seen too many teams chase perfection when all the business needed was a handful of reliable metrics. 
I mean, the amount of times a pivot table would have answered more questions that the overly complex dashboard the data team did end up developing‚Ä¶
In many cases, you can get by with something as simple as a replica of your database and run your analytics from there, and that‚Äôs more than fine to start with.
Hype is not a data strategy. [ https://substack.com/redirect/7796e08c-9007-4100-af69-a737d3f65148?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ]
Balance Speed and Scalability
If you‚Äôre the first data hire, the business will likely have:
A lot of requests
No process for how to actually use data
So your job early on isn‚Äôt to build a full-blown data warehouse [ https://substack.com/redirect/65947ef1-acff-42dc-ae43-374aa551713c?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ]. It‚Äôs to find simple, practical ways to use data to move the business forward.
Start by delivering a few key reports or even just a light analysis that give insights into things the company can‚Äôt currently see or can‚Äôt answer. For example:
Churn is higher than expected - Can you answer why and which segments are actually churning or at the highest risk to?
Customer acquisition costs are trending up - figure out if certain channels are underperforming or if marketing spend isn‚Äôt aligned with high-LTV [ https://substack.com/redirect/b7978cb0-c4fb-4792-a09f-f3c2cf1a602f?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ] customers, and suggest reallocations.
Inventory levels are inconsistent across systems - trace how data flows from suppliers to warehouse and POS, identify where mismatches occur, and work with operations to fix broken processes or integrations.
That way the business gets familiar with using data and you get familiar with the data that represents the business.
Trust and quality > quantity
There are a lot of conversations around the speed of development for data team [ https://substack.com/redirect/99587289-a148-4f3c-9843-a2733aee5c73?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ]. Yes, leadership wants insights fast, but constantly churning out dashboards with bad or inconsistent data is a quick way to lose trust.
Whether you‚Äôre generating AI SQL slop or just turning your data team into a dashboard factory.
The more dashboards and data products you create, the more likely it is that things won‚Äôt reconcile. So even if the business is asking for 100 dashboards, take a step back and consider the following:
A 1,000-person company probably doesn‚Äôt need 100 dashboards
Multiple dashboards tracking the same metric with slight differences only create confusion
Every dashboard you build adds to your maintenance and overhead
It‚Äôs easy to fall into the ‚Äúmore is better‚Äù mindset when you‚Äôre the first data hire. I know that was me! But more can mean distraction, inconsistency, and a never-ending cycle of upkeep. 
Finding The Right Projects
Finding meaningful projects starts with a deep understanding of the business [ https://substack.com/redirect/0765b0c1-12f0-457d-a5da-4f96aa2a23c1?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ]. As data engineers and analysts, we have unique access to core metrics [ https://substack.com/redirect/a4ff6b8e-ac96-4b49-9aa9-647dd84c2f7f?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ] and raw data, giving us the tools to ask better questions and uncover insights others might miss.
The key is taking a moment to pause and reflect, rather than defaulting to shipping pipelines and dashboards. Ask questions about the data and how it connects to business outcomes.
For instance, if you work at a Starbucks, McDonald‚Äôs, or a Cava-type restaurant, a core metric might be comparable store sale [ https://substack.com/redirect/3009a937-b0d8-4c13-a0c0-e50a9754f9b9?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ]s. In a hotel, it‚Äôs probably Occupancy and average daily rate. But knowing the metrics isn‚Äôt enough, you need to understand what moves it.
Ask yourself:
What factors actually impact occupancy?
Was there a clear reason it dropped this week, like seasonality, a storm, or a local event?
Are competitors pricing lower?
If we reduced prices, would we see an increase?
If you‚Äôre still trying to figure out how to find the right projects, I‚Äôve written a near chapter‚Äôs worth of content here [ https://substack.com/redirect/122d9f24-65a6-418e-b119-9e6b93d9569e?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ].
Getting Buy-In
During your first month(or in some cases just the first few weeks), you‚Äôll probably get a bit of grace. People expect you to ramp up, learn the business, and identify gaps and opportunities. But soon enough, you‚Äôll need to start delivering value, and that means getting buy-in for projects.
Congrats‚Ä¶you‚Äôre in sales [ https://substack.com/redirect/420f8125-ac4c-4969-81c9-07e8246313e7?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ]!
Wes Kao  said it well in her interview with Lenny Rachitsky  : a lot of us get so caught up in logistics, we forget to focus on the sales.
The Abstract Is Hard: You‚Äôve heard ‚Äúshow, don‚Äôt tell.‚Äù Even if you can clearly explain your project, it helps a lot to show a tangible mock-up. Visuals reduce ambiguity and make your work easier to rally behind. I enjoyed the way Shachar Meir [ https://substack.com/redirect/b581df88-0a1a-4019-9209-87979fd98db9?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ] put it describing 1-hour, 1-day, or 1-month versions. If you can build an initial version of something in an hour so people can see it and understand the value you can get far more buy-in.
Anchor to Pain Points: People buy into solutions when they clearly solve something painful. I know, we all have the same inclination to lead with WHAT and HOW we‚Äôll be using to solve the problem instead of WHY it even matters. Sadly this requires us to have some empathy and understand, well, other people and their needs. Instead of ‚ÄúWe should build a churn dashboard,‚Äù try: ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre losing 15% of customers each quarter, here‚Äôs a quick analysis on why.‚Äù Now the value of a deeper project is obvious.
Enlist Champions: Find someone influential who feels the pain your project solves. If they‚Äôre excited, they can help champion the idea internally and build momentum with peers or leadership. I know it can be tempting to try to solve every problem on your own. But the world, fun fact, does not revolve around you and other people would love to help(as long as you can show them why they also benefit).
Celebrate and Communicate Early Wins: Some people wait too long to share progress. Don‚Äôt. As your team hits milestones, keep stakeholders in the loop. Let your champions know, and keep reinforcing the momentum. (Let‚Äôs be honest, some execs ride a single win for months. You can too, as long as you‚Äôre building on it.)
Frame Options with Trade-Offs: Sometimes, buy-in stalls because stakeholders can‚Äôt decide. I mean, they likely feel like they have dozens of options. Should they invest in project A, B, C, Z? What could be the consequences of said decisions? Make it easier for them by presenting options: ‚ÄúWe can do X in one week or Y in three weeks with more depth.‚Äù This gives them a sense of control and shows you understand time and resource constraints.
Communicating and Aligning with Stakeholders
As you start completing projects and pitching new ones, your ability to communicate clearly becomes just as important as your technical skills. I recently wrote an article abut this so you can check it out below.
Final Thoughts
Being the first data hire isn‚Äôt rare, and it‚Äôs definitely not easy. When I posted about this recently, more than a few people reached out to share their own experiences. It‚Äôs a tough spot to be in, but far from impossible.
The key is setting expectations early. Otherwise, you risk becoming a dashboard machine, cranking out reports no one actually uses.
I‚Äôll be writing a follow-up piece soon on what I‚Äôve seen work as companies start building out their data teams. If you‚Äôve been through it yourself, I‚Äôd love to hear ‚Äã‚Äãwhat worked (or didn‚Äôt) for you.
As always, thanks for reading!
Don‚Äôt Miss Out On These 6 Free Data Leader Webinars Coming Up In July
What Every Data Leader Gets Wrong About Optimization [ https://substack.com/redirect/4b87143c-6bee-47a4-9994-20c78cc4aa36?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ] with Paul Stroup [ https://substack.com/redirect/220c6229-a373-482b-8ce4-0ee91db68b74?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ]
Building Streaming Pipelines for Real-Time Analytics [ https://substack.com/redirect/157634fb-32e1-4308-a786-6e960ada8735?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ] with Istv√°n Kov√°cs [ https://substack.com/redirect/cec24755-e33c-4bc6-9d19-be1d58f800d8?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ]
>From Reactive to Proactive: Managing Stakeholders to Unlock Strategic Data Work [ https://substack.com/redirect/97cf0796-9190-41d8-9bfd-0fe3a3de86a2?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ] with Celina Wong [ https://substack.com/redirect/80c88a95-0d97-47a4-9c46-da2dfd7d025e?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ]
Building A Data Unicorn  [ https://substack.com/redirect/d7c8b8a4-c24d-464f-a364-0c34ecbbf8de?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ]With Veronika Durgin [ https://substack.com/redirect/ccfd9ef8-2a16-4af9-8a41-50ec49ff804a?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ]
Integrating ML Workflows Into Data Pipelines [ https://substack.com/redirect/3e939d59-b3bf-45e6-be50-836a6f020fb7?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ] with Jeff Nemecek [ https://substack.com/redirect/baad3871-fc94-45df-8a44-b2294d444f68?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ]
Beyond the First Use Case - Building Data Platforms and Processes for Long-Term Adoption  [ https://substack.com/redirect/40fb4a19-1733-456b-acfa-91fe54d12a48?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ]with Patrick Taggart [ https://substack.com/redirect/e110627f-5091-4049-931d-a889c9e625a8?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ]
Join My Technical Consultants Community
If you‚Äôre a data consultant or considering becoming one then you should join the Technical Freelancer Community! We have over 1700 members!
You‚Äôll find plenty of free resources you can access to expedite your journey as a technical consultant as well as be able to talk to other consultants about questions you may have!
Articles Worth Reading
There are thousands of new articles posted daily all over the web! I have spent a lot of time sifting through some of these articles as well as TechCrunch and companies tech blog and wanted to share some of my favorites!
The End is Nigh (Again)
By Joe Reis  
It‚Äôs that time again in the zeitgeist where the end is nigh for programming languages and practices. The last couple of months have felt like a coordinated campaign to declare things like SQL, R, data engineering, BI, analytics, and more as dead or obsolete. Why now? Maybe it‚Äôs the changing of the seasons. Maybe it‚Äôs the uncertainty about what AI does to our field and tools. Or perhaps we‚Äôre once again trapped in the echo chamber of a hype cycle, where people start confusing ‚Äúwhat‚Äôs hot‚Äù with ‚Äúwhat matters.‚Äù
Read More Here [ https://substack.com/redirect/321fdc86-1544-4fd4-a077-002d6faeb5b3?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ]
Contra Ptacek's Terrible Article On AI
A few days ago, I was presented with an article [ https://substack.com/redirect/a43076d0-98f3-4f23-98ae-4ae473d79ff8?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ] titled ‚ÄúMy AI Skeptic Friends Are All Nuts‚Äù by Thomas Ptacek. I thought it was not very good, and didn't give it a second thought. To quote the formidable Baldur Bjarnason [ https://substack.com/redirect/21c3b0e9-4469-483d-86d1-f788030640ca?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ]:
‚ÄúI don‚Äôt recommend reading it, but you can if you want. It is full of half-baked ideas and shoddy reasoning.‚Äù1 [ https://substack.com/redirect/65f8c79c-99fa-482e-8cfd-2539318ed140?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ]
I have tried hard, so very hard, not to just be the guy that hates AI, even though the only thing that people want to talk to me about is the one time I ranted about AI at length [ https://substack.com/redirect/4a4c8f89-3438-4f69-9a30-533e633cf4f9?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ]. I contain multitudes, meaning that I am capable of delivering widely varied payloads of vitriol to a vast array of topics.
Read More Here [ https://substack.com/redirect/826f17a0-2934-4278-9687-b44ef84f1391?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ]
End Of Day 186
Thanks for checking out our community. We put out 4-5 Newsletters a month discussing data, tech, and start-ups.
If you enjoyed it, consider liking, sharing and helping this newsletter grow!

Subject: We‚Äôre here to help your business.
Body Text: NA

Subject: New Arrivals: Style Without Limits
5 levels to increasing your income as a ghostwriter
Body Text:
***********************
Hey there, Ghostwriter!
***********************

Welcome to the Premium Ghostwriting Blueprint‚Äîwhere every week we
help you knock down high-ticket clients as a Premium Ghostwriter
(even if you‚Äôre a full-time Freelance Writer, or you have a 9-5).

As a reminder: If you'd like to accelerate your trajectory as a
Premium Ghostwriter, don't forget to subscribe to my YouTube
channel (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/75uo4eeqwos2u2m997hzhw6mv966tn/7qh7h2uo33z2wxf9/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vQG5pY29sYXNjb2xlNzc=
). Every week, I share new videos breaking down the skills,
frameworks, & strategies you need to build a profitable writing
business with 26,000+ others.

Today we want to help you price your ghostwriting service (and
start increasing your income).
-----------------------------------------------------------------

Congratulations!

The client said YES.

‚ÄúBut how much should I charge?!‚Äù

Great question‚Äîlet‚Äôs talk money.

****************************************************
How To Think About Pricing Your Ghostwriting Service
****************************************************

There are 5 levels to increasing your income as a ghostwriter.

* Charging per word
* Charging per hour
* Charging per month
* Charging per asset
* Charging per outcome

Let‚Äôs take a brief look at each one and where you should be
thinking about positioning yourself as a Premium Ghostwriter.

Level 1: Charging Per Word
--------------------------

You want to escape this level as quickly as you can.

The fact that your value is tied to the number of words you write
means you inherently have very little long-term pricing power.

Move on.

Level 2: Charging Per Hour
--------------------------

Getting paid per hour is a simple way to be compensated‚Äîin the
beginning.

But you do NOT want to be in the business of your value being
tied to ‚Äúeffort‚Äù for long. There is no incentive to get better or
get your work done faster.

Why would you if it means you actually make less money?

Level 3: Charging Per Month
---------------------------

Is this better than being paid per word? Yes.

Is this better than being paid per hour? Usually. But getting
paid in exchange to do ‚Äúanything‚Äù the client needs is a giant
mistake‚Äîand almost always ends up earning you less than if you
had just charged hourly.

Make sure you are very specific about what you will and won‚Äôt do.

Level 4: Charging Per Asset
---------------------------

This is the correct, and most lucrative, way to monetize your
skills as a ghostwriter.

All the client cares about is whether or not you successfully did
what you said you were going to do. You create an asset (like a
5-Day Educational Email Course), and you charge a fee for the
creation of that asset.

The measure for success has nothing to do with a) your time, or
b) your effort.

Level 5: Charging Per Outcome
-----------------------------

This is the ultimate goal, and where you end up making the most
money as a ghostwriter (or Solopreneur of any kind).

The only way to increase your pricing power above Level 4 is to
share in the OUTCOME you generate. Either you participate in some
sort of profit-sharing model, or you own some equity in the
business you are helping to accelerate.

Both of these vehicles are rare, and likely not something you‚Äôre
going to unlock in the early stages of your career.

*****************************************************************
Accelerate yourself to Level 4 as quickly as possible (and
optimize for several years).
*****************************************************************

Raise your prices.

Build efficiencies.

Once you‚Äôve pushed Level 4 as far as you can, start looking for
specific, advantageous opportunities to reach up to Level 5 and
elevate yourself further by being rewarded for the outcome you
successfully generate for yourself and whomever you partner with.

Now that you know how to think about pricing, it‚Äôs time to name
your price.

**************************************
How To Price Your Ghostwriting Service
**************************************

‚Äã
To make sure you aren‚Äôt undercharging or overcharging relative to
general expectations, here are are the going rates (in a range)
of the most-popular ghostwritten services.

Ghostwriting Social Media Accounts (Twitter, LinkedIn, etc.)

* Low-end: $1,500 per month for 1-2 Tweets per day and 1 Thread
per week.
* High-end: $10,000+ per month for 2-4 Tweets per day and 2-3
Threads per week.
‚Äã

Ghostwriting Thought Leadership Articles

* Low-end: $300 per 800-word article.
* High-end: $5,000+ per 800-word article.
‚Äã

Ghostwriting Keynote Speeches

* Low-end: $3,000 per speech.
* High-end: $20,000+ per speech.
‚Äã

Ghostwriting Startup Pitches & Pitch Decks

* Low-end: $2,000 per pitch deck.
* High-end: $10,000+ per pitch deck.
‚Äã

Ghostwriting Educational Email Courses

* Low-end: $1,000 per email course.
* High-end: $5,000+ per email course.
‚Äã

Ghostwriting Landing Pages

* Low-end: $1,500 per landing page.
* High-end: $10,000+ per landing page.
‚Äã
* Ghostwriting Video Scripts* Low-end: $200 per video.
* High-end: $2,000 per video.

Ghostwriting Books & eBooks

* Low-end: $10,000 per book.
* High-end: $250,000 per book.

There are outliers for all of these‚ÄîUpwork freelancers who charge
significantly less, and celebrity writers who charge tremendously
more.

Find your service.

Name your price.

That‚Äôs it!

Dickie & Cole

Co-Founders, Premium Ghostwriting Academy

PS‚Ä¶ Want more help growing your freelance writing business
(without completely burning out)?

Then make sure to subscribe to my YouTube Channel (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/75uo4eeqwos2u2m997hzhw6mv966tn/qvhozqgwu8urqqnmolhg/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vQG5pY29sYXNjb2xlNzc=
)!

Every week I share a new video breaking down the different
frameworks we teach inside PGA to help our students become
Premium Ghostwriters.

‚ÄãIn my latest video (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/75uo4eeqwos2u2m997hzhw6mv966tn/7qh7h2uo5d0qr9f9/aHR0cHM6Ly95b3V0dS5iZS9WbHVfR3JrTEtfcz9zaT10RVlWQ19RMHJjU1ZUZ1JJ
), I explain the 7 steps I took to achieve financial freedom as a
writer:

Subject: Before you get your book, I wanted to share this...
Body Text:
Ever lost a client to a competitor you know has an inferior product to you? 
Candace,

‚ÄòWe‚Äôve decided to work with another supplier‚Äô.

Ouch.

Being replaced sucks (yeah I‚Äôve been there too).

It really isn't fun when you know you have a better product or service‚Ä¶

My company Dent
[https://pu693.keap-link020.com/v2/click/da3a71108a9f220a52710c084ba04322/eJyNj00LgkAURf_LW0t-S81ORGTQXEStQ5yBhnQcxjeBiP-9scJVQdt3zz2POwNy2UikDAgokxxCcEDzVijBJWaDxKZ9hUngJYEDnZD3Qg9GAZm_Vbd8vfqhH3sO4KS4Rc6nNCtpXVwrWpcWVY22L_7xhEEU76NNlB9TWsGy_DTzXmD-sPIRCGrD10VM2FV40Z3lb4hqJK7LLLJrh743UuBki41SXLLP6pJP7_ryBDTkXtk=] 
has worked with thousands of established entrepreneurs, to help them unpack and
package the IP so they stand out and get noticed in their industry.

Each of these entrepreneurs became the Key People of Influence for what they do.

When you become one, your customers start to see you as a vital life force in
their life, not a functional supplier.

Vital people add something a functional person doesn‚Äôt have.

Functional is...

 * Great at what you do
 * Talk the talk and walk the walk
 * But at the end of the day‚Ä¶. you are performing a role for your customer that
   is replaceable.

If someone can find a cheaper option, they will take it.

A client can replace a functional supplier. An investor can easily put their
money into someone else.

Functional does the job but functional is still interchangeable.

The word vital has 2 components to its meaning: ‚Äúirreplaceable‚Äù and the other is
‚Äúlife-force‚Äù.

Vital people are the ‚Äúirreplaceable life-force‚Äù of a project, a business, an
industry or even a cause.

They see themselves as redefining the game in some way.

They have their own unique take on things that makes them almost impossible to
overlook.

What do you want to become the irreplaceable life force in? What do you want to
be known for in your industry?

Hit reply, I‚Äôd love to know!

Cheers,

Profile Image [https://pu693.files.keap.app/pu693/bfdabd5f-591d-473e-b87c-2b5dc3546eb8]
 Mike Reid
Co-Founder & CEO Americas
mike@dent.global
www.dent.community [http://www.dent.community] 


P.S. Whenever you‚Äôre ready, here are some things you might enjoy...

1. Join one of my upcoming workshops to learn about the Key Person of Influence
strategy and how to apply it into your business. www.kpiwebclass.com

2. Request a physical copy of the KPI Book (on me). This book is a best-seller,
has been read by 100K entrepreneurs globally and will show you how to become the
go-to brand in your industry. www.becomeakpi.com

3. Take the KPI Scorecard and benchmark your strengths and weaknesses in 5 key
areas of industry influence. Get personalized recommendations based on how you
score. www.scalemyinfluence.com

Hi there,

We know inboxes get busy, so here‚Äôs a quick recap of the most popular courses launched this year so far at DeepLearning.AI.

These courses have been among the most enrolled by our community, and they cover practical skills across AI agents, RAG, vibe coding, and more:

The Batch ads and exclusive banners - 2025-05-13T182128.677 (https://info.deeplearning.ai/e3t/Ctc/LX+113/cJhC404/MW4sZBBgnWpW2mhv3r56fK6yW6B8lDm5z5V4mN2NZZ4l3prCCW8wLKSR6lZ3m4W7SDBNX65NXBHW2vqBqG1WRGTQW3h4vf03YqK7wW4KCMRQ8VNV7MW9dJB5t5t5YlfVkdYKd3G_nfBW5XRcMh7d-sjCW8lSBn21r5d8mW7nw5r25JLDF3W6SW8Ky1BfbHMW8BDl6B1LDfVcW6fJ6SF9czxt2W8f-W0b1ClXgrW1b4GJ-81T5-vW2m6dGP6H9Y-bW7MKJt96Nx9x_N7gtkZZ7hFxrW2f73Q98f6pSGN5xYJGcjzYTNW8tdH5Q625hlVW1G0NZd5r5TqJV9PxHC80ZhSyW8fglhv6VBL4zW8c0qqD8QwmcSN3CPtdwlyGCcVvrWfj3vNfzqW2ngnMC6jBfJhMJ773HJWCWRf6vnkpT04 )

MCP: Build Rich-Context AI Apps with Anthropic

In this hands-on course built in collaboration with Anthropic, you‚Äôll learn how to use the Model Context Protocol (MCP) to simplify the way AI applications connect to external systems like GitHub, Google Docs, or web content. You‚Äôll build an MCP-compatible chatbot, deploy an MCP server, and explore how this open protocol streamlines tool and data integration across LLM-based apps like Claude Desktop, making AI development more scalable and less fragmented.

Enroll for Free
(https://info.deeplearning.ai/e3t/Ctc/LX+113/cJhC404/MW4sZBBgnWpW2mhv3r56fK6yW6B8lDm5z5V4mN2NZZ4l3prCCW8wLKSR6lZ3m4W7SDBNX65NXBHW2vqBqG1WRGTQW3h4vf03YqK7wW4KCMRQ8VNV7MW9dJB5t5t5YlfVkdYKd3G_nfBW5XRcMh7d-sjCW8lSBn21r5d8mW7nw5r25JLDF3W6SW8Ky1BfbHMW8BDl6B1LDfVcW6fJ6SF9czxt2W8f-W0b1ClXgrW1b4GJ-81T5-vW2m6dGP6H9Y-bW7MKJt96Nx9x_N7gtkZZ7hFxrW2f73Q98f6pSGN5xYJGcjzYTNW8tdH5Q625hlVW1G0NZd5r5TqJV9PxHC80ZhSyW8fglhv6VBL4zW8c0qqD8QwmcSN3CPtdwlyGCcVvrWfj3vNfzqW2ngnMC6jBfJhMJ773HJWCWRf6vnkpT04 )

The Batch ads and exclusive banners - 2025-06-16T152837.770 - copia (https://info.deeplearning.ai/e3t/Ctc/LX+113/cJhC404/MW4sZBBgnWpW2mhv3r56fK6yW6B8lDm5z5V4mN2NZZ423prCCW7Y8-PT6lZ3l_W8bPLMg1W-_nXW7DTp7H3fhB3LW6JG7l41fK6ZgW3MJwJk5N69w2W2q40Fg2wvzwyN364F_-L_LK2W7QyyLH3pPWCwW2V7j0H80NNqfW2p1tJ04JSYkCN2K006gQRSdPW8Dn0Bv8Q_pKZW3Hz7DF4SWjv5W529sVG30pqr1W42Nm5b7_YVNBW3tWcfF1nhy49N17VB6F9FBC0W5nSbg54DdMMjW2ldN9W4Nk7C-VqVbb84r8tlxW4LGQJf1gG_xmW2YqbyB4RX-Y2W77x9KK5vYJrqW2HPc1m2SSmt0W3sFd1v4kkvbkF5z8pzS3BLbW6PScXw8-D8qxf85_Twg04 )

Building with Llama 4

Learn to build powerful, multimodal applications with Llama 4 in this hands-on course made in collaboration with Meta. Taught by Amit Sangani, Director of Partner Engineering at Meta, the course explores Llama 4‚Äôs Mixture-of-Experts architecture, long-context capabilities, and two of their three new models: Maverick and Scout. You‚Äôll experiment with image grounding, multi-image reasoning, and massive text inputs using the official Llama API and Together.ai. You‚Äôll also try out Meta‚Äôs prompt optimization tool and synthetic data kit to improve and fine-tune your applications.

Enroll for Free
(https://info.deeplearning.ai/e3t/Ctc/LX+113/cJhC404/MW4sZBBgnWpW2mhv3r56fK6yW6B8lDm5z5V4mN2NZZ423prCCW7Y8-PT6lZ3l_W8bPLMg1W-_nXW7DTp7H3fhB3LW6JG7l41fK6ZgW3MJwJk5N69w2W2q40Fg2wvzwyN364F_-L_LK2W7QyyLH3pPWCwW2V7j0H80NNqfW2p1tJ04JSYkCN2K006gQRSdPW8Dn0Bv8Q_pKZW3Hz7DF4SWjv5W529sVG30pqr1W42Nm5b7_YVNBW3tWcfF1nhy49N17VB6F9FBC0W5nSbg54DdMMjW2ldN9W4Nk7C-VqVbb84r8tlxW4LGQJf1gG_xmW2YqbyB4RX-Y2W77x9KK5vYJrqW2HPc1m2SSmt0W3sFd1v4kkvbkF5z8pzS3BLbW6PScXw8-D8qxf85_Twg04 )

The Batch ads and exclusive banners - 2025-07-15T161729.182 (https://info.deeplearning.ai/e3t/Ctc/LX+113/cJhC404/MW4sZBBgnWpW2mhv3r56fK6yW6B8lDm5z5V4mN2NZZ423prCCW7Y8-PT6lZ3ktN1mZxpNn4ndyW8G9T_F153X9jW4w_g854dQQbYW3YQvvs1ds30DW1th9zk8MPR8TW4Y5yb_9gCxx-W1jQ5Y_14rbwRW1vGJhb6zBbWTVvnkWV7T33QfW3L_B7j2zbD61W5rMJGG3tzmPZW4qs1QL4PCLvvW3RPPTr4pg0WxW14BvCl6ZpqN3W5zNhb-7YshX5W8W5zkS6wp6RzW1SL1gb2CLL7HW4sTN4r6pmBQvW7fz9cZ6B_XFlW8dJRp871tY8mVzMZYm4JQBdNW3XzFNH5FK9whW2C96mD3BlKL1W5z2ShY8J04q3W35tLRL3Y0YHCW2Tn-__3q3BlPf1P38Sv04 )

Vibe Coding 101 with Replit

Build real apps with the help of an AI coding agent. Learn how to collaborate with coding agents to prototype, debug, and deploy applications in Replit‚Äôs cloud environment. In this hands-on course created with Replit, you‚Äôll build a website performance analyzer and a head-to-head voting app while strengthening your development skills through structured prompting, effective debugging, and agentic coding principles that help you ‚Äúvibe code‚Äù with clarity and intention.

Enroll for Free
(https://info.deeplearning.ai/e3t/Ctc/LX+113/cJhC404/MW4sZBBgnWpW2mhv3r56fK6yW6B8lDm5z5V4mN2NZZ423prCCW7Y8-PT6lZ3ktN1mZxpNn4ndyW8G9T_F153X9jW4w_g854dQQbYW3YQvvs1ds30DW1th9zk8MPR8TW4Y5yb_9gCxx-W1jQ5Y_14rbwRW1vGJhb6zBbWTVvnkWV7T33QfW3L_B7j2zbD61W5rMJGG3tzmPZW4qs1QL4PCLvvW3RPPTr4pg0WxW14BvCl6ZpqN3W5zNhb-7YshX5W8W5zkS6wp6RzW1SL1gb2CLL7HW4sTN4r6pmBQvW7fz9cZ6B_XFlW8dJRp871tY8mVzMZYm4JQBdNW3XzFNH5FK9whW2C96mD3BlKL1W5z2ShY8J04q3W35tLRL3Y0YHCW2Tn-__3q3BlPf1P38Sv04 )

The Batch ads and exclusive banners (6)-1 (https://info.deeplearning.ai/e3t/Ctc/LX+113/cJhC404/MW4sZBBgnWpW2mhv3r56fK6yW6B8lDm5z5V4mN2NZZ423prCCW7Y8-PT6lZ3kTW1klCt176ZKFGW423Bfj2xrCZSW60MMxs2QLzQ7W6G9Bh76db2MpW26VsC08gRpCbV-sG455NNTF6W8qyNyX8tzlmZW36x9Bv6gbQjmW4D83cf7W8-D9W7cY19h8r9PDMW7qYtjl53CLVnW6fzmMs1KMrtLW8wgwzl3xgr_vW7hCWfC96VWRgW7pMVKV2DmW2LW37zDkT49HY2cW5GxYP87_yMzJVbwFQW7jgYZ6W7RC_yw8MP8bmW6FTQyt5T7lf1W32hScP4qTGGkW4-nWfJ3mN7BFVq8p4m3YYwK2W5Hhddv2qLSq_W5qJjDf1Wttw8W12PfBF8q-YBsf77RNCd04 )

How Transformer LLMs Work

Understand the architecture behind today‚Äôs most powerful LLMs. This course, created with the authors of the Hands-On Large Language Models book, breaks down how transformer models work, covering tokenization, embeddings, attention mechanisms, and recent transformer optimizations like KV caching and grouped query attention. You'll build a strong technical foundation, explore the Hugging Face Transformers library, and gain the intuition to understand model architecture and build more effective LLM applications.

Enroll for Free
(https://info.deeplearning.ai/e3t/Ctc/LX+113/cJhC404/MW4sZBBgnWpW2mhv3r56fK6yW6B8lDm5z5V4mN2NZZ423prCCW7Y8-PT6lZ3kTW1klCt176ZKFGW423Bfj2xrCZSW60MMxs2QLzQ7W6G9Bh76db2MpW26VsC08gRpCbV-sG455NNTF6W8qyNyX8tzlmZW36x9Bv6gbQjmW4D83cf7W8-D9W7cY19h8r9PDMW7qYtjl53CLVnW6fzmMs1KMrtLW8wgwzl3xgr_vW7hCWfC96VWRgW7pMVKV2DmW2LW37zDkT49HY2cW5GxYP87_yMzJVbwFQW7jgYZ6W7RC_yw8MP8bmW6FTQyt5T7lf1W32hScP4qTGGkW4-nWfJ3mN7BFVq8p4m3YYwK2W5Hhddv2qLSq_W5qJjDf1Wttw8W12PfBF8q-YBsf77RNCd04 )

RAG 16 by 9 final (https://info.deeplearning.ai/e3t/Ctc/LX+113/cJhC404/MW4sZBBgnWpW2mhv3r56fK6yW6B8lDm5z5V4mN2NZZ423prCCW7Y8-PT6lZ3mhW91zf8Q5qT9SJW3Dm0Hd89kY4ZN2cyv4fnsq84MrWLGdFPqHTW2r9R638bmw8MW1HlYf74xzr_-W4S4qzX8tbQNVVZrw6m60q1V4W7jY5L96QmmPZW1L5VSd6x_RqmW8VGgPG5MRfHmVGQTk92GxzdHV5n2dV91JK-yW4qcns98WfVKFW6Spsgq52gf6FN1F11ffdKVy1W3fYqKz3CkCxkW1xB-328B6CWJW2y18jl25sBfwTkvvF94CDNNW983LZF4VLNg0W1WYsgQ7yRj-WW38FX0-5QxhMyW1ccT1R69Yl6SW86GKlR2l3__3W389D6N3-vXbPdR8tHH04 )

Bonus! Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG)

Yesterday, we launched this hands-on course where you‚Äôll learn how to design, build, and evaluate production-ready RAG pipelines, from retrieval strategies and vector databases to prompt engineering and system deployment. You‚Äôll explore key tradeoffs, tackle real-world challenges like latency and context limits, and work with tools like Weaviate and Arize Phoenix across domains like e-commerce and healthcare. Subject: Free Big SQL Energy Beginner Course Lesson 2
Body Text:
View this post on the web at https://jessramosdata.substack.com/p/free-big-sql-energy-beginner-course-516

Got BDE?‚ö°Ô∏è
Hi BDEs! Welcome to Lessons 0 & 1 of the free Big SQL Energy Beginner Course‚ö°Ô∏è Today we‚Äôre getting setup and learning the super basics of writing our first SQL query!
If you‚Äôre new here, I‚Äôm Jess Ramos, the founder of Big Data Energy and the creator of the BEST SQL course and community: Big SQL Energy‚ö°Ô∏è. Check me out on socials: üîóLinkedIn [ https://substack.com/redirect/2bf66272-3ab1-4744-b60b-59cbd7081dc0?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ], üîóInstagram [ https://substack.com/redirect/6ce691ce-c40a-4a0b-8d21-48acaa29c73e?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ], üîóYouTube [ https://substack.com/redirect/aeef0cb2-ace1-45f9-bf0f-1472d1a6843b?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ], and üîóTikTok [ https://substack.com/redirect/761b2f65-781e-4bf3-9df6-e0977427e2b0?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ].
Big SQL Energy Intermediate is an intermediate SQL course designed to solve real business problems hands-on using realistic data and a modern tech stack. You‚Äôll walk away with 2 SQL portfolio projects, portfolio building guidance, access to the Big Data Energy Discord community, and lots of confidence for you upcoming coding interviews. This course is all of the most important things I‚Äôve learned on the job as a Senior Data Analyst in tech who grew from a $72K salary to over $150K salary. And now I‚Äôm sharing it with YOU!
                                  Use code Jan2025 for 20% off for all of January!
But if you‚Äôre here for the free BEGINNER Big SQL Energy course, the next lesson for you is below! ‚¨áÔ∏è
Lesson 0: Intro & Getting Started
üé• Video [ https://substack.com/redirect/cd1d8b45-fa8d-41f6-ba73-6afb7af7df5b?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ]
Before you start, you‚Äôll need access to any IDE (integrated development environment) for SQL of your choosing. I highly recommend using a üîóHex data science notebook [ https://substack.com/redirect/43dcc026-9077-4832-90f9-cd3f1daa0399?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ] because it‚Äôs easy to get started with and stored in the cloud‚Äî so no headaches to download and set up. However, you can alternatively use DBeaver, MySQL Workbench, SSMS, or any others if you‚Äôd prefer. Just import the dataset used in the lesson, and you‚Äôre ready to go! Remember, if you get stuck or experience errors, ChatGPT and Gemini are great resources to learn about syntax and help you debug. Alright, let‚Äôs get started!
üîó Join Hex Data Science Notebooks: https://app.hex.tech/signup/big-data-energy [ https://substack.com/redirect/43dcc026-9077-4832-90f9-cd3f1daa0399?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ]
üîó Datasets (Orders & Customers): https://github.com/jessramosdata/big-sql-energy-beginner [ https://substack.com/redirect/e7176d16-b911-47f8-adad-985a7052253f?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ]
Lesson 2: Order By
üé• Video [ https://substack.com/redirect/6490f39c-bc1d-46ce-bb8b-de659e23d289?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ]
Now that you‚Äôve learned how to pull some data using SELECT and FROM combined with * or column names, I bet you‚Äôre wondering how to sort data in SQL. It can be really hard to see any trends or insights with a large amounts of data, so sometimes we have to summarize, rearrange, or reshape data in order to learn more. However, I do want to caution you that sorting an entire dataset can have negative impacts to optimization since it can take a lot of time and power to sort a very large dataset. But let‚Äôs ignore that for now since we‚Äôre learning the basics‚Äî I talk more about optimization in my üîóintermediate course [ https://substack.com/redirect/e22e252f-8387-46d3-90e3-6763ad5f8158?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ].
To sort a dataset in SQL, we have to use the ORDER BY clause in SQL. By default, ORDER BY sorts in ascending order, or in other words smallest to largest. We can add it after FROM like this:
select
   *
from
   table
order by
   order_date
There are other SQL clauses that sometimes go between FROM and ORDER BY, but we‚Äôll learn those later. If you want to switch the order to descending order (largest to smallest), you can do it by adding ‚Äúdesc‚Äù after the column name:
select
   *
from
   table
order by
   order_date desc
And of course you can order by multiple columns as well too. It‚Äôll order by the first column and then by the second column. Here‚Äôs a few examples of that. Notice how including desc and changing the position changes our ordering:
select
   *
from
   table
order by
   customer_id, order_date
;


select
   *
from
   table
order by
   customer_id, order_date desc
;

select
   *
from
   table
order by
   customer_id desc, order_date
;

select
   *
from
   table
order by
   customer_id desc, order_date desc
;
In some SQL dialects (especially in newer cloud platforms like Snowflake for example), you can use a shorthand notation to represent the column name based on the columns selected in the SELECT statement. Order by 1, 2 orders by the first and second column in your select statement for example:
select
   *
from
   table
order by
   1, 2
;
And that‚Äôs how we can sort datasets in SQL! See you tomorrow for the next lesson!
If you‚Äôve enjoyed the free BEGINNER Big SQL Energy course, grab my intermediate course for 20% off NOW because this deal expires February 1. There are no deadlines or timelines for this course‚Äî you start and take as long as you want. It will take your beginner skills to the next level and get you ready to ace your interviews.
DM me or email me at courses@bdeanalytics.com if you have questions on the intermediate course!
-xoxo,
jessüíï
WHO AM I?‚ö°Ô∏è
I'm Jess Ramos, a content creator, instructor, and leader in the data world. I'm super passionate about data and especially SQL‚Äî which inspired me to launch my own SQL course, Big SQL Energy! My 9-5 is being a Senior Data Analyst in tech. I'm also an Instructor with LinkedIn Learning and the founder of Big Data Energy Analytics. My 5-9 (aka outside of my regular job!) is creating amazing content for YOU on LinkedIn [ https://substack.com/redirect/2bf66272-3ab1-4744-b60b-59cbd7081dc0?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ], Instagram [ https://substack.com/redirect/bbd843bf-f410-4ea1-b33a-f9a88c0c6aa9?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ], TikTok [ https://substack.com/redirect/761b2f65-781e-4bf3-9df6-e0977427e2b0?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ]-- and this newsletter!ü§©
Big Data Energy‚ö°Ô∏è is a MUST subscribe if you want BDE in your data career.

Unsubscribe https://substack..bfHGRRQET_j4fEkbEOx07TSA47bpi5-laQssNv0I2Q4?

Body Text:
Hi there!

Everything you do in PyCharm lives inside of a project <https://go.jetbrains.com/dc/k2oLQLl4sOXaMfj4PBQzO0xwp2dQmblqwCsEpQn-sVkX_XFt39WVWNXvjK-k_bej40L1HGnrjrf4kCrG6L_rajNWpcuHmv7oAIOn4N3fD-RWxtKCjergGFxsi4MfPGO74aGpHZLIGgZg1Y7-kA7dUFEluQic_OLaAeUUzFWau4vcifJX2zPYk-eDQitYw30X/NDI2LVFWRC0xMTQAAAGX9o0FrnPk2N4UE63Hp7qSuMrSOIA-JUM78ZUdCgFh3RjB48NugNHQplS_TyoltpBLOP4RmU4=>.

Projects allow the IDE to understand your files and their relationships to provide best-in-class code completion, project-wide refactorings, and more.
Create a New Project
Select a pure Python <https://go.jetbrains.com/dc/k2oLQLl4sOXaMfj4PBQzO0xwp2dQmblqwCsEpQn-sVnBKTUPNd4m0zgRbIdqVj-Kf2eLKj2Vg2YG8fr9u5MWgN2uM7b3sNR4ea-D-ls0YQTfoPA7bgEUVNXLXXp953sAB3z6uUjAlPYl4WwnxMjqQqNO44P_ZtxV_fWf6-PlWT1I283XZln9H1kZoRc2P_Un/NDI2LVFWRC0xMTQAAAGX9o0FrnPk2N4UE63Hp7qSuMrSOIA-JUM78ZUdCgFh3RjB48NugNHQplS_TyoltpBLOP4RmU4=>, web-framework-based <https://go.jetbrains.com/dc/k2oLQLl4sOXaMfj4PBQzO0xwp2dQmblqwCsEpQn-sVlD49vwsIwOM97qEvocsSDhL3CCOreBeEB1HyxDxm4kycSOInWFBrREjDEO-F3foP3wJrQ8WJX2daCkD65kdxUHniXHnuNszC3YzC5bisN8Pai5H5wh0otrE3f8XA5Ev6ucP9MV7dbSQ9zOishZeuOg/NDI2LVFWRC0xMTQAAAGX9o0FrnPk2N4UE63Hp7qSuMrSOIA-JUM78ZUdCgFh3RjB48NugNHQplS_TyoltpBLOP4RmU4=>, or scientific <https://go.jetbrains.com/dc/k2oLQLl4sOXaMfj4PBQzO0xwp2dQmblqwCsEpQn-sVmkcZ2N7AhgQ5guJgsjDkfll8b4Ucjj1ZBmvmMqECAbs-uTlsG4jIycrsFCrD-SKNwFiY4rF76ldY1anyFdsWq_vU7kTG987ypxd9BqZ8RCTIDs8jLfynEDWmOja_LtKk6SqNWQCUtfvhOSl8o4sAtE/NDI2LVFWRC0xMTQAAAGX9o0FrnPk2N4UE63Hp7qSuMrSOIA-JUM78ZUdCgFh3RjB48NugNHQplS_TyoltpBLOP4RmU4=> project type, create a new <https://go.jetbrains.com/dc/k2oLQLl4sOXaMfj4PBQzO0xwp2dQmblqwCsEpQn-sVkntgwPqKFFw21gH8xvrllvVtajipzl10Xzq3rYsZEbSLtB_c7G1S81uHIItEBBR_ACHUo2qzzK3Uod8ab5Y0ekBLyVUqvWE_HQw3u3upgnQ9YsqDN5DPIDLBfmUrbR9F2vRGrHBAkCQENiSBCLuotrYIdZZGlRN2AJt1D0Kd1Ak2XQdW5Zlmvpd4BjobL1TVrCiX7kEP4O4AaMJfCJVCKH/NDI2LVFWRC0xMTQAAAGX9o0FrnPk2N4UE63Hp7qSuMrSOIA-JUM78ZUdCgFh3RjB48NugNHQplS_TyoltpBLOP4RmU4=> or select an existing <https://go.jetbrains.com/dc/k2oLQLl4sOXaMfj4PBQzO0xwp2dQmblqwCsEpQn-sVkntgwPqKFFw21gH8xvrllvVtajipzl10Xzq3rYsZEbSLtB_c7G1S81uHIItEBBR_ACHUo2qzzK3Uod8ab5Y0ekBLyVUqvWE_HQw3u3upgnQ9YsqDN5DPIDLBfmUrbR9F2vRGrHBAkCQENiSBCLuotra0xsbkHM6z3OvQwsF-pOkczbyO60NPU5-RfPHa7RS0w=/NDI2LVFWRC0xMTQAAAGX9o0FrnPk2N4UE63Hp7qSuMrSOIA-JUM78ZUdCgFh3RjB48NugNHQplS_TyoltpBLOP4RmU4=> Python interpreter, and let PyCharm install dependencies, configure specific support, and create run configurations for you.

 <https://go.jetbrains.com/NDI2LVFWRC0xMTQAAAGX9o0Frpygvusi5R5YsdmnE-3g78WS09ghko7idTBDlWkKHZ0cmNTnL-E8tciR_1yIVvfg3f0=>
Configure a Local Python Interpreter
To create a new project you need to configure a local Python interpreter first. We recommend using either virtualenv <https://go.jetbrains.com/dc/k2oLQLl4sOXaMfj4PBQzO0xwp2dQmblqwCsEpQn-sVnBKTUPNd4m0zgRbIdqVj-KOIbE4FZMqnnOrIRowBNerBLmYs3VPsbZ5P3Ccm6ary5gNHwnNktYGmxncwICMTZ-XJIoBbT8JomttsGTmeJyJzJaieiRvFliu3DmQuFN-Stlb5Z64ZNzh35cMrr8YGg_N6AydRDAejE2SqGPweCocg==/NDI2LVFWRC0xMTQAAAGX9o0FrnPk2N4UE63Hp7qSuMrSOIA-JUM78ZUdCgFh3RjB48NugNHQplS_TyoltpBLOP4RmU4=>, Conda <https://go.jetbrains.com/dc/k2oLQLl4sOXaMfj4PBQzO0xwp2dQmblqwCsEpQn-sVnXtZIzeS4U-vf5H_L8VQZOLYTD02Er39YgumIrDQeS85J-OwxzY_ijbkCy5wWfakHH_jRGfhOFRJy5fEsoeWR-UQpaNoBD2gOCthMhsZsAfoMV6c02mgr4r3LPJw_kCZpPG350JoRQ-mPPONR1s36GLDn3KTxSvM3KOQsN_BvyvFXQOqaD6LyvMqYb7SJ6eiY=/NDI2LVFWRC0xMTQAAAGX9o0FrnPk2N4UE63Hp7qSuMrSOIA-JUM78ZUdCgFh3RjB48NugNHQplS_TyoltpBLOP4RmU4=>, or Poetry <https://go.jetbrains.com/dc/k2oLQLl4sOXaMfj4PBQzO0xwp2dQmblqwCsEpQn-sVnECdN32UeAJ_D7RqN11VkNgASb2TxneJeF0_Df6nXbZNd9zw6ZmlvHg6pcwsOuqX5XoVbolaIiKZ07Movjl_w9xefKaxWyf1bpC7RxjCpJ-j6uzRpC4daF5KMOCvAH3SY=/NDI2LVFWRC0xMTQAAAGX9o0FrnPk2N4UE63Hp7qSuMrSOIA-JUM78ZUdCgFh3RjB48NugNHQplS_TyoltpBLOP4RmU4=>.
Add a Remote Python Interpreter
Remote interpreters can be added afterward through PyCharm‚Äôs support for WSL <https://go.jetbrains.com/dc/k2oLQLl4sOXaMfj4PBQzO0xwp2dQmblqwCsEpQn-sVmewHksB55DsnsiV-WkNVUhwrD4XZ0y4vMzXRrnC9RYxmfMLqlhTFC3FcauDuvrvlol6D8sHZUiU6nWUpTX3qQNL7fVrvYDspP6Bra8C-Ex-ZgKHAZjJRZG5QMUfVcjoTn7sJsU40KeqZcEqALsu0A7HtuHpWKSRF9s3oTYa2_kJw==/NDI2LVFWRC0xMTQAAAGX9o0FrnPk2N4UE63Hp7qSuMrSOIA-JUM78ZUdCgFh3RjB48NugNHQplS_TyoltpBLOP4RmU4=>, Docker <https://go.jetbrains.com/dc/k2oLQLl4sOXaMfj4PBQzO0xwp2dQmblqwCsEpQn-sVm7DVqvFzMrg8hDOyByxEMuhSuJiM17ICfl_7ZV4BlILgyrZUV0uGRRtxIlS6xgTQE7AJ1kI-WU64xhnX01gqnq6s3KPTkmS833v8DH5ziQJphz9sNc9ixaK-LyuwJ77XVYTnw5EMkaKduQX9LZQabv5pmc5C608vBXgW6BivSb4g==/NDI2LVFWRC0xMTQAAAGX9o0FrnPk2N4UE63Hp7qSuMrSOIA-JUM78ZUdCgFh3RjB48NugNHQplS_TyoltpBLOP4RmU4=>, and SSH <https://go.jetbrains.com/dc/k2oLQLl4sOXaMfj4PBQzO0xwp2dQmblqwCsEpQn-sVkntgwPqKFFw21gH8xvrllvkKZvl3DYqT9C-QvLaRc-LXBl4B1YlFEI45IO2HARalVg3AoaVGbryf6yJ0oB0wiOqLvpX7XhCr4ZDkdVRcz0lX6TirLG8ScvYrQMw-88S4Pw2S8G1pwYY0yvLbzYhfgtAJqs4QTQMEUBmNC3iiVVBw==/NDI2LVFWRC0xMTQAAAGX9o0FrnPk2N4UE63Hp7qSuMrSOIA-JUM78ZUdCgFh3RjB48NugNHQplS_TyoltpBLOP4RmU4=>.
Run a File
Right-click inside the editor and select Run <file name> to quickly run a file in PyCharm <https://go.jetbrains.com/dc/k2oLQLl4sOXaMfj4PBQzO0xwp2dQmblqwCsEpQn-sVk9o_sqVc_IADP_5XrCvvBcO8GUvYqX32VCoMa_KTSqCy6YAFNVHmkQdAalrvLO2H-wvc1ExXtKgKaeI0hBTbMwWzZTrHXxKVrIg_CLSDDAy4ySGbYBl-Lc227b8JqEH_RBAtuu9_J8axH4efD2OKMZW2TJFW0rRjsOg7iZG83lxw==/NDI2LVFWRC0xMTQAAAGX9o0FrnPk2N4UE63Hp7qSuMrSOIA-JUM78ZUdCgFh3RjB48NugNHQplS_TyoltpBLOP4RmU4=>.
Need help? Reach out to us on Twitter <https://go.jetbrains.com/NDI2LVFWRC0xMTQAAAGX9o0FrjAmrH0JAGspnKf_Xo5okKM7z6M0mBaCvv76wUWiD2neF_5-BBRcPqJdG2DSC2fPCWM=>, use our issue tracker <https://go.jetbrains.com/NDI2LVFWRC0xMTQAAAGX9o0FromH1NWExXUHsOIQqHCu-Ob498mvDLYt5gFBe6mrPpriWp-XEAq-IenjzKXlogSN578=>, or contact our Support team <https://go.jetbrains.com/NDI2LVFWRC0xMTQAAAGX9o0FrpGqi92T3XchKQYKPP6Z-j451tIJlfm2ONRHU5703pPrpy9oOcjPc1hZE6ratxUhQhQ=>.
The PyCharm team

If you no longer wish to receive¬†PyCharm educational materials during your trial period,¬†click here <https://go.jetbrains.com/NDI2LVFWRC0xMTQAAAGX9o0Frr8wzV9LWiAoDO6Ovux74e1sIV9kNqPBmgErhq7lM7yTkx8bMlH_VleHrqVp0UsX3zo=>.

Subject: Update on Your Application to Serve Robotics
Body Text:
Hi Candace,

Thank you for your interest in the Sr. Data Analyst role at Serve Robotics. We truly appreciate you taking the time to apply.

At this time, we have filled the position and will not be moving forward with additional candidates. Although we did not have the opportunity to connect during this process, we were grateful for your interest in Serve Robotics and the potential to bring your talents to our team.

We encourage you to stay in touch and consider applying to future opportunities with us. You can always view our open roles at our https://www.serverobotics.com/careers.

Wishing you all the best in your career journey, and we hope to connect with you down the line!

Best regards,
Serve Robotics Recruiting Team

From Name: Jess Ramos from Big Data Energy‚ö°Ô∏è
Reply-To: Jess Ramos from Big Data Energy‚ö°Ô∏è <reply+2k7qq6&51dsk7&&96a09bd10c8042d379e8e9194e4b60abd027694b70b5161eb1eddf34a6a6f254@mg1.substack.com>
Subject: Aggregate Functions in SQL: Lesson 15 Free Beginner SQL Course
Body Text:
View this post on the web at https://jessramosdata.substack.com/p/aggregate-functions-in-sql-lesson

Got BDE?‚ö°Ô∏è
Hi BDEs! Welcome to Lesson 15 of the free Big SQL Energy Beginner Course‚ö°Ô∏è Today we‚Äôre learning about Aggregate Functions in SQL!
üö® 17 more days of 20% off my intermediate course! 
This will be the last big sale for AWHILE! So take your happy new year gift. You‚Äôll be ready for it after you finish this beginner course üéâ And after intermediate, you‚Äôll interview and job READY üî•
If you‚Äôre new here, I‚Äôm Jess Ramos, the founder of Big Data Energy and the creator of the BEST SQL course and community: Big SQL Energy‚ö°Ô∏è. Check me out on socials: üîóLinkedIn [ https://substack.com/redirect/981ba68a-7e6b-4966-b7b6-0d9c489debe1?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ], üîóInstagram [ https://substack.com/redirect/7998cbff-891b-4c77-a45b-0c7f585d47f6?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ], üîóYouTube [ https://substack.com/redirect/0b2c6f4d-fe3f-4012-b0e2-d398ba7881a5?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ], and üîóTikTok [ https://substack.com/redirect/4a7ded8a-a5f1-44cb-9093-26dbf32e5341?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ].
üîóBig SQL Energy  [ https://substack.com/redirect/d1fae9e0-2c43-44e2-a50b-209d1da713cd?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ]Intermediate [ https://substack.com/redirect/d1fae9e0-2c43-44e2-a50b-209d1da713cd?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ] is an intermediate SQL course designed to solve real business problems hands-on using realistic data and a modern tech stack. You‚Äôll walk away with 2 SQL portfolio projects, portfolio building guidance, access to the Big Data Energy Discord community, and lots of confidence for you upcoming coding interviews. This course is all of the most important things I‚Äôve learned on the job as a Senior Data Analyst in tech who grew from a $72K salary to over a $150K salary. And now I‚Äôm sharing it with YOU!
                                  Use code Jan2025 for 20% off for all of January!
Free Beginner Big SQL Energy course: The next lesson for you is below! ‚¨áÔ∏è
Miss the intro and setup? ‚¨áÔ∏è
üé• Intro Video [ https://substack.com/redirect/48ad1c51-a55c-4455-a70b-3039c80ee5c8?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ]
‚úâ Intro & First Lesson [ https://substack.com/redirect/697d5748-0104-4b5d-bcde-d49cc421b02e?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ]
Lesson 15: Aggregate Functions
üé• Video [ https://substack.com/redirect/22db6a1a-b1c2-4e48-ba82-d31910bd9bb0?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ]
Aggregate functions are probably one of the most important skills you can have when first learning SQL. They‚Äôre the way of combining and summarizing data from many, many noisy rows into metrics, insights, and digestible values. Think about a large spreadsheet. What‚Äôs one of the first things you might want to do? Maybe you‚Äôd want to count the number of rows, find the sum of a column, or fine the minimum and maximum values. This exactly what we can do with aggregate functions. 
Aggregate functions can be great for performing descriptive statistics on a dataset, and they are pure MAGIC when paired with a GROUP BY or HAVING clause in SQL. Don‚Äôt worry, those lessons are later on in this beginner course, but just keep in mind how versatile aggregate functions are. 
Of course basic aggregate functions are really useful on their own, but I do want to point out that they‚Äôre also something that can be built on to produce advanced SQL work such as window functions, pivoting data in SQL using CASE, and even in CTES‚Äî which are all taught in-depth in my üîóintermediate course [ https://substack.com/redirect/d3ba56d9-f4f3-426c-b519-f0f51a6416a4?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ], so head on over there to learn advanced use cases for aggregate functions. 
There are a few main aggregate functions that I use the most, but there are of course some others as well. 
Count(): counts all the non-null values in a column. Note: count(*) will count rows, but we‚Äôll learn that in the next lesson, so ignore this for now.
select
   count(order_id) as order_count
from 
   orders
Sum(): sums numeric values in a column.
select
   sum(price) as total_price
from 
   orders
Avg(): Calculates the average (mean) of numeric values in a column.
select
   avg(price) as avg_price
from 
   orders
Min(): Finds the minimum value in a column.
select
   min(price) as min_price
from 
   orders
Max(): Finds the maximum value in a column.
select
   max(price) as max_price
from 
   orders
Bonus: Median(): Finds the median value of a column. Note: Not all SQL environments and dialects will support this function.
select
   median(price) as median_price
from 
   orders
Not only can we produce basic descriptive statistics using aggregate functions, but we can also wrap aggregate functions around other metrics and calculations we‚Äôve created. For example, we can fine the sum() and avg() of the total_revenue calculation created by multiplying price and quantity (using arithmetic operators):
select
   price * quantity as total_order_revenue
from 
   orders
;

select
   sum(price * quantity) as total_revenue,
   avg(price * quantity) as avg_revenue
from 
   orders
;

And those are basic aggregate functions‚Äî now go GET TO PRACTICING! 
Alright I‚Äôll see you in the next lesson! But first‚Ä¶
üö®üö®üö® Don‚Äôt sleep on this 20% off discount for my intermediate course! This beginner course is a good intro, but it will NOT get you interview and job ready! üö®üö®üö®
DM me or email me at courses@bdeanalytics.com if you have questions on the intermediate course!
-xoxo,
jessüíï
Big Data Energy‚ö°Ô∏è is a MUST subscribe if you want BDE in your data career.

Dear Evan:



Congratulations. The Board of Directors of NIPSA, on the recommendation of the NIPSA Visiting Committee, has voted to approve Level 3 therapeutic certification for Academics West for a period of five (5) years. I am attaching your Certificate and your school retains full membership in the National Independent Private Schools Association.

Subject: Candace... which stage are you?
Body Text:
Your entrepreneur journey isn‚Äôt what you think it is... Hey Candace,

It‚Äôs tempting to think your entrepreneur journey is unique. When you‚Äôre so close
to your own journey, it can be hard to get perspective.

However, in thinking it‚Äôs unique and different from everyone else‚Äôs, you get
caught up in the details and miss the big picture.

We‚Äôve worked with thousands of entrepreneurs and interviewed thousands more
across a wide range of industries. What we‚Äôve discovered is the entrepreneur
journey is a lot more predictable across their businesses than it is unique.

There are certain problems and frustrations that come along at a very
predictable time, and there are also strategies you can deploy to overcome them
if you know the journey ahead of you.

Here‚Äôs what it looks like:

 1. Start-up - Pre-revenue or early stage business, testing out ideas in the
    market, enthusiasm but little track record or results.
    
    
 2. Wilderness - Struggling solopreneur or small team, trading time for money,
    no productized offering, juggling multiple roles, hand to mouth survival,
    broad value proposition - nothing really unique about their business from
    the market‚Äôs perspective.
    
 3. Lifestyle - A team of 3 - 12 people, less hours, more freedom, revenue high
    6 to early 7 figures, good profit. Lots of digital and IP assets, being
    leveraged by the people in the business. Unique, differentiated and in
    demand.
    
    
 4. The Desert - Too big to be a small business, and too small to be a big
    business. Heavy investment in infrastructure and long-term investment
    cycles, high-risk, no cash, people complexity and constantly starved of
    cash, low profitability. High stakes, high stress.
    
    
 5. Performance - Team of 40+ people, EBITDA close to or above $1M. Leadership
    team running the business. Not founder reliant. Steady growth, high
    valuation, investable, great team culture, profitable again. 
    
    
 6. (BONUS) Unicorn ‚Å†- A team of 250+ people with ultra-high revenue per person
    that happened to be at the right place and time with the right opportunity
    (eg. software, ecommerce, blockchain)‚Å†

Watch this short explanation of the Entrepreneur Journey HERE

Subject: üëâ¬†A Final Quick Reminder
Body Text:
Hey Candace,

Just a short email from me today letting you know the bonus offer
we‚Äôve added for LifeOS is coming to an end in a few hours.

In case you missed it, if you sign up to LifeOS (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/qdumn6rew9u7h4v5wzgclh83ppwkkb4/m2h7h6u3gd44gvil/aHR0cHM6Ly9hbGlhYmRhYWwuY29tL2xpZmVvcy8_dXRtX2NhbXBhaWduPWZyaWRheV80JnV0bV9tZWRpdW09ZW1haWwmdXRtX3NvdXJjZT1wb3N0X2V2ZW50X3NlcXVlbmNl
) before 2259 GMT today (April 4th), you‚Äôll be able to join the
April Sprint - a 3-week live event run by our Productivity
Coaches that we‚Äôve organised to help turn the goals that you
might‚Äôve set during the Spring Reset into sustainable action over
the coming months (if you missed the Spring Reset last week, you
can catch up here (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/qdumn6rew9u7h4v5wzgclh83ppwkkb4/e0hph0u7p8rrpob7/aHR0cHM6Ly9hbGlhYmRhYWwuY29tL2NvbmZpcm1hdGlvbi9zcHJpbmctcmVzZXQtd29ya3Nob3AtcmV3YXRjaC1jb25maXJtYXRpb24v
)).

Now that we‚Äôre a few months into the year, I know that
resolutions may have slipped away and motivation may be waning
which is why we wanted to provide support to kickstart the
quarter and set you up for the rest of 2025.

LifeOS is designed to help you reclaim your time, energy, and
focus, so you can stop spinning your wheels and start making real
progress.

If you want to take things a step further and commit to 12 months
of support and accountability, you can also sign up to LifeOS Pro
(
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/qdumn6rew9u7h4v5wzgclh83ppwkkb4/m2h7h6u3gd44gvil/aHR0cHM6Ly9hbGlhYmRhYWwuY29tL2xpZmVvcy8_dXRtX2NhbXBhaWduPWZyaWRheV80JnV0bV9tZWRpdW09ZW1haWwmdXRtX3NvdXJjZT1wb3N0X2V2ZW50X3NlcXVlbmNl
) (formerly Productivity Lab), which is our annual membership
giving you access to daily focus sessions, accountability pods,
weekly reviews, monthly Q&As and more, for the equivalent of just
$2.73 per day.

Absolutely no worries if you're happy with your current systems -
have a great end to the week and an enjoyable weekend ahead üôå

Speak soon,

Ali x

Subject: üìù¬†The Objection Killer Checklist
Body Text:
Hey there!

A few days ago, I released a new checklist to help you knock down
objections from potential clients on your sales calls.

And I don‚Äôt want to miss out!

I dropped it in our free group, Ghostwriters Anonymous, and so
far over 200 people have downloaded it:

‚Äã

---------------------------
Why has it been so popular?
---------------------------

Because no matter how great your ghostwriting offer is (or how
good you‚Äôre at sales), your prospects will ALWAYS have some sort

Subject: Phone interview invitation - Data Analytics Lead Instructor
Body Text:
Hello,

Thank you for taking the time to apply for our Data Analytics Lead
Instructor opening at The Marcy Lab School <https://marcylabschool.org/>!
We were very impressed by your background and welcomed the opportunity to
share more about this position with you. We hope to learn more about you,
your professional interests, and what you might bring to this role.

During this 30-minute phone call, you will interview with Ifeoma Nwoke, our
Senior Director of Data Analytics Fellowship. She looks forward to learning
more about your background and interest in the position. Additionally,
she is excited to share more about the organization and the aspirations for
this important role.

Three brief next steps:

   1. *Sign up for a 30-minute phone interview
   <https://calendly.com/ifeoma-marcylabschool/mls-data-fellowship-lead-instructor-phone-interview>*
with
   her.
   2. *Review the job description*
   <https://jobs.gusto.com/postings/the-marcy-lab-school-data-analytics-lead-instructor-5aa6f852-6922-4df4-9c68-3d241befdd98>for
   the role, noting any questions or concerns you may have.
   3. Complete some Marcy Lab School Pre-Reading. We‚Äôre including a few
   links below to help you build more context on our work. During the call,
   we‚Äôd love to make time to answer any follow-up questions that you may have
   about the role or the organization.

Let me know if you have any questions! We are excited to connect with you
soon!

*Marcy Lab School Reading Materials*

   - Our 2021 Annual Report <https://2021.marcylabschool.org/> is filled
   with photos and videos that tell the story of our impact from past years
   (and the two years leading up to it!). It also has a few stats that speak
   to the demographic profile of our school. I hope you enjoy it.
   - Here's a recent write-up
   <https://workshift.opencampusmedia.org/a-true-alternative-to-a-four-year-college/>
in
   WorkShift by Paul Fain, a leading voice in the country's Higher Education
   and Workforce policy.
   - Three recent features in CNBC
   <https://www.cnbc.com/2023/02/27/new-york-school-disrupts-education-black-latino-students-tech-jobs-.html>
   , People
   <https://people.com/meghan-markle-prince-harry-brooklyn-school-world-mental-health-day-8349264>,
and
   the New York Times
   <https://www.nytimes.com/2023/02/11/nyregion/restoration-brooklyn-housing-bed-stuy.html>
   .
   - Here is a case study <https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dfU4v2xy_gQ> that
   tells the story of our impact in collaboration with one of our partner
   employers, Cockroach Labs.
   - Prior to each board meeting, our Executive Director drafts a memo
   outlining the quarter's updates and learning priorities. I would like to
   share two of the most recent memos with you, as they will provide you with
   valuable context as to where we are in our young organization's growth
   cycle. This memo
   <https://www.notion.so/d2a16f2c4f024d4b8a476acb727e2a49?pvs=21> from
   February 2023 (actually addressed to the staff) laid out our near-term
   strategy of "getting better before we get bigger" in response to the
   '22-'23 tech hiring downturn. This most recent memo
   <https://www.notion.so/706963532ab142e38f6d501609cbd255?pvs=21> from
   February 2024 is a bit of a sequel to the previous memo. It lays out a
   strategy of cautious scale and deep investment in our students
   during continued market uncertainty.
   - These are the most FAQs
   <https://marcylabschool.notion.site/FAQ-Data-Analytics-Fellowship-Lead-Instructor-at-the-Marcy-Lab-School-177b1966ed7480f2a0eec5b605721f2c?pvs=4>
for
   this role.


Best,

EMMA PLASCENCIA (she/her)

Business Operations Manager

882 Third Avenue, Floor 11
Brooklyn, NY 11232

marcylabschool.org

<https://www.instagram.com/marcylabschool/>

<https://twitter.com/marcylabschool>

<https://www.linkedin.com/school/marcylabschool/>

<https://www.youtube.com/@marcylabschool>

<https://marcylabschool.org>

Subject: Application Received-Data Analytics Senior Manager at Sollis Health
Body Text:
Hi Candace,

Thank you for applying to the Data Analytics Senior Manager position at Sollis Health. We are excited that you are interested in a career here as we know there are many opportunities out there to apply to.

This email is to confirm we have received your application. Our hiring team is currently reviewing all applications, and we are planning to schedule interviews shortly. If you are a qualified candidate, you will receive an email from someone on the Sollis Health Talent Acquisition team to schedule an interview. Throughout the candidate review process, we will keep you updated on the status of your application.

Thank you again for your interest in Sollis Health and we look forward to connecting with you soon!

Sincerely,
The Sollis Health Talent Acquisition Team

--

Sollis Health is the first and only medical membership that‚Äôs on-demand 24/7, 365. We live up to the concierge promise: with just one call, our members experience unparalleled care and follow-up on their schedule and their terms. Our members never wonder if it‚Äôs a ‚Äúreal‚Äù emergency. They simply call Sollis for immediate access to ER-trained medical teams, on-site labs and imaging, expedited specialist appointments, and care navigation that‚Äôs all under one roof. With unlimited 24/7 virtual and in-person support from locations in Manhattan, the Hamptons, Los Angeles, South Florida, and San Francisco, Sollis puts our members in first class by handling all medical issues‚Äîbig or small‚Äîwith expert concierge care anytime, anywhere.

Learn more about us at SollisHealth.com ( https://SollisHealth.com )

Our goal has always been to deliver the value you deserve regardless of whether you buy or sell on Mercari. With that in mind and after carefully considering your feedback, we have an important update: We‚Äôre rolling out a new fee structure starting on January 6, 2025.

When we introduced our current fee structure in March, our aim was to make selling more accessible to sellers. However, we realized this structure wasn‚Äôt helping sellers sell more and ultimately negatively impacted Mercari and our community by reducing overall transactions on the marketplace. The new fee structure addresses these concerns. Our new fee structure: We‚Äôre reintroducing a selling fee and lowering the buyer fee. This new fee structure aligns the benefits you receive with the fees you pay. For Sellers A flat 10% selling fee applies to item price and buyer-paid shipping Free ACH direct deposits for successful withdrawals. A $2 fee applies only for rejected deposits. Limit to one direct deposit per day. For more information on Seller Protection, please see

Subject: Reminder - Speed Dating Tonight
Body Text:
Hello,

Just writing to remind you about the event you signed up for:

Title: Older Women/Younger Men (Cougars & Cubs) Speed Dating

Date: Friday, October 18, 2024 at 7:00 PM - 9:00 PM

Location: Flute Champagne Bar, 205 W 54th St (Between Broadway & 7th Ave), New York, NY 10019

Your name is on our list of registered participants for this event. Just give your name to our host upon arrival to be checked-in.

  *   Please arrive 15 minutes early to sign in and get situated.
  *   Please do not be absent as it would affect our male to female ratio.
  *   Please order at least 1 drink or food item during our event so the venue will invite us back to host more events.
  *   Dress code: It's a singles event, so you should aim to look your best. No hoodies, sweatshirts, shorts, gym wear, etc. Button down shirts preferred, stylish jeans okay.
  *   Please reply to let me know you got this message.

Best,
Jennifer Sutton
www.nyminutedating.com<http://www.nyminutedating.com>

Subject: Junior HR Data Analyst opportunity with our direct client
Body Text:
Hi Candace,

This is Robin, a virtual recruiter with GTT.

Thank you for your job application with GTT. Below is the job description for your reference.

I will be calling you to gather more details about your profile. My goal is to complete your profile to help you with current and future job opportunities. If you are unable to take the call at this time, please let me know your preferred date and time for a call, and I will call you accordingly.


Job Description:

Job title: JUNIOR HR DATA ANALYST

Location: Remote

Duration: 6 Months to begin with

Job Overview: The client is looking for Junior HR Data Analyst.

Responsibilities:

  *   Manager will ask them to speak on their experiences.

Requirements:

  *   Must have good data analyst experience.
  *   Experience (actual hands on) with Oracle Fusion is a HUGE plus.
  *   Must be very good in Excel, manipulating data, high volume.

Working Conditions:

  *   REMOTE.


Regards
Virtual Recruiter Robin


About GTT:
Global Technical Talent is a subsidiary of Chenega Corporation (www.chenega.com) with over 1.3 billion US$ in revenue and 5800 US employees. We provide Total Talent Solutions, Global staffing, SOW, RPO, Direct Sourcing, and Global Payroll with physical offices in US, Canada, and India. GTT Digital headquartered in Toronto specializes in providing high-tech digital and banking talent to some of the nation‚Äôs largest financial institutions. As a leader in the staffing industry for over 22 years, we have become one of the largest staffing firms in the New England region, working with Fortune 500 clients and cutting-edge, technology-driven recruiting infrastructure.


By replying to this email, you consent to receive a limited number of text messages, and automated artificial voice calls for job opportunities from GTT and its partners. Standard messaging and data rates may apply, and you can unsubscribe at any time by replying STOP.

Subject: 5 success secrets
Body Text:
EVERY successful entrepreneur does this Candace, 

10 years working with 3500+ founders through our accelerators, taught us this: 

At the center of every industry you will find an inner circle of people who are
the most visible, valuable and well connected.

They are the Key People of Influence. 

You probably already know of these people in your industry:

 * Their names come up in conversation ... for all the right reasons.
 * They attract a lot of opportunities ... that are perfect for them.
 * They earn more money than most ... and it isn‚Äôt a struggle.
 * They can make a project successful if they are involved ... and people know
   it.
 * These people are in demand; they don‚Äôt chase opportunities, they curate them.

Think about your own industry - Who are the influencers or top players within
your niche?

I‚Äôm not talking about celebrity status. 

Instead, these people wield the most authority and influence.

They win more clients, have more freedom and lead the lifestyle you want. 

If you think it takes years or decades to become a Key Person of Influence
(KPI)... think again. 

There are plenty of people who have been in an industry for years who are NOT a
KPI.

What's missing, is their ability to master these 5 skills:

 * Learning how to Pitch your ideas and business with a lot more power.
 * Publishing thought leadership in the form of books, blogs, articles.
 * Turning your services into an ecosystem of valuable Products and productized
   service offerings people want to buy.
 * Raising your Profile in online and traditional media
 * Partnering with other high performers in your industry to access greater
   distribution, product value and brand awareness.

The Key Person of Influence book outlines the 5-step methodology for how you can
stand out, scale up and have a bigger impact with your message.

It‚Äôs been read by more than 100,000 entrepreneurs around the world and I want to
give you a copy on me.

I promise it will change the results you get in your business in ways you can‚Äôt
even imagine:

 * Francisco Bricio scaled his business exponentially from $2M to $60-70M per
   year

 * Andrew Valyear tripled his revenue in 18 months
   [https://pu693.keap-link008.com/v2/click/cbe30591fac0f0ef660d502f88a5b335/eJyNj00LgkAQhv_LnCVzLTFvISGL1iHqHFsOtGTrsM4GEv73tg88FXSd93mf4b0Do1GGZQ0ZkEsWMQRg8aRJo-G8NaxOrzAR00QE0GhzKWzrCLL7t-qYP69RlCazALgn9Mhuu8xLuSkOldyUHiVl_Yt_PLGYi1SMotV6KSsYhp9mvGpe3by8g4ytw-eiWvtVvLeN58_M1GVh2LeO3eSIIdlY5zcVtebi64oITf3ZXmL_lgwPbNVgnA==]
 * Antoinette Oglethorpe won her first business awards from becoming a KPI
   [https://pu693.keap-link008.com/v2/click/94f15f8db4f24ca0a05e9fa4119b9cce/eJyNj8EKwjAQRP9lz8XaqLH2JiJaqh5ED54k2gWDNV3SjVCk_26q0pOC1503b5kHMBplOM0hAXJyMoAALJ41aTQ8Kw2r8yuUoi9FAIU214UtHUHy-Fbt8vYaRbGUAXBN6JHddjrL0s3iuEo3mUdJWf_iH89AjEQsOtF8PU1X0DQ_zXjTPL97eQUJW4ftolz7Vby3hecvzFQlYViXjl3vhCGK5dgSrQ9q6OuKCE3-2Z5h_ZY0T2C-YDA=]

What could you achieve after mastering these 5 skills? 

Grab your copy here >>
[https://pu693.keap-link008.com/v2/click/d28c211cc16a3dccc0b49a631609db1f/eJyNj8EKgkAURf_lrUVzTCl3IiKiuYhax6hDDdrMMD4DEf-9scJVQdt3zz2POwEyQQVmDYSghmDvgQWa1VxxJjCWAmn9CgOyCYgFHRdtquWgIJy-Vdd8ubpu4G8twFExg5yOUZxnZXopsjI3qKLavPjH4xGf7MgqSg5RVsA8_zSzO8fkYeQ9hKgHtixquFmFZ90Z_oao-tBxamo3hrKvnaxo51RSto6pU6WYaD7bcza-JfMTYQRgYw==]

Hope it helps you cut through the noise Candace.

Cheers,
