Subject: The Power of Pendulation
Body Text:
Hey friends,

Quick thing before we start - the Android version of VoicePal (https://djX7c204.eu1.hubspotlinks.com/Ctc/5H+113/djX7c204/VWfkHg4mWT0KW2y9kCl3PngV9W2nfwL35m5HVXMyCDms3pyd0W7lCdLW6lZ3lHW3Nyd9R3R7DFCW5LzNb_7P9qH6W3-7M_-4xsZXgW2YsKY23cHW1FN1SSjSk2w9-NW5ZVKVP7WrWpjW411gpR8HnFYpW6yTgmP9dQp9mW2FXxp_4wP16dN4TYZ_43rlWsW1jttdt3gTyP1W8b-6ZL66rk-6W1k7cyX1N0lbyW7ZxqJ_5Y6D_5W6-d3xD6fHg_MW4w9hlV66kNffN7Ftb-hybKMgN1lL1RrjpTKPW6tQ03K2rdHfNW2BT_h_7_2WyXMWvhF9CtXfDW3rXNQG3Yj1TKW8-HTVq5Nfr_3W165X7F5LL5dvf4059GF04 ) , our AI ghostwriting app that we‚Äôve been building for 9+ months, has just launched. If you‚Äôre one of the many people who use Android, and you need/want to do a lot of writing in your work or your life, you might like to give VoicePal a try. It‚Äôs essentially a ‚ÄúGhostwriter in your Pocket‚Äù - ie: you hit record and say whatever‚Äôs on your mind, it asks you sensible follow-up questions, and it turns what you‚Äôve said into a first draft that sounds like you. It‚Äôs totally transformed my own approach to writing and creating, and it‚Äôs also helped our 2,000+ paying users on iOS (https://djX7c204.eu1.hubspotlinks.com/Ctc/5H+113/djX7c204/VWfkHg4mWT0KW2y9kCl3PngV9W2nfwL35m5HVXMyCDn23pyd0W8wLKSR6lZ3q4W8jBYyG6ZQcwfN3nvVH2P-bCLW2fGjBJ6TqDTkW4vKZR73--TlrN2dCQj29KMnPW5SQbCP1dBhxgW48gg7c8tr8NkW1PczRP7synN5W7S9qbp4wdKjqW8tmqLX5jhTXXW6fWwGJ6C_4XCW660YyV2XX9NwW8y4b6-5xLhQwW1Xbw8q35wrMpW5fdq-L5g5s6MW8P483f4XQJ93N7lgp4FJkyxSW27RvgH7vH6VJW94yW6c5ddhpqW8WMvVh2kc5xJW3dkVWH7y62hGW7ty-JL8XMDJHW9m4q8n42mcdGW7_jN1t1118rMW12DgmQ5N6Pv1W3dNl727VbKD9W6cNnmv1TtY9WW32tYwp2mWNwJf5qG4CM04 ) (and plenty of our 60k+ free users too).

Anywayyyyy, I‚Äôve just gotten back to Hong Kong from an incredible, life-changing, 7-day off-the-grid retreat hosted by Joe Hudson (https://djX7c204.eu1.hubspotlinks.com/Ctc/5H+113/djX7c204/VWfkHg4mWT0KW2y9kCl3PngV9W2nfwL35m5HVXMyCDms3pyd0W7lCdLW6lZ3lzW8fyq574Dc0gGW3rLqh417HyLgW2X1GpX2J_s2_W8JZ0_B2kd7cqW3-29FP6T_LJbW2NdBc57y_JsyW1XZh9G5LXjh1W3GhcX03L9xTGW5ZC6F076QDZkW1zbDk_5-CSRmW8tPGB95dNNSSW1H_PGb7711SBW7g-G2Z5vLN-mW5_13gc7dSTZVW1PXZTw90fbbKW3Fd-Lg63Fmg5W61B9gt93YymlW5wknKt4bC902W1x3-Py2j_V8TW92mX6q8mhnjxW4yLNyG7ZfjLJW6plDCB1g7WCGW77NdZq4R0bYFV3vYmJ2dl0LVf5Ll3fq04 ) and the Art of Accomplishment (https://djX7c204.eu1.hubspotlinks.com/Ctc/5H+113/djX7c204/VWfkHg4mWT0KW2y9kCl3PngV9W2nfwL35m5HVXMyCDms3pyd0W7lCdLW6lZ3lzW8fyq574Dc0gGW3rLqh417HyLgW2X1GpX2J_s2_W8JZ0_B2kd7cqW3-29FP6T_LJbW2NdBc57y_JsyW1XZh9G5LXjh1W3GhcX03L9xTGW5ZC6F076QDZkW1zbDk_5-CSRmW8tPGB95dNNSSW1H_PGb7711SBW7g-G2Z5vLN-mW5_13gc7dSTZVW1PXZTw90fbbKW3Fd-Lg63Fmg5W61B9gt93YymlW5wknKt4bC902W1x3-Py2j_V8TW92mX6q8mhnjxW4yLNyG7ZfjLJW6plDCB1g7WCGW77NdZq4R0bYFV3vYmJ2dl0LVf5Ll3fq04 ) team in California. I'm still in the process of distilling all the learnings, many of which are pretty hard to explain. But there's one concept that stuck with me, which I wanted to share with you today, and it's called pendulation.

The word itself comes from the world of trauma therapy, but it‚Äôs a useful concept outside of that too. It describes that natural back-and-forth movement‚Äîlike a pendulum‚Äîwhen we‚Äôre learning or integrating something new into our lives. Here‚Äôs a story that Joe and Tara, the retreat facilitators, told us to illustrate this:

Imagine a baby learning to walk. You wouldn't expect that baby to just get up one day and walk perfectly. No, the baby first crawls, and then when it starts trying to walk, it gets up, stumbles, and falls. But after a while, it takes a few steps and falls again. And when it falls, it doesn‚Äôt think, "Oh no, I failed at walking. I‚Äôll never be able to walk again!" It hasn‚Äôt yet learned that particular thought pattern üòâ Instead, it just tries again. It gets up, it takes a few steps, it stumbles, it falls again.  Eventually, after enough of this back-and-forth process‚Äîthis pendulation‚Äîthe baby learns to walk with confidence.

Joe and Tara used this story to explain how we can approach integrating new lessons into our lives. We shouldn‚Äôt expect to just nail it on the first try. Instead, pendulation is part of the process‚Äîthere are going to be moments where we feel like we‚Äôve got it, and others where it feels like we‚Äôve completely lost it. And that‚Äôs okay.

This got me thinking about how much this concept applies to so many areas of life.

Take YouTube, for example. When people join my Part-Time YouTuber Academy (https://djX7c204.eu1.hubspotlinks.com/Ctc/5H+113/djX7c204/VWfkHg4mWT0KW2y9kCl3PngV9W2nfwL35m5HVXMyCDms3pyd0W7lCdLW6lZ3mYW55Cjyg2q3YmTW6x_LlJ2JxVhcVSVP385Nw3ZbW8GDF6K6K35MGV5w51-2-N7B1N234T97rgP3hW3HqY7C6-SMX1W3tllbQ2yWLCPW3VcHqz767_WtW2dBh718Fk8d-W1cQ2Lg62rpthW72VtZ93byw2kW9cGvqX60y1FjW8GnZ_k8vX-6VW2q7S4N2Ws3VTVbl8Y230JcvGN4QQkFWR9R_wW1dpdSx5B4xc9W5-fqm11r4szgN7htz5YT1-CtW9gx_sS43lXvNW1_ScM_18jtmTW7JnCJR9631khN4QWSKNvMNRQf8P1BF004 ) , they‚Äôre super excited in the first few weeks, making videos and learning all the things. But then life happens. Maybe they stop uploading for a few weeks, or even months. The people who succeed, though, are the ones who get back up. They recognise that the gap in consistency isn‚Äôt a sign of failure‚Äîit‚Äôs just pendulation. They start making videos again, and over time, with enough back-and-forth, it becomes second nature.

I‚Äôve been experiencing this with my own health journey too. Since turning 30, I‚Äôve been taking my health more seriously. But it‚Äôs not been smooth sailing. There are times when I‚Äôm super consistent with the gym and eating well, and other times when I‚Äôm traveling or just out of routine, and everything falls off. The key I‚Äôve learned is to not beat myself up when I‚Äôm off-track. That‚Äôs just pendulation at work. You pick yourself up, you get back to it, and over time, you improve.

This concept has also been a massive mindset shift for me when it comes to my productivity system. Earlier this year, I was super consistent with my weekly reviews and morning manifestos, but then life got in the way‚Äîgetting married, going to Burning Man‚Äîand I slipped. Tbh, I‚Äôve been inconsistent with my productivity systems for years. I get excited about new tools like Building a Second Brain (https://djX7c204.eu1.hubspotlinks.com/Ctc/5H+113/djX7c204/VWfkHg4mWT0KW2y9kCl3PngV9W2nfwL35m5HVXMyCDms3pyd0W7lCdLW6lZ3kVW8-b4ll3-PSfhW6kp3-w3Wfn4-W614FWF8JBSqwVCd1BN4N___BN6y67KKRcgtnW42xMNW30lBKVW3hSY0V8L8nhMW76LCDp3Y3mh8W6ZKKbR8NWbF_W2pn07b2tR132W4yM7V12rN5Q_W5fQHPn6rWM3hW52gvgb1Y6vzXW3nFz6N4CH8t3W6q8qzT2FLDwlW8mKxty4mdyFVW2fs3_58FJr5xW8hT9Sn6DftD9W79J8QS5T5SJgW7bNdNs4-p71BW58dZGD2k_wk1W6W84LQ6GZY7nW4jTzqG2Jg1WXW2qs3G35CncCQf4qjfjR04 ) or reading Getting Things Done, and I‚Äôll stay organised for a while. But then the pendulum swings back, and I find myself in chaos again. And that‚Äôs okay.

What‚Äôs been liberating for me is realising that even though I‚Äôve gone through these cycles, I‚Äôve been slowly moving forwards over time. It‚Äôs 3 step forwards in periods of consistency, and then 2 steps back when life falls into chaos. Rinse and repeat. But over time, I‚Äôm still moving in the direction I want to be. And despite having (plenty of) these periods of inconsistency with my own productivity habits, I‚Äôve still somehow ended up as a ‚Äúproductivity expert‚Äù and convinced a publisher into letting me write a book (https://djX7c204.eu1.hubspotlinks.com/Ctc/5H+113/djX7c204/VWfkHg4mWT0KW2y9kCl3PngV9W2nfwL35m5HVXMyCDms3pyd0W7lCdLW6lZ3lzN3zxfbJbnmQ5W7Rf5xw2SGKgzW2vQdQG1jdWqRW525NPC1V1mBxW6YPhrv6nHnXpW7mg1DN4pT4nkW4_91rY5MW76wN1D_NpTfYlHGW6TVrLn4tfw09W8JdtcZ1tWYMrW6B6FFs3xcCR6W5CbLXQ5Wj1K0W2rRjsJ78DqmJVk7fFf6sQ15RW2zX6P05phSgHN8tSdJMjZkK8W4bK8KL642lxdW9k7dBv6KWVzQW6BflZ38Dm2rkW4KgW-Q5VdBBkW1Ptrwh7mgQPHW1nd2-18gV_FZW5CfSrX2Bj9KVMsxdZ2XGmk3f22XY4M04 ) about it that‚Äôs been translated into 30+ languages üòÇ

If you look at business growth, it‚Äôs the same story. With every business, there are periods of rapid growth, and then plateaus, or even declines. This expanding and contracting is natural‚Äîit‚Äôs like the beating of a heart. A heart that only contracts or only expands can‚Äôt beat. It‚Äôs the movement between the two that keeps things alive.

So, if you‚Äôve been hard on yourself for not being consistent with your goals‚Äîwhether it‚Äôs creating content, sticking to your health routine, or staying on top of your to-do list‚Äîgive yourself some grace. Recognise that pendulation is part of the process. As long as you keep getting back up, you‚Äôll keep moving forward.

At the end of the day, consistency is great, but no one‚Äôs going to care how perfectly you stuck to your habits. What really matters is whether you enjoyed the journey and connected with the people who matter to you along the way.

Have a great week!

days of client (or your own) content in just 2 steps.

far over 400 people have downloaded it:

Once you‚Äôve planned out 90 days of content you won‚Äôt have to

have to do is look at your list and create the piece of content

Body Text:
Candace,

Congratulations, You‚Äôre in!

02:00PM Tuesday, 10th June America/New_York

‚ö° ADD TO CALENDAR ‚ûù add the event to my calendar!

this email.

Looking forward to helping dramatically increase inbound leads and sales.

To your success,

Topher Morrison
, Dent Global

stand out.

Subject: ‚è∞ A Simple Question That Changed My Perspective on Time
Body Text:
Hey friends,

Yesterday I shared the Magic Lamp journaling prompt - lots of
kind, inspiring replies to that email, so thank you to everyone
who replied with their own vision for what their answer to that
question would be.

Today I want to share another thought exercise / journaling
prompt to get your juices flowing while we‚Äôre in the midst of
‚ÄúNew Year New Me‚Äù energy.

This one comes from the YouTube channel / podcast Graham Cochrane
(
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/lmur20nw6mimhn577zwf6h8lo4v00bg/wnh2h6uwldxvnxhl/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vQEdyYWhhbUNvY2hyYW5l
). I first came across Graham‚Äôs videos 8+ years ago when I was
first getting into trying to become a music YouTuber. The first
few videos I ever made were of me and my friends singing covers
of popular songs, and Graham‚Äôs YouTube channel Recording
Revolution (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/lmur20nw6mimhn577zwf6h8lo4v00bg/reh8h9u0opwv4xi6/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vQHJlY29yZGluZ3Jldm9sdXRpb24=
) was helpful in teaching me about microphone positioning, audio
engineering, mixing and the like. Fast forward many years, and
now Graham‚Äôs pivoted into being a (rather good) business coach
instead of ‚Äúthe audio tutorial guy‚Äù. I binged a few episodes of
his podcast over the holidays and loved this simple question he
posed in one of them:

‚ÅâÔ∏è What would you do differently if you didn‚Äôt feel you were
running out of time?

When I heard that, I paused the video, and let it sit for a few
moments. What would I do differently if didn‚Äôt feel like I was
running out of time? That question made me realise that I often
approach business (and sometimes even life) like I‚Äôm in a race
against some invisible clock. YouTube channel‚Äôs not growing as
fast as it used to. We could be launching products faster. Speed
of execution is important. I should get started with the next
book. I shouldn‚Äôt put more time into this video, I should just
get it out there. Etc.

I was listening to this episode while I was walking in the local
park, so I paused the video, opened up VoicePal (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/lmur20nw6mimhn577zwf6h8lo4v00bg/08hwhgudp4gwvqbp/aHR0cHM6Ly92b2ljZXBhbC5tZQ==
), and recorded my thoughts in response to the prompt:

What would I do in my business if I didn‚Äôt feel like I was
running out of time? I would definitely take my time with product
launches. I wouldn‚Äôt worry so much about trying to film something
every day. Some days, like this one, I‚Äôd wake up, have a
leisurely morning, and explore until creative inspiration
strikes‚Äîlike I did this morning for the productivity system.

If I wasn‚Äôt concerned about running out of time, I would focus on
making existing things better for our students rather than
constantly launching new things. I‚Äôd concentrate on really
understanding what our students want and need, then figure out
how to deliver it in a scalable way, like we‚Äôre doing with
Productivity Lab (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/lmur20nw6mimhn577zwf6h8lo4v00bg/8ghqh3ul78qpzwal/aHR0cHM6Ly9hbGlhYmRhYWwuY29tL3NwYXJr
). I would be more hands-on with projects and take my time with
approvals, making sure I‚Äôve thoroughly worked on offers before
launching them.

Right now, I aim to film about three things a week‚Äîsometimes even
trying to film daily. But I wouldn‚Äôt be wedded to doing two
videos per week if time wasn‚Äôt a concern. I would be comfortable
spending more time learning rather than just outputting content.

I think I would focus more intensely on how I can help people. If
I wasn‚Äôt concerned about running out of time, the true North Star
would be: Does this help our students achieve their dreams? Does
this actually help them build the life they want, achieve
financial freedom, or whatever their goal might be?

If I wasn‚Äôt trying to grow the business as fast as possible, I
would probably be more relaxed about hiring. I would focus on
building a base of recurring revenue where people are genuinely
delighted to pay each month or year.

I would prioritize life stuff more and go with my energy. On days
when I don‚Äôt feel like working, I wouldn‚Äôt force myself. If I
feel inspired on weekends, I might work then. It would be a more
fluid balance rather than trying to confine everything into rigid
structures.

I wouldn‚Äôt think of weekends as weekends or weekdays as workdays.
While still keeping some meetings on the calendar, I‚Äôd treat all
time as fluid exploration. Sometimes I might feel like doing
nothing or reading a book. Other times, I might want to watch
videos or play video games. And sometimes, when the energy is
right, I‚Äôd make YouTube videos, work on products, or build
frameworks. I would follow these natural rhythms if I wasn‚Äôt
concerned about running out of time.

Graham mentioned in the podcast that pretty much every business
owner he works with has this constant feeling that ‚Äútime‚Äôs
running out‚Äù, ‚Äúwe‚Äôve gotta move faster‚Äù etc. I certainly have
that - even though I‚Äôm the Feel-Good Productivity (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/lmur20nw6mimhn577zwf6h8lo4v00bg/vqh3hmupq6e3llfw/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5mZWVsZ29vZHByb2R1Y3Rpdml0eS5jb20vYW1hem9u
) guy, and I‚Äôve researched and written 3 chapters on the
importance of rest, energy conservation and burnout prevention, I
still often need to remember to take my own advice. It‚Äôs okay to
slow down sometimes. Time isn‚Äôt running out. We got this.

That‚Äôs not to say you should 100% always operate like this -
speed clearly has benefits. But as with most things, a virtue
taken to excess becomes a vice üòä

So I‚Äôll put the question to you:

What would you do differently, in your work and/or life, if you
didn‚Äôt feel like you were running out of time?

Have a great week!

Ali xx

PS: Over the last few weeks, my friends and I built an app called
Superfocus (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/lmur20nw6mimhn577zwf6h8lo4v00bg/m2h7h6u8lxm0vzcl/aHR0cHM6Ly9zdXBlcmZvY3VzLm1lLw==
) to help us be more focused and less distracted. It was
initially a side project, but we got some solid feedback and so
we want to launch it as a proper app soon. Check out the
walkthrough here (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/lmur20nw6mimhn577zwf6h8lo4v00bg/m2h7h6u8lxm0vzcl/aHR0cHM6Ly9zdXBlcmZvY3VzLm1lLw==
). If you like the idea, we‚Äôd love to have you as a Founding
Member, where you get lifetime access to the app at a steep
discount in return for giving us feedback and helping shape the
product. More info here if that sounds interesting (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/lmur20nw6mimhn577zwf6h8lo4v00bg/m2h7h6u8lxm0vzcl/aHR0cHM6Ly9zdXBlcmZvY3VzLm1lLw==
) üòä

PPS: Even if I had all the time in the world, I‚Äôd still listen to
audiobooks at least at 1.5x speed - I just find that they‚Äôre more
enjoyable that way.

-----------------------------------------------------------------
‚ö°Ô∏è WeWork - Energise Your Work in 2025 (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/lmur20nw6mimhn577zwf6h8lo4v00bg/dphehmu02x8wvgbl/aHR0cDovL3dlLmNvL2FsaTE1
)‚Äã
-----------------------------------------------------------------

One of my goals for 2025 is to more regularly leverage the power
of co-working to make my work more energising. If you‚Äôre a
freelancer, remote worker or entrepreneur that‚Äôs just getting
started, then you‚Äôll probably know that feeling when you're just
working from home and the days begin to blur into one another and
eventually you‚Äôre left feeling a bit demotivated, de-energised,
and bored.

So, this year, I‚Äôm going to be using WeWork (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/lmur20nw6mimhn577zwf6h8lo4v00bg/dphehmu02x8wvgbl/aHR0cDovL3dlLmNvL2FsaTE1
) to escape this depressing cycle. A WeWork (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/lmur20nw6mimhn577zwf6h8lo4v00bg/dphehmu02x8wvgbl/aHR0cDovL3dlLmNvL2FsaTE1
) All Access membership is perfect for people looking to build
healthy routines to help meet their goals. You get access to
beautiful, convenient spaces across hundreds of locations around
the world to get stuff done in, plus free WiFi and private
meeting rooms. Ever since I started using their spaces back in
Cambridge, heading to WeWork (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/lmur20nw6mimhn577zwf6h8lo4v00bg/dphehmu02x8wvgbl/aHR0cDovL3dlLmNvL2FsaTE1
) has also allowed me to meet other entrepreneurs and interesting
people which means I always finish the workday energised - not
drained.

So, if you‚Äôre looking to boost your motivation, increase your
productivity, and feel better during your workday, then I highly
recommend WeWork (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/lmur20nw6mimhn577zwf6h8lo4v00bg/dphehmu02x8wvgbl/aHR0cDovL3dlLmNvL2FsaTE1
).

You can get an exclusive 15% off your WeWork All Access
membership with the code ALI15. Check out the link here (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/lmur20nw6mimhn577zwf6h8lo4v00bg/dphehmu02x8wvgbl/aHR0cDovL3dlLmNvL2FsaTE1
) and start 2025 productive and energised

Thanks to WeWork (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/lmur20nw6mimhn577zwf6h8lo4v00bg/dphehmu02x8wvgbl/aHR0cDovL3dlLmNvL2FsaTE1
) for sponsoring this issue of LifeNotes. üôè

üéü Want to advertise in LifeNotes (300,000+ subs)?

Get in touch (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/lmur20nw6mimhn577zwf6h8lo4v00bg/e0hph0u0dzqw63h7/YW5ndXNAYWxpYWJkYWFsLmNvbQ==
)

Whenever you're ready, here are some more ways I can (hopefully)
help you:

Double your productivity and do more of what matters to you:

üìï Read or listen to my book Feel-Good Productivity (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/lmur20nw6mimhn577zwf6h8lo4v00bg/7qh7h2uoxewpqra9/aHR0cHM6Ly9nby5mZWVsZ29vZHByb2R1Y3Rpdml0eS5jb20vbGlmZW5vdGVz
).

Subject: ‚ö°Ô∏è You're Invited to Productivity Spark 2025 (for FREE)
Body Text:
Hey Candace,

As we approach the end of the year, I‚Äôve been thinking a lot about how we can make 2025 a year of real, meaningful progress.

If you‚Äôre anything like me, you‚Äôve probably set ambitious goals before, only to watch them lose steam after a few weeks. It‚Äôs not because we lack motivation ‚Äî it‚Äôs because we often don‚Äôt have the right plan to turn those goals into action.

That‚Äôs why I‚Äôm so excited to announce Productivity Spark 2025: a completely free, live, and virtual productivity summit happening the first weekend of January, designed to help you plan your most productive year yet and start taking immediate action on your biggest goals.

You can register by clicking this link:

üëâ Join the FREE Productivity Summit
(https://djX7c204.eu1.hubspotlinks.com/Ctc/5H+113/djX7c204/VWcmhX46Ml33VHWQHz80Y8NjW3Z50n15pss1_MyCDms3pyd0W7lCdLW6lZ3pTW69x9xh3fQ4YVVL0c-G5QHDqvW9ffxH983bQmhW2xQ_PM3TR-xnW5ghfvD8MQtgnW1vww_x8J0xZGW9879vR2Y0CK9VTCJ_J59M7q0W7C9m3m7Gq-hxW52WMfz9kCnqXW1G2Nht5vRCsLW3rjVDf4LmZnLW3mkzrQ8-NVWRW1VzYNP99wqRtW1wVntL1JzgTqW2KSts32Z4WmyW73m-DR97TXCpW94TySJ1GTPhLW81MKwy4TRJK5W1NdryK7NM4fYW3wRyZs6Tr9ZVW3ZnKtR35M-rMW4dqYKW6X9JF9W1--Rpp99RV2Lf4GP6gn04 )

What to Expect:

This summit isn‚Äôt about cramming your schedule or overloading you with productivity hacks. Nor is it about passively listening to the same productivity advice you‚Äôve heard a million times before.

At Productivity Spark 2025, we‚Äôre focusing on interactive, taught sessions designed to help you leave with something tangible. Whether it‚Äôs a roadmap for your goals, a clear action plan for your projects, or a new productivity system, you‚Äôll walk away with more than just inspiration ‚Äî you‚Äôll leave with a real toolkit for success.

Here‚Äôs how we‚Äôre structuring the event to make it as actionable as possible:

- Core sessions from me where we‚Äôll dive deep into planning strategies and productivity systems. These aren‚Äôt just lectures ‚Äî they‚Äôre hands-on workshops where you‚Äôll work on your own goals in real-time.
- Guest-led workshops from incredible speakers (details coming soon!) with a focus on practical exercises and frameworks you can immediately apply.
- Interactive activities to help you craft your 2025 roadmap, so you leave with a clear, actionable plan.
- VIP Bonus Workshops on AI Powered Productivity, that you can access after registration.

Everything is designed to help you take action. No fluff. No ‚Äúone-size-fits-all‚Äù advice. Just practical tools and inspiration to set you up for success.

Why You Should Join:

The start of the year is when we‚Äôre most motivated to make changes, but without the right plan, that motivation can fizzle out fast.

Productivity Spark 2025 is here to give you the clarity, structure, and momentum you need to hit the ground running.

Whether you‚Äôre looking to:

- Start a side hustle
- Grow your YouTube channel
- Achieve work-life balance
- Or finally tackle that passion project you‚Äôve been putting off

‚Ä¶this summit will set you up for success for the year ahead ü•≥

Mark Your Calendar:

üìÖ When: Saturday 4 January 2025 - Sunday 5 January 2025

üñ•Ô∏è Where: Online ‚Äî join from anywhere in the world

If you‚Äôre interested in joining you can register down below where I‚Äôll be sharing more details of the event, including the full lineup of speakers:

üëâ Join the FREE Productivity Summit
(https://djX7c204.eu1.hubspotlinks.com/Ctc/5H+113/djX7c204/VWcmhX46Ml33VHWQHz80Y8NjW3Z50n15pss1_MyCDms3pyd0W7lCdLW6lZ3pTW69x9xh3fQ4YVVL0c-G5QHDqvW9ffxH983bQmhW2xQ_PM3TR-xnW5ghfvD8MQtgnW1vww_x8J0xZGW9879vR2Y0CK9VTCJ_J59M7q0W7C9m3m7Gq-hxW52WMfz9kCnqXW1G2Nht5vRCsLW3rjVDf4LmZnLW3mkzrQ8-NVWRW1VzYNP99wqRtW1wVntL1JzgTqW2KSts32Z4WmyW73m-DR97TXCpW94TySJ1GTPhLW81MKwy4TRJK5W1NdryK7NM4fYW3wRyZs6Tr9ZVW3ZnKtR35M-rMW4dqYKW6X9JF9W1--Rpp99RV2Lf4GP6gn04 )

Let‚Äôs kick-start 2025 together and make it a year to remember üòú

Speak soon!

Ali xx

Sent with ‚ù§Ô∏è from Ali Abdaal Ltd.

16-19 Eastcastle Street , Fitzrovia, London, W1W 8DY, United Kingdom

Unsubscribe from some / all of our emails (https://hs-143785640.s.hubspotemail-eu1.net/hs/preferences-center/en/page?data=W2nVjwf3Y2w_LW2x-mHb2-vG0RW3DW-KY4pn-yTW2KqB073bqRR3W32KdCt1QkY5VW2YNmb54fGwbMW2FKVcp2TLkMhW2xLx0D21j9GHW2nT5xM3P3SdCW1Xv1mg2HYKrdW38D2l725k3kdW3LY3kV3b5r4PW24SHgR2TrRXDW30J8YY2WhjCfW4kx3443jl450W1Q51jy3ZHkW2W2nRnFP32CrW8W30n_BV25m9gMW43s3bt3bd4VjW2MB5WW2KWRk0W41nbrx1VtPgWW3NDbjY1ZkRCWW4rnNvr2FM531W2TxrQn2vD3vGW4hrg1l1XftZ_W38bDJ34pCcDJW3zkrqY1X9hyrW41Gw4M3SPqTNW23rw2C4mLX3wW3Vyh842t0n_4W4hy5X234gHSpW1Vtk9h3g7qZWW2YxSy53QV_McW2CDCml3dfv4DW2MSHZW47ks__W4hDGV_3gmBvkW3Xvb8C345DGRW2PsNkW3DMdkCW1ZvfDD253Ky6W1_lwXZ1NdD1VW38ghS42WzmFjW3W0fJW1VvGDqW4m970W4rp81wW45TjZp2zM8lqW2PCdsD2TzYp1W4kvrjz3gblFjW1V7rMm1BGMJJ0&_hsenc=p2ANqtz--TFXmuAo-M4E1Y8b__lGlZoIu3q-bman0CMEYDqQpFAV9Bl1SukxS_9T0AeInHzu5wyzBGhzyqtPC714EA7JML2jvWgg&_hsmi=100543898 ) üò¢

Subject: üí¨¬†What Would Your Future Self Tell You?
Body Text:
Hey friends,

Hope you had a great weekend üôå

Quick thing before we start - if you want to learn how to grow
and monetise a YouTube channel, then you might be interested in
checking out CreatorNotes. It‚Äôs my weekly email newsletter for
creators where I share practical insights on all things content
creation, audience growth, and making money on YouTube, and you
can subscribe in one click by clicking the link here. (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/wvugd3nzo9bghkg333xa7hnqzlzxxi8h4lw6v/3oh4z6kdsdu34xpnomfp/aHR0cHM6Ly9hbGlhYmRhYWwuY29tL2NvbmZpcm1hdGlvbi9jcmVhdG9yLW5vdGVzLW9wdC1pbi1jb25maXJtYXRpb24v
)‚Äã

Anyway, in today‚Äôs email I wanted to share a journalling prompt
that I frequently return to when I‚Äôm getting caught up in
day-to-day tasks and stresses: ‚ÄúIf your future self could send
you a text message right now, what would it say?‚Äù

There‚Äôs something so powerful about imagining your future self
looking back at this exact moment and thinking about things like
what would they want you to know? What would they encourage you
to do more of? Or what would they gently tell you to stop
worrying about?

When I sat down with this prompt myself, I wrote down three
things.

1Ô∏è‚É£ My future self told me to be more present when I‚Äôm with my
daughter because she‚Äôs at that stage where she‚Äôs literally
changing every week - making new sounds, making new expressions,
finding new ways of seeing the world - and I know this time‚Äôs
going to fly by faster than I can possibly imagine.

2Ô∏è‚É£ The second thing was to spend more time building friendships
here in Hong Kong. Since having a baby, I‚Äôve basically been
neglecting all the friendship stuff (except when team members
come to visit) but I know that the longer I wait, the harder
it‚Äôll be to build a social life from scratch.

3Ô∏è‚É£ Third, my future self told me to chill out on the work front
a bit.

At this stage in the business, I don‚Äôt need to be putting in long
hours but somehow I always find myself filling all my time with
work, whether that be coming up with interesting new frameworks
for YouTube videos we‚Äôve got coming up on the channel or creating
new course material for our Lifestyle Business Academy students.

And it‚Äôs not that I‚Äôm forcing myself to do work I hate - I
genuinely enjoy this stuff and I feel very lucky to be able to do
what I do but there‚Äôs this weird thing where, because I enjoy it,
I use that as justification to keep working instead of actually
living my life.

When I answered this journalling prompt recently, I specifically
made note of Cal Newport‚Äôs concept of fixed schedule
productivity, which is where you basically define your working
hours - let‚Äôs say 10am to 6pm - and then you have to make your
work fit within that constraint.

If not, then it just rolls over to the next day, instead the
evening or the weekend because that time becomes ring-fenced for
what actually matters. So for me that could look like spending
time with Izzy and our baby or finally building those friendships
I‚Äôve been neglecting.

Fixed schedule productivity sounds incredibly simple, I know‚Ä¶ but
the workaholic in me always likes to find reasons why I need to
keep working beyond 6pm or why a certain task can‚Äôt wait until
tomorrow. So this is something I‚Äôm actively working on changing
before 2026 (and hopefully, future Ali will thank me for it üòâ).

The interesting thing about this exercise is that none of these
insights were particularly surprising to me and it‚Äôs not like I
discovered some hidden truth about myself that I‚Äôd never
considered before. But there‚Äôs something about framing it as
advice from your future self that makes it feel more urgent and
real, rather than just another item on a random ‚ÄúI should
probably do this at some point‚Äù list.

Insights like these also only emerge when you actually take the
time to sit with these questions - not just when you‚Äôre thinking
about them for a few minutes while making coffee or sitting on
the toilet (we‚Äôve all done it before ü´£), but when you genuinely
create space for reflection.

So my challenge for you this week is to set aside some proper
time to ask yourself this question.

Step away from your usual environment - maybe take yourself to a
quiet, vibey coffee shop or a local park if the weather‚Äôs nice -
and turn off all your notifications so you‚Äôre not tempted to
check your phone every few minutes.

I‚Äôd also suggest writing out your answers instead of just
thinking about them, because there‚Äôs something about the act of
putting pen to paper (or fingers to keyboard) that helps clarify
your thoughts and often surfaces things you didn‚Äôt even realise
you were thinking.

Plus, you can always come back to what you‚Äôve written in a few
months and see whether you actually listened to your future self
or just carried on as usual.

If you give this exercise a go, I‚Äôd genuinely love to hear what
comes up for you - hit reply and let me know.

Have a great rest of your week üôå

Ali xx

P.S - if you‚Äôre interested in diving deeper into this kind of
reflective work, the Life Compass module within my flagship
productivity course - LifeOS (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/wvugd3nzo9bghkg333xa7hnqzlzxxi8h4lw6v/08hwhgu2gnlko6fp/aHR0cHM6Ly9hbGlhYmRhYWwuY29tL2xpZmVvcz91dG1fY2FtcGFpZ249ZnV0dXJlXzEwJnV0bV9tZWRpdW09ZW1haWwmdXRtX3NvdXJjZT1wcm9kdWN0aXZlbm90ZXM=
) - is designed to help you get clear on your direction and
values, and we‚Äôve got a whole bunch of prompts just like this one
that help you actually figure out what matters to you (rather
than what you think should matter to you, which is often very
different üòÖ).

So if you want to join over 3,500 other people who‚Äôve taken
LifeOS (

Subject: Day #4 Livestream Starting Soon
Body Text:
Kaggle


Hello Candace,

Today's livestream starts at 11 AM PT / 7 PM CET / 11:30 PM IST. Click hereto join!

Paige Bailey will be joined by Donny Cheung, Scott Coull, Ewa Dominowska,Chris Grier, Anant Nawalgaria and Karthik Raman to discuss domain specificmodels.

For the complete list of scheduled livestreams and past recordings, checkout this YouTube playlist.

See you soon!

The Kaggle Team






Google

Subject: 5-Day Gen AI Intensive Course with Google - Now as a Learn Guide!
Body Text:
Kaggle







Hi Candace Grant,

We're excited to announce that Kaggle's 5-Day Generative AI IntensiveCourse with Google is now available as a self-paced Learn Guide!

This live event was held from March 31- April 4, 2025, and is now madeavailable as a self-paced learning guide for anyone interested inunderstanding the fundamental technologies and techniques behind GenerativeAI.





Access Learn Guide Here



This learn guide covers:


Foundational LLMs & Prompt Engineering
Embeddings & Vector Databases
Generative Agents & Agent Companions
Domain-specific LLMs
MLOps for Generative AI


Access whitepapers, podcasts, code labs, and recorded livestreams‚Äîalldesigned to help you build your Generative AI expertise. Join Kaggle'sDiscord to collaborate with other participants.

Happy learning!

The Kaggle Team



Kaggle, Inc 1600 Amphitheatre Pkwy Mountain View, CA 94043

This email was sent to aicoaching2025@gmail.com because you indicated thatyou'd like to receive news and updates about Kaggle. If you don't want toreceive these emails in the future, please unsubscribe here. You can alsochange your preferences on your account's profile page by logging in atkaggle.com.

Subject: How I made $20,000/mo as a writer
Body Text:
One of the saddest things about ghostwriting?

People think ghostwriters are:

* Broke
* Unhappy
* And burned out

They believe the tired clich√© of ‚ÄúNobody makes a living as a
writer!‚Äù

But here‚Äôs the thing:

There‚Äôs a grain of truth to this clich√©‚Ä¶ if you‚Äôre a writer that
charges per word or per hour.

But there‚Äôs another type of writer that doesn‚Äôt do this‚Äîand guess
who‚Äôs making all the cash?

‚Äã
I know this is true because I was one of those writers charging
per word or per hour and I struggled to make rent (and I even
thought about going back to my 9 to 5).

But then I started charging for ASSETS and OUTCOMES and
everything changed.

*****************************************************************
You can build a lucrative Premium Ghostwriting business with this
simple reframe.
*****************************************************************

It took me thousands of hours to figure out how to package and
price my services so I could charge high-profile clients my
high-ticket prices (which helped me reach my first $20k month and
then $180k/month 2 years later).

But if you want to start seeing results faster, you need someone
who can coach you and mentor you (so you don‚Äôt make all the
painful mistakes I made throughout the years).

And this requires an investment in yourself.

So, if you‚Äôre serious about building a side hustle you can use to
finally escape your 9 to 5, I‚Äôd love to be your mentor.

-----------------------------------------------------------------
‚ÄãClick here to take the next step to build a profitable writing
business. (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/5quwmrrklwc7hve9omoh6h9pxg444sn/l2hdnzmxh6u3xn5dwdfg/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cucHJlbWl1bWdob3N0d3JpdGluZ2FjYWRlbXkuY29tL2tpY2tzdGFydGVyLWNhbGw_ZWw9TndfTm92MTgmaGU9YWljb2FjaGluZzIwMjUlNDBnbWFpbC5jb20=
)‚Äã
-----------------------------------------------------------------

See you inside üôÇ

Nicolas Cole

Co-Founder, Premium Ghostwriting Academy

PS‚Ä¶ A question I hear a lot:

‚ÄúIs there really a lot of demand for ghostwriters?‚Äù

Yes, there is!

Jayana here is a great example.

She just landed her 5th ghostwriting project (and is working with
a dream client!).

Of course, not everyone who joins PGA gets these kind of results.

But we like to show that it is possible to start landing
multiple, high-paying clients by becoming a Premium Ghostwriter.

‚ÄãClick here to take the next step to kickstart your Premium
Ghostwriting journey. (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/5quwmrrklwc7hve9omoh6h9pxg444sn/m2hr8959a6u84qklwlsl/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cucHJlbWl1bWdob3N0d3JpdGluZ2FjYWRlbXkuY29tL2tpY2tzdGFydGVyLWNhbGw_ZWw9TndfTm92MTgmaGU9YWljb2FjaGluZzIwMjUlNDBnbWFpbC5jb20=
)‚Äã

‚Äã

1. No longer interested in hearing about Premium Ghostwriting
Academy? No worries. Click here to unsubscribe (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/5quwmrrklwc7hve9omoh6h9pxg444sn/vqh846lobmupwv2q85bw/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cuc2hpcDMwZm9yMzAuY29tL3ByZWZlcmVuY2VzLWNvbmZpcm1lZA==
)from all Premium Ghostwriting Academy emails.

2. No longer want to receive Ship 30 emails? You can click here
to unsubscribe (
https://unsubscribe.convertkit-mail.com/5quwmrrklwc7hve9omoh6h9pxg444sn
) from all future updates from us. (By unsubscribing, you will
also stop receiving updates about products you might have bought

Hey Candace,

Let‚Äôs be honest: most productivity advice doesn‚Äôt work.

You‚Äôve probably tried at least one of these approaches before:

‚úÖ Downloading a fancy new productivity app

‚úÖ Reading yet another book on habits and time management

‚úÖ Following someone else‚Äôs ‚Äúperfect‚Äù morning routine

‚úÖ Creating a detailed to-do list (that never gets done)

And yet‚Ä¶

üëâ You still struggle with procrastination.

üëâ You still feel overwhelmed by your workload.

üëâ You still can‚Äôt seem to stay consistent with your goals.

It‚Äôs not your fault.

The truth is, most productivity systems aren‚Äôt designed to
actually work for you.

They‚Äôre designed to give you structure - but they don‚Äôt help you
stick with it.

That‚Äôs where LifeOS (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/qdumn6rew9u7h446ww2hlh83g0kkkt4/dphehmu03x0gl2fl/aHR0cHM6Ly9hbGlhYmRhYWwuY29tL2xpZmVvcw==
) is different.

Why Most Productivity Systems Fail
----------------------------------

Most systems fail for one of three reasons:

1Ô∏è‚É£ They‚Äôre not designed for YOUR life.

Most productivity systems assume everyone operates the same way.
But you‚Äôre not a robot. You have unique energy levels, personal
preferences, and natural rhythms that affect how you work best.

2Ô∏è‚É£ They rely too much on motivation.

Motivation is unreliable. Some days you wake up ready to conquer
the world. Other days, you just want to stay in bed. If your
system only works when you "feel like it," it‚Äôs destined to fail.

3Ô∏è‚É£ They don‚Äôt provide built-in accountability.

If you‚Äôre the only one holding yourself accountable, it‚Äôs easy to
fall off track. A great productivity system removes friction and
makes it easy to stay consistent - even on the tough days.

That‚Äôs why LifeOS isn‚Äôt just another productivity system.

It‚Äôs a system that actually works for YOU.

)

How LifeOS Fixes This
---------------------

üîπ It‚Äôs Custom-Built for You

LifeOS isn‚Äôt a rigid framework. It helps you design a system
based on your natural tendencies, strengths, and goals, so it
actually sticks.

üîπ It Works Even When Motivation Fails

With LifeOS, you won‚Äôt have to rely on motivation. You‚Äôll build
repeatable habits, routines, and workflows that keep you moving
forward, even when motivation is low.

üîπ It‚Äôs Designed for Long-Term Success

LifeOS isn‚Äôt a quick-fix hack. It‚Äôs a proven system that helps
you stay organised, take consistent action, and build momentum
every single day.

If you‚Äôre tired of starting over, feeling stuck, or struggling to
stay on top of your goals, LifeOS is your answer.

Subject: New job for you?
Body Text:
Wow‚Ä¶

¬†

According to a new survey, as much as 50% of Americans want to completely change their career in 2024.

¬†

That‚Äôs over 80 MILLION people who want to quit their frustrating, stressful old job‚Ä¶

¬†

And discover something that gives them more fulfillment, more income, more free time.

¬†

Are you one of them, Candace?

¬†

Because if so‚Ä¶

¬†

I have 3 questions that could tell you if a career in COACHING is just the new career change you need this year.

¬†

Ready?

¬†

* Are you a keen listener, who loves working with people and genuinely wants to serve others?
* Have you always looked up to coaches, leaders, thinkers and other people who inspire through their wisdom?
* Are you keen to learn and invest in your growth this year and beyond?
If you answered YES to all 3 of those questions.

¬†

Congratulations!

¬†

I want to invite you to be mentored by me and my team.

¬†

We‚Äôll take you step-by-step through everything you need to know to become a certified coach.

¬†

(Even if you‚Äôve never coached before).

¬†

So in JUST 5 months time‚Ä¶

¬†

You could begin to shift away from your tiresome 9 - 5‚Ä¶

¬†

And start a rewarding new career as a professional, certified coach.

¬†

With a new potential source of income from helping others achieve their goals for their life, career, and relationships‚Ä¶

¬†

While you work as many hours as you want, with clients you choose, and from anywhere in the world.

¬†

How does that sound to you?

¬†
¬†

Well, we get very involved in mentoring our students, so we can‚Äôt accept everyone who applies.

¬†

But I‚Äôm confident you could be a great fit.

¬†

That‚Äôs why I want to offer you 1 of the final places in the next cohort of my coaching school.

¬†

Just fill in this form to apply to become a Jay Shetty certified coach ( https://call.jayshettycoaching.com/?el=day-5-email-1-funnel-booking&utm_campaign=booking-funnel&utm_campaign_name=JSCS%3A+VSL%2FPathway+Funnel&utm_content_name=D5E1+VSL+V2&utm_medium_name=email_action&utm_source_name=customer.io ).

¬†

(It‚Äôs just a few basic questions)

¬†

And if you‚Äôre successful‚Ä¶

¬†

You can start being mentored by me and my team RIGHT AWAY‚Ä¶

¬†

And be bursting with wisdom, confidence and ready to start your new career as a certified coach.

¬†

Subject: Competition Launch: Stanford RNA 3D Folding
Body Text:
Kaggle







Hi Candace Grant,

If you sat down to complete a puzzle without knowing what it should looklike, you'd have to rely on patterns and logic to piece it together.Predicting RNA's 3D structure works the same way‚Äîusing only its sequence tofigure out how it folds into the structures that define its function.

In this competition, you'll develop machine learning models to predict anRNA molecule's 3D structure from its sequence. With limited data available,the challenge is to fine-tune models that can accurately capture RNA'scomplex folding patterns.





Total Prizes:

$75,000


Entry Deadline:

May 22, 2025




Learn More



Your work could help push RNA-based medicine forward, improving treatmentsfor cancer and genetic diseases, and help biologists understand the originand future of life.

Good luck,

Walter Reade
Kaggle Data Scientist



Kaggle, Inc 1600 Amphitheatre Pkwy Mountain View, CA 94043

This email was sent to aicoaching2025@gmail.com because you indicated thatyou'd like to receive news and updates about Kaggle. If you don't want toreceive these emails in the future, please unsubscribe here. You can alsochange your preferences on your account's profile page by logging in atkaggle.com.

Subject: The Data Leader‚Äôs Guide to Crucial Conversations
Body Text:
View this post on the web at https://seattledataguy.substack.com/p/the-data-leaders-guide-to-crucial

If you‚Äôre like me, you‚Äôd rather avoid conflict. Maybe it started back in third grade when we figured out it was easier to be agreeable than ask for what we actually wanted.
The problem? Avoiding conflict and uncomfortable conversations‚Äîespecially in leadership‚Äîdoesn‚Äôt make problems disappear. In fact, it often makes them worse.
For data leaders, this is especially true. Whether it‚Äôs pushing back against a VP‚Äôs unrealistic deadline or addressing an underperforming team member, difficult conversations are part of the job. And the more we dodge them, the more we stall our own growth.
In this article, I want to explore conflict avoidance in the data world‚Äîwhy it happens, why it‚Äôs a problem, and, more importantly, how to handle crucial conversations effectively.
Let‚Äôs start with a common challenge: data experts and their tendency to avoid conflict.
Data Teams and the Conflict Avoidance Problem
If we ran a survey, I‚Äôd bet most data professionals would lean toward being conflict-avoidant. It‚Äôs a pattern I see all the time.
Just the other day, I was talking to another data leader [ https://substack.com/redirect/ba25e1e7-280c-438a-9a31-341001307ab9?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ] about this exact issue. They shared a story about having to step in and have a difficult conversation on behalf of their ICs because a stakeholder had started pushing boundaries‚Äîbordering on bullying.
I chuckled and said, ‚ÄúLet me guess. Your ICs told you it was no big deal, and they‚Äôd just do what the stakeholder asked, right?‚Äù
They nodded.
If we plotted conflict avoidance on a spectrum, with obnoxious jerks on one end and conflict-avoidant pushovers on the other, I bet most data folks would skew toward avoidance. But plenty of us are overly dogmatic‚Äîgoing on the offensive the moment we see a data axiom being broken.
Neither approach is great.
The real skill lies in striking a balance: being direct without being combative, standing firm without being inflexible.
So, let‚Äôs talk about how to do that‚Äîstarting with the art of having crucial conversions.
Why You Need To Be Able To Have Difficult Conversations
‚ÄúA person's success in life can usually be measured by the number of uncomfortable conversations he or she is willing to have.‚Äù ‚ÄïTim Ferriss
I love this quote from Tim Ferriss because it hits on an uncomfortable truth: avoiding difficult conversations won‚Äôt save you from problems‚Äîit will only make them worse.
Sure, we avoid conflict because we worry about damaging relationships or creating a quagmire of a situation. (Guess what: you might.) But if you never learn to push back, you‚Äôll find yourself at the mercy of others‚Äô decisions‚Äîoften at your own expense.
Is a client micromanaging you, but you‚Äôre afraid to push back because you don‚Äôt want to risk the project?
Is a VP pressuring you to cut corners, even though you know it‚Äôll cause bigger delays later?
Is a team member underperforming and slowing the whole project down, but no one wants to address it?
Many data professionals would just let things slide. The problem is that these issues rarely fix themselves‚Äîthey usually escalate.
Imagine this: You notice a project is going off the rails. Someone on your team who‚Äôs slightly senior to you is responsible. You hesitate to speak up because you don‚Äôt want to overstep. The project derails completely, deadlines are missed, and leadership is frustrated.
All because you avoided a difficult but necessary conversation.
That‚Äôs the conflict snowball‚Äîignoring small issues until they spiral into bigger ones.
This problem exists in every industry, but its impact varies. In tech and data, missed deadlines and bad decisions cost time and money. In industries like healthcare, avoiding crucial conversations can literally cost lives [ https://substack.com/redirect/e9f4b562-709d-4e51-a910-4dd2fc1490a5?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ].
Before diving into how to have these tough conversations effectively, let's talk about what not to do.
SeattleDataGuy‚Äôs Newsletter is a reader-supported publication. To receive new posts and support my work, consider becoming a free or paid subscriber.
Don‚Äôt Just Say No‚ÄîAnd Don‚Äôt Be the Boulder
One of the most common difficult conversations data professionals face‚Äîhundreds of times in their careers‚Äîis when they need to say no or redirect a decision.
Take this classic example:
‚ÄúWe should get rid of data engineers [ https://substack.com/redirect/ba8a5ca7-11f0-4d40-833a-d1a62cf940fd?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ] and let analysts and SMEs have direct access‚Äîit‚Äôll be faster.‚Äù
Sure, there‚Äôs a shred of truth to that. Modern tools make data more accessible than ever. But realistically? Most of that work would still end up in Excel, which is a whole different topic.
Going back to the original premise, as a data leader, your first instinct might be to say, ‚ÄúNo, that‚Äôs a bad idea,‚Äù and you‚Äôd be right. But if the person proposing this‚Äîespecially a senior leader‚Äîhas already convinced themselves or others it‚Äôs a great idea, a flat-out no won‚Äôt cut it.
In fact, you‚Äôll be viewed as an obstacle.
You can‚Äôt just be the boulder that blocks progress. 
Instead, you need to provide a path around the boulder.
This isn‚Äôt about caving to bad ideas. It‚Äôs about guiding the conversation so the other person can recognize the pitfalls themselves‚Äîwithout feeling like you‚Äôre shutting them down.
Because here‚Äôs the thing: even at the highest levels, leaders have plenty of stressors. Sometimes, we forget that the people above us also have people above them. What seems like a major issue to you might not even register for them in the bigger picture.
What does register? The feeling that someone is undermining them. That‚Äôs why trust is key.
Taha Hussain   article [ https://substack.com/@tahahussain ] on surviving toxic workplaces covers this in the context of building trust. It‚Äôs a solid read worth checking out.
Some Tactical Mindsets And Frameworks
There are plenty of methods for handling difficult conversations, but one I often hear people say to avoid is the sandwich method‚Äîwhere you cushion criticism between two positives.
Why? Because once you're in a leadership role, people see right through it. It comes off as formulaic, and worse, it dilutes the clarity of your message. So, just cut it out.
Instead, I really enjoyed the framework Celina Wong [ https://substack.com/redirect/518dcbe0-828b-4778-b8d5-72eabe0006a5?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ] shared during one of our recent chats on the TFA [ https://substack.com/redirect/f741a4a8-d31f-4ea4-9e77-30ef983581ab?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ]. It‚Äôs simple, direct, and effective:
Find Common Ground: Start by aligning on shared priorities. 
"We both know that accurate and reliable data reporting is critical to our decision-making and overall business strategy."
Call Out the Problem: Clearly state the issue and why it matters. 
"That said, I've seen some discrepancies in our recent reports that could undermine their credibility. The errors, though small, are creating confusion and could lead to misguided decisions."
Provide a Solution: Offer a constructive path forward.  "I recommend we implement a peer review process before finalizing any reports. This extra step should help us catch errors and ensure our data is robust and trustworthy."
Radical Candor
Maybe it‚Äôs just required reading for Facebook, but it‚Äôs hard to talk about difficult conversations without referencing Radical Candor [ https://substack.com/redirect/6ca91369-15f7-4397-8371-cb249d735c78?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ]. After all, if you look at the chart above where I have conflict-avoidant vs. aggressive jerks, the only thing missing is the Care Personally axis.
But unlike a strict framework, Radical Candor is more of a mindset test.
Think about your last few difficult interactions. Where did you fall?
Did you care deeply but hesitate to state your opinion or challenge directly because you didn‚Äôt want to upset anyone? 
Did you wrap your point in so much fluff that your real message got lost?
Here‚Äôs an example of what that looks like in practice:
Senior Data Leader:
"I went over the updated set of goals for 2025 Q2. The direction is promising, though there‚Äôs a minor disconnect between the proposed milestones and our current resource levels. I believe our team can probably figure it out."
VP:
"Can you be more specific about the disconnect?"
Senior Data Leader:
"It‚Äôs just that the staffing levels might not perfectly match the timeline. I don‚Äôt see it as an immediate issue, but it‚Äôs worth keeping in mind."
This response is vague, hedged, and ultimately unhelpful. A better approach? Just say what you mean:
‚ÄúI don‚Äôt believe our current staff level will be able to hit these milestones because of X, Y, and Z. To stay on track, we should either hire a contractor or extend the timeline by two months‚Äîeither approach will help us meet the goal.‚Äù
That‚Äôs being direct while still showing you care about the outcome.
Final Thoughts
Difficult conversations aren‚Äôt always predictable. Sometimes, they blindside you, and other times, you‚Äôre the one who needs to initiate them. Either way, learning how to navigate them is a skill that will serve you well‚Äîboth as a data leader and in life.
It‚Äôs a fine balance between being direct and being a jerk. It takes practice, but the more you lean into uncomfortable conversations, the more you can refine your approach. And the more you refine your approach, the more you realize that things tend to work out on the other side.
So don‚Äôt shy away. Start practicing. The more you engage in crucial conversations, the better you‚Äôll get at them.
As always, thanks for reading.

You‚Äôll find plenty of free resources you can access to expedite your journey as a technical consultant as well as be able to talk to other consultants about questions you may have!
Articles Worth Reading
There are thousands of new articles posted daily all over the web! I have spent a lot of time sifting through some of these articles as well as TechCrunch and companies tech blog and wanted to share some of my favorites!
Introducing Netflix‚Äôs Key-Value Data Abstraction Layer
At Netflix our ability to deliver seamless, high-quality, streaming experiences to millions of users hinges on robust, global backend infrastructure. Central to this infrastructure is our use of multiple online distributed databases such as Apache Cassandra [ https://substack.com/redirect/e78602cd-090a-46a3-ba60-5b579bca689b?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ], a NoSQL database known for its high availability and scalability. Cassandra serves as the backbone for a diverse array of use cases within Netflix, ranging from user sign-ups and storing viewing histories to supporting real-time analytics and live streaming.
Read More Here [ https://substack.com/redirect/805371e1-c066-491c-b287-500ed9f9cb01?j=eyJ1IjoiNTFkc2s3In0.TG_s5GaRal_EYLFDF-UYKHL5eEiDcX8TdL6-5nynlYA ]

Subject: Raise Capital Faster: 3 Days, 250+ Investors, One Summit [room block expiring]
Body Text:
Family Office Super Summit: This ultra-wealthy investor event features 125 speakers on stage over 3 days and 650 participants in Fort Lauderdale December 9th-11th.Hi Candace,

When was the last time you stood in a room where 250+ family offices and ultra-wealthy investors were actively looking to back companies, invest in funds, or partner on joint ventures? Subject: [PythonAnywhere] How about creating a web app?
Body Text:
Hi there,

Thanks again for signing up for your account "jabjabcarnival" on PythonAnywhere!

We noticed you haven't created a website yet.  Give it a try!  It's really easy:
with your free account, you can host one website at
jabjabcarnival.pythonanywhere.com

Once your website is up and running, if things take off and you get tons of
visitors, it's easy to upgrade to a plan that can handle it -- we host sites
ranging all the way from homepages with a few visitors a day, to live sites
with hundreds of thousands.

Here's where to go to get started:

    https://www.pythonanywhere.com/user/jabjabcarnival/webapps/

...and here are some useful resources:

* A simple guide to creating your first website on PythonAnywhere:

    https://www.pythonanywhere.com/task_helpers/start/3-web_app/

* A guide for taking a website you've built on your home computer and
  putting it online on PythonAnywhere:

     https://www.pythonanywhere.com/task_helpers/start/4-deploy-local-web-app

* Using a virtualenv so that you can use exactly the version of Django
  or Flask or any other framework that you want to use:

     https://help.pythonanywhere.com/pages/Virtualenvs

* A beginner's tutorial for building a database-backed website using
  Flask:

     https://blog.pythonanywhere.com/121/

* Some general hints and tips on using Flask:

     https://help.pythonanywhere.com/pages/Flask


Give it a go!  And if you have any comments or questions, just get in touch with
us at PythonAnywhere Support <liveusercare@pythonanywhere.com> -- we're here to help.



Piotr + the PythonAnywhere team.


Piotr Kaznowski
Developer

PS These emails are designed to help you get the most out of PythonAnywhere,
including pointing you towards some cool features that are a bit hidden.
We'll only send out one a week, but if you want to unsubscribe from them,
you can do so here:
https://www.pythonanywhere.com/unsubscribe_from/engagement_emails/?email=aicoaching2025%40gmail.com&n=e640d807aa143f1e677409405986fb27

--
PythonAnywhere: Develop and host Python from your browser
https://www.pythonanywhere.com/

Subject: What are your ‚Äú3 P‚Äôs‚Äù?
Body Text:
There‚Äôs always a bigger client to chase‚Ä¶

¬†

Another goal you haven‚Äôt reached‚Ä¶

¬†

And no matter how successful other people would say you are, you always feel like there‚Äôs more you could have done.

¬†

Sound familiar, Candace?

¬†

If it does, you could be experiencing the ‚Äúarrival fallacy‚Äù.

¬†

A lot of people do.

¬†

Because today our society is so focused on tangible goals, that we lose sight of what really fulfills us in life.

¬†

Especially these ‚Äú3 P‚Äôs‚Äù:

¬†

1. Purpose - what do you feel called to help with or do? Who do you daydream about being or being more like?

2. Passion - if money was no object, how would you spend your time? So often we get lost chasing money and lose sight of our ‚Äúwhy‚Äù. We settle for emptiness to tick the money box and end up feeling lost.

¬†

3. Process - what can you do today that you couldn‚Äôt do before you started - and how can you help others now that you couldn‚Äôt do before?

¬†

Once you have alignment with these ‚Äú3 P‚Äôs‚Äù, your success won‚Äôt feel like the end of the road.¬†

¬†

But a signpost on a bigger journey.

¬†

So as a simple self-reflection exercise‚Ä¶

¬†

I‚Äôd encourage you to take out your phone or a piece of paper now and write down your ‚Äú3 P‚Äôs‚Äù.

¬†

Then assess how closely you are living and working in alignment with those.¬†

¬†

Later today I‚Äôll tell you why that‚Äôs so important - and what next steps you need to take.

So make sure you practice this self-reflection now‚Ä¶

And reply to this email if you‚Äôd like to share your ‚Äú3 P‚Äôs‚Äù - I‚Äôd love to hear more about you.

-Jay Shetty, Jay Shetty Certification School ( https://call.jayshettycoaching.com/?el=booking-email-enroll-163-1&utm_campaign=booking-be&utm_campaign_name=JSCS%3A+Prospects+Week+163-2&utm_content_name=What+are+your+%E2%80%9C3+P%E2%80%99s%E2%80%9D%3F&utm_medium_name=email_action&utm_source_name=customer.io )Enroll Now Before The Price Increase

my team will call you to tell you more:

Subject: 4 ways to build trust as a ghostwriter
Body Text:
***********************
Hey there, Ghostwriter!
***********************

Welcome to the Premium Ghostwriting Blueprint‚Äîwhere every week we
help you knock down high-ticket clients as a Premium Ghostwriter
(even if you‚Äôre a full-time Freelance Writer, or you have a 9-5).

As a reminder: If you'd like to accelerate your trajectory as a
Premium Ghostwriter, don't forget to subscribe to my YouTube
channel (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/v8u2pwwv82bmu9dmedcghvlpo8llh9/6qhehou700o820u9/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vQG5pY29sYXNjb2xlNzc=
). Every week, I share new videos breaking down the skills,
frameworks, & strategies you need to build a profitable writing
business with 26,000+ others.

Today we want to help you start building trust as a ghostwriter
(and leverage it into more business than you know what to do
with).
-----------------------------------------------------------------

But before we get into it, here‚Äôs the 1 thing you need to know:

Being a highly-paid ghostwriter doesn‚Äôt require as much
credibility as you think.

In fact, your job, as a ghostwriter (and Solopreneur of any kind)
is to give people the language you want them to use when
introducing you. Because guess what? The more specific you are
about the language you want people to use, the easier it will be
for them to copy/paste that language and repeat it over and over
again.

When this happens, the game is won.

And your client will assume your are the right person for the
job‚Ä¶ BECAUSE THEY ARE USING YOUR LANGUAGE.

So, let‚Äôs walk through exactly how to do that for yourself.

**************************************
4 Ways To Build Trust As A Ghostwriter
**************************************

There are 4 ways to build trust as a ghostwriter‚Äîand to be
honest, none of them have anything to do with ‚Äúachieving‚Äù
something noteworthy.

#1: Your Bio

‚Äã
Here‚Äôs what happens when you get introduced to someone, or they
stumble across your profile online.

* They look you up.
* They click on your social profile.
* And the very first thing they do is read your bio.

And if your bio says, ‚ÄúI ghostwrite Educational Email Courses for
health and wellness brands ,‚Äù guess what they assume about you?
THAT YOU GHOSTWRITE EDUCATIONAL EMAIL COURSES FOR HEALTH AND
WELLNESS BRANDS!!!!!!

All you have to do is say what you do, right there, right away in
your bio, and people will internalize that as ‚Äúthe truth.‚Äù

Easy!

#2: Your Content
----------------

‚Äã
The second way you build trust as a ghostwriter is with the
content you publish.

When someone looks you up, or stumbles across one of your social
profiles, what‚Äôs the second thing they do after reading your bio?

* They scroll for a few seconds.
* They see what kind of content you are posting.
* And they decide if what you write about is for them or not.

In those few seconds, if they see you posting content like: ‚ÄúStar
Wars is the best movie of all time. Change my mind,‚Äù they are
probably not going to see you as ‚Äúan expert‚Äù in health and
wellness!

But if your bio says, ‚ÄúI ghostwrite Educational Email Courses for
health and wellness brands,‚Äù and then they scroll and almost all
your content is about how to ghostwrite Educational Email
Courses, the benefits of Educational Email Courses, the mistakes
people make when creating Educational Email Courses, etc., guess
what? THEY ARE GOING TO THINK YOU ARE AN ALL-STAR AT EDUCATIONAL
EMAIL COURSES!!!!!

#3: Your Own Asset
------------------

‚Äã
What‚Äôs the next thing someone does after reading your bio and
scrolling through your content?

* They click on your website.
* They scan through any resources.
* And they look for proof that backs up your bio, your content,
etc.

So, if you say you ghostwrite Educational Email Courses, wouldn‚Äôt
it make sense for you to have an Educational Email Course for
yourself? IT SURE WOULD!!!! And when they see you have your own
Educational Email Course pinned to the top of your profile, what
are they going to think? THAT YOU SURE DO KNOW A LOT ABOUT
EDUCATIONAL EMAIL COURSES!!!!!

#4: How You Pitch Your Service
------------------------------

Quick recap.

* Someone has read your bio.
* They‚Äôve scrolled through some of your content.
* Maybe they even typed in their email address and signed up for
a newsletter.

By the time they reach out to you, or you reach out to them,
they‚Äôre under the assumption that you are the go-to expert when
it comes to Educational Email Courses for this specific industry
(Health and Wellness brands, for example).

And if you get on the phone with them, and you can clearly
articulate the benefits of Educational Email Courses, the
mistakes founders and business owners make when writing
Educational Email Courses, and the outcomes they can unlock, then
guess what? YOU‚ÄôVE GOT YOURSELF A CLIENT‚ÄîBECAUSE YOU SURE DO SEEM
TO KNOW A LOT ABOUT EDUCATIONAL EMAIL COURSES!!!!!

Now, does this have anything to do with being an Internet
celebrity? Nope.

Does it have to do with you having a huge audience? Nope.

Does it have to do with you having a giant email list? Nope.

Literally the ONLY thing a prospective client wants to know is
whether or not you ‚Äúknow your stuff.‚Äù And the way they evaluate
whether or not you ‚Äúknow your stuff‚Äù comes down to these 4
credibility checks:

* Does your bio say so?
* Does your content show so?
* Does your own asset prove so?
* Does your conversation guarantee so?

If you pass the above 4 checks, you are going to have more
business than you know what to do with.

That‚Äôs it!

Dickie & Cole

Co-Founders, Premium Ghostwriting Academy

PS‚Ä¶ Want more help growing your freelance writing business
(without completely burning out)?

Then make sure to subscribe to my YouTube Channel (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/v8u2pwwv82bmu9dmedcghvlpo8llh9/48h4gle6c7urkkgd2kfq/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vQG5pY29sYXNjb2xlNzc=
)!

Every week I share a new video breaking down the different
frameworks we teach inside PGA to help our students become
Premium Ghostwriters.

‚ÄãIn my latest video (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/v8u2pwwv82bmu9dmedcghvlpo8llh9/kkhmh2ulvz8rrdtk/aHR0cHM6Ly95b3V0dS5iZS9WbHVfR3JrTEtfcz9zaT10RVlWQ19RMHJjU1ZUZ1JJ
), I explain the 7 steps I took to achieve financial freedom as a
writer:

(
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/v8u2pwwv82bmu9dmedcghvlpo8llh9/kkhmh2ulvz8rrdtk/aHR0cHM6Ly95b3V0dS5iZS9WbHVfR3JrTEtfcz9zaT10RVlWQ19RMHJjU1ZUZ1JJ
)‚Äã

‚Äã

1. No longer interested in hearing about Premium Ghostwriting
Academy? No worries. Click here to unsubscribe (
https://click.convertkit-mail.com/v8u2pwwv82bmu9dmedcghvlpo8llh9/reh6eo7wc9u0vz929qt6/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cuc2hpcDMwZm9yMzAuY29tL3ByZWZlcmVuY2VzLWNvbmZpcm1lZA==
)from all Premium Ghostwriting Academy emails.

2. No longer want to receive Ship 30 emails? You can click here
to unsubscribe (
https://unsubscribe.convertkit-mail.com/v8u2pwwv82bmu9dmedcghvlpo8llh9
) from all future updates from us. (By unsubscribing, you will
also stop receiving updates about products you might have bought
from us!)

Subject: üò¨ Why You Still Haven‚Äôt Started (Yet)
Body Text:
Hey friends,

Hope you've had a good start to the week üôè

Quick reminder before we start, I‚Äôll be hosting a quarterly
workshop this Saturday (28th June) at 1400 BST where we‚Äôll be
reflecting on the last 90 days and setting our intentions for the
quarter ahead. It's always a fun event so come along if you can,
you can register here (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/5qu5ex8krot7hn9kkdoi6h9m8n444tnh30xrv/wnh2h6uqv2lg6lfl/aHR0cHM6Ly9hbGlhYmRhYWwuY29tL3N1bW1lci1yZXNldC0yMDI1Lz91dG1fY2FtcGFpZ249bGVhbmxlYXJuaW5nXzIzJnV0bV9tZWRpdW09ZW1haWwmdXRtX3NvdXJjZT1wcm9kdWN0aXZlbm90ZXM=
).

Anyway, today I wanted to share a diagram and a concept from one
of my recent videos.

It‚Äôs taken from Pat Flynn‚Äôs new book Lean Learning (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/5qu5ex8krot7hn9kkdoi6h9m8n444tnh30xrv/reh8h9umvloxzpf6/aHR0cHM6Ly9nZW5pLnVzL2xlYW5sZWFybmluZw==
) (great read btw) and I wanted to reshare it because 1) I wish
more people see this diagram and 2) even if you have seen it, I
feel like it‚Äôs one of those things that bears repeating
regularly.

So whenever I‚Äôm at events or giving talks, I hear a lot of people
say things like, ‚ÄúI want to start a business‚Äù or ‚ÄúI want to start
a YouTube channel‚Äù, but they‚Äôre stuck in this endless cycle of
research. They keep trying to learn more concepts, watch more
videos and consume more content before actually getting started.

And I‚Äôve seen the same pattern play out with people when it comes
to improving their personal productivity too - people consume
endless videos looking for the perfect system or the ideal Notion
set-up without actually taking action.

The thing is, researching and learning feels super productive.
When you watch a YouTube video or read a business book or
whatever, you get this sense of making progress towards doing the
thing. And consuming all this content also makes us feel like
we‚Äôre reducing our chance of failure by eliminating the unknown
factors that might trip us up along the way.

(And don‚Äôt get me wrong, I‚Äôm not immune to this either. I still
have to catch myself regularly too, especially when I'm starting
something new üòÖ)

But all this consumption doesn‚Äôt meaningfully move the needle on
making real progress towards your goals.

Yes, there‚Äôs a minimum viable amount of information you need to
get started.

But what a lot of people don‚Äôt realise is that it‚Äôs actually a
very small amount of information - and way smaller than most
people think, as you can see here in my recreation of Pat‚Äôs
diagram:

‚Äã
Once you get started, once you‚Äôre taking step after step, and
building momentum, that‚Äôs when the research and learning becomes
useful, because it‚Äôs grounded in action.

The analogy I shared in this video was: to imagine learning how
to ride a bike.

You probably know how to ride one right now, but if you think
about it, there‚Äôs a whole bunch of information out there about
bikes that you could theoretically learn - about the gears,
suspension, clip-on-shoe things, foamy bum pads, shorts,
aerodynamics‚Ä¶

But back when you didn‚Äôt yet know how to ride, it would have been
completely pointless to consume all the same information that a
Tour de France or Olympic cyclist needs to compete.

Instead, all you needed to do was sit on the bike, maybe use the
training wheels, and just start pedalling. Yep, you may have
fallen off a couple of times, but taking action was the only
thing necessary to learn the skill of riding a bike. And only
once you knew how to ride a bike would it be worth looking into
all the other stuff (if riding bikes is your calling).

So if you‚Äôve ever caught yourself thinking: ‚ÄúOh if I just consume
more info, then I‚Äôll magically feel ready‚Äù remember that
realistically, you‚Äôre never going to feel ready. Any new thing
you try to do is always going to involve a little leap of faith.

I hope this was a useful reminder üëå

Have a great week and hope to see some of you at the Summer Reset
(

Subject: Needed: Corporate Giving Grant Analyst ‚ÄìPharma (Hybrid - Lawrenceville, NJ)
Body Text:
Hello,

My name isRupalim and I am aSenior Recruiter at Stage 4 Solutions, a consulting
and interim staffing company. We strive to find the perfect match between our
team members' career objectives and our clients' needs. We have a job opening
that may be a great role for you or someone you know. Please review the
following job description and let me know if you are interested.

Corporate Giving Grant Analyst ‚ÄìPharma (Hybrid - Lawrenceville, NJ)

We are seeking a Corporate Giving Grant Analyst ‚ÄìPharma for a global
pharmaceutical client. You will be responsible for managing the administration
of approved funding requests. This role ensures that funding applications are
complete, accurate according to company and department SOPS and legal and
compliance standards. The Analyst works closely with internal and external
stakeholders to ensure the successful completion of the administrative
requirements of funding requests.

This is a 40-hour per-week, 6-month contract (extensions possible), 50% onsite
role in Lawrenceville, NJ. Hours: Monday ‚Äì Friday 8am-5pm.

This is a W2 role as a Stage 4 Solutions employee. Health benefits and a 401K
are offered.



Responsibilities:

 * Communication with potential grant recipients/organizations including
   generation and sending out Corporate Giving Agreement (ie. contract),
   obtaining all required signatures (organization and company), requesting
   required documentation (ie. new vendor creation and/or update)
   
   

 * Creating Purchase Orders; reviewing and approving invoices and
   troubleshooting payment issues
   
   

 * Interacting with internal and/or external stakeholders to convey information
   related to Corporate Giving processes
   
   

 * Keeping track and taking appropriate action on current, active funding
   requests
   
   

 * Responsible for accuracy, completeness and quality of data entered and
   uploaded into CG system (Cybergrants)
   
   

Requirements:

 * Fluent (expert level in speaking, reading and writing) in one or more of the
   following languages ‚Äì French, German, Portuguese, Spanish, Dutch, Japanese,
   Chinese, Korean and Turkish, as well as English.
   
   

 * Ability to articulate corporate giving and grants process to internal
   stakeholders and external customers in a professional manner.
   
   

 * Assists in the identification of and recommendation for process improvement,
   procedures, information, and opportunities to improve departmental functions
   and increase service value to the enterprise. Strong MS Office experience
   
   

 * Experience working with diverse stakeholders and community organizations.
   
   

 * Experience with Financial systems (such as SAP, Ariba, etc) is a plus.
   
   

 * Experience with CyberGrants is a plus
   
   

 * Experience in the healthcare, pharmaceutical, or nonprofit sector is
   preferred
   
   
   

Please submit your resume to our network at 
https://www.stage4solutions.com/careers/
[https://www.stage4solutions.com/careers/] (please apply to the Corporate Giving
Grant Analyst ‚ÄìPharma (Hybrid - Lawrenceville, NJ) role).

Please feel free to forward this project opening to others who may be
interested.

Stage 4 Solutions is an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and
are committed to providing employees with an inclusive environment that is free
of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions are based on the job
requirements and candidates‚Äô qualifications, without regard to race, color,
religion/belief, national origin, gender identity, age, disability, marital
status, genetic information, or other applicable legally protected
characteristics.



Compensation: $35/hr. - $37.98/hr.

#LI-SW1





Thanks for your consideration.



Thanks,

Rupalim



*****************************************************

Rupalim Dutta

Sr Recruiter

Stage 4 Solutions, Inc.

Consulting & Interim Staffing

rupalim.dutta@stage4solutions.com [mailtorupalim.dutta@stage4solutions.com]

408-409-7285 (cell)
